I usually get the Kim chee fried rice, seafood pancake, potstickers, and tofu kimchee soup.  This place is a great place to come after a night of drinking or to get together with friends.  It's located inside a garage that they turn into a restaurant.  Reminds me of a place called Little Seoul back home in Hawaii.  They also have spam stew too!
author: Rissa K.

description:
Toyose was my introduction to Korean food. Living in the Bay Area I eat Asian food more times a week than I'd like to admit but it's usually Japanese, Chinese, Thai or Burmese. 

My friends and I ordered the chicken wings, seafood pancake and beef stew - all of it was exceptional.

The wings although not very spicy were the best fried chicken wings I have EVER had. 

The pancake and the vinegar type sauce that came with it were full of flavor and phenomenal. 

The beef stew is loaded with things other than beef such as sliced fish ball, squid, shrimp, mushrooms and glass noodles. The broth again had huge flavor and the beef was insanely tender.

Toyose also kills it with its onlyinsanfrancisco type vibe. 

It's one of those restaurants that as you walk out you think "Damn - I can't wait to come back!"

NOTE*** this place gets packed even on weekdays. Get their early - put in your name and wander across the street for a pint and come back. Be prepared to wait 30 minutes or longer for a table and don't stress about it.
author: Alex W.

description: Very cozy and cute place to grab a late night bite, love the atmosphere. Kimchi fried rice is yums and the ddeokbokki are delicious! I usually don't like chicken katsu but we ordered it and it was also really good :) Wait can be a bit long so try to go outside of rush hours.
author: Jennifer N.

description:
When I heard this restaurant was in a garage, I imagined a straight up garage w/ hella tables... but it's a legit restaurant inside! Hella threw me off. lol

the food: 

Chicken Karrage? ... was okay. It's good with the pickled daikon they give you with it. Nothing to rage about. 

Their "omelettes" aren't really egg omelettes like you would expect. Forgot which one we had, but it was pretty bomb! There was ramen, spam, hotdogs, kimchi, rice cake, tofu, & some meat in it.. in your typical korean tofu soup..but it was really delicious.

We also got their seafood pancake. Can't go wrong with this! A bit small, but it was good. 

Kimchi fried rice was also pretty good. 

the service:

it was alrightt... there is a little buzzer if you need something.
author: Elise T.

description: First things first, order a pitcher of Hite. You won't be disappointed. Then get sake and begin to drink while you order and scan the menu. Items are family sized and made to share so take that into account. Be aware that whenever you need any food or drinks there is a buzzer on the wall when ready just press it. We got shrimp fried rice, bulgolgi and calamari, and the wings to finalize or order. Could barely finish those three items with three hungry and drunk college kids so this place is priced well and easy on the wallet. Enjoy different dishes and don't be afraid to trying anything you see on here that's new
author: John R.

description: The food is great here, the Kimchi fried rice+ seafood pancake are a must! the soups are great as well. The only thing with this place is the long wait but its worth it. Don't go there if you are super hungry cause the wait will be torturous. Oh and yes this was a garage which they turned into a restaurant.
author: Yas J.

description: 3.5 stars - I think the place is good. I came here twice and I always get the beef stew and fried chicken, their seafood pancake is pretty good too. But I personally don't think I am paying the price for what it's worth. There's a lot of korean restaurants in the Bay Area and this is not one of those you must try places. You can get the same if not tastier food somewhere else with lower prices.
author: Kelly Z.

description:
I finally ventured out to the edge of the earth to eat at the enigma that is Toyose, and wow it was so worth it!

Yes, it is in a garage. And yes ,this did confuse me. But once you step inside, it doesn't look like a garage at all! It just looks like a typical Korean bar. I love it! 

The food was pretty darn good. I really enjoyed the beef kimchi fried rice (order this, seriously. I think it has crack in it or something) and seafood pancake. The fried chicken was just okay, in my opinion. I've had better Korean fried chicken. Jap chae wasn't bad, and the french fries were, well, french fries. XD

But the SOJU. Oh my goodness that stuff is delicious, and expensive! Our dinner bill was very very expensive thanks to these little bottles of fruity, boozy happiness. My favorite flavor? Probably kiwi. But honestly, you can't go wrong with anything.
author: Jade R.

description:
1st Trip: This place was recommended to me by a friend who said that the soju was AMAZING and that it didn't feel like you were in a garage. Yeah, that's all it takes to get me there. Needless to say, it felt like you were in a whole new world when you step through those garage-looking doors. Although, I'm not well-versed in Korean foods, I reached out to some trusty sources (aka the internet) to satisfy my order. 

TIP #1: If Busy, ASK to be put on the waitlist. 

Arrived: 8pm | Wait time: Over an Hour

This is what I got:
Pineapple Soju ($11) | Easy-to-Get-Drunk Warning
Calamari & Beef Bulgolgi ($14) | Mix with Rice and enjoy!
Spicy Chicken Wings ($13) | Not Actually Spicy, but Sooo Juicy *drools*
_____________________________________________________
2nd Trip: This time around, I wanted to find a place in the outer sunset area that could accomodate my seemingly impossible request - open past 10pm. Alas, I came to Toyose, since they're OPEN UNTIL 2AM and they're tasty. Perfect!

TIP #2: The later you get there, the more seats available.

Arrived: 10:30ish | Wait time: No Wait

This is what I got:
1 Peach Soju ($11) | Easy-to-Get-Drunk Warning
Chicken Katsu ($10) | Take a date, split it to satisfaction

TIP #3: Push the button next to your table for service. simple.
author: Brian T.

description:
Been coming here for years, the quality of the food has stayed consistently great throughout my long dining experience with them. Get the fried chicken! Kimchi fried rice, and gizzard. The kiwi soju is good too if you can handle straight soju like my homie Alan!

Service is fast and friendly as well, Thanks June!
author: Alfred W.

description: I love coming here with friends when we want to have  a chill soju night. The food is pretty good and I almost always order the kimchi fried rice. The only bad this is it can get kind of busy and the wait can easily go up to 30-an hour wait. They don't let you do reservations and they can't tell you how long a wait it might be. The service is here use to suck but it's gotten a lot better and I think that's mainly because they changed to two new girl waitresses and two new guy waiters who are more attentive versus the old waitresses who gave a lot of attitude and stuck up to the customers. Overall, love this Korean food spot!
author: Kaman C.

description:
Growing up, I used to walk by Toyose on my way to church and wondered what this place was. Since there wasn't any sign on the place (at least any signs in english) I grew up calling this place chicken garage (since there's a picture of a chicken head on the garage). Now that I'm old and know that it's a restaurant. I still call it chicken garage. 

Anyways, this place is happening at night. Don't be fooled by the looks on the outside. Inside is tables after tables of full of people. The best part of Toyose is the fact that they have a service bell. YES! no more waiting for the waitress to walk by when you need help. All you gotta do is ring the bell and the sign behind the cash register lights up with your table number and the waitress comes to bring you whatever you need. 

As for the food, it's a little bit on the pricey side but it's really good. I highly recommend the chicken wings - OMG it's a big order but it is FREAKING GOOD! And a visit to Toyose would not be complete without at least an order of soju cocktail. My favorite are mango and yogurt.. each bottle has probably about 10 shots in each. So order accordingly :)
author: Jess s.

description:
(+): seafood pancake was crispy and chewy. The wings were perfect. fishcake soup with ramen was sweet and a little umami (whatever the hell that means). tables also have waiter call buttons. 

(-): kimchi fried rice was overhyped to me. it was good, but, like, chill out, yelp. i guess i don't eat beef and i'm not a huge kimchi fan so that's where that comes from. also, it's a little pricey.

(0): go when it's not crowded, but it is worth the wait. you'll be glad that this cute little outer sunset house-turned Korean restaurant is not another overpriced rental on Craigslist.
author: Siva M.

description:
I ordered their spicy noodles with calimari (not sure the exact title of it) and it was really good. The level of spicy is on the spicier side which is great! It actually got me to start sweating which I have not done in a while when eating spicy food.

Our table also ordered their yogurt flavored soju which was great. They don't skimp out on the soju so it was still very strong in the drink. The flavor was great tasting and deceiving as I could down that whole bottle without realizing there's much alcohol in it.

One thing I wish was that the prices would be cheaper for everything overall. It is more on the pricey side when it comes to korean food but still good overall.
author: Spencer E.

description: This place looks like a garage from the outside but you wouldn't be able to tell from the inside. Both the beef kimchi friend rice and seafood pancake were excellent choices. They had great flavor and the portions were decent. I only wished that you can specify the spiciness level of the kimichi fried rice; it is spicy. The menu has a variety of dishes and snack items. Since they open late it would be a good place to go if you want dinner or a late night meal. The place is popular so expect a wait. There is a board to sign in your name to the waitlist.
author: Ali F.

description:
Came here for a late night snack/drinks with a few friends.

It was my first time here so I was a little shocked that this restaurant was literally in a garage. The outside of the restaurant door is a garage that opens with two side doors. It was quite a surprise and shock to walk into the restaurant.

The atmosphere in the restaurant was very dim and dark. It was a little stuffy and smelly too. I walked into the very narrow restaurant and got seated all the way at the end.

I came here with a few Korean friends so they did all the ordering as I say there in shock about how the restaurant was in a garage.

Soon enough the food and drinks came. We got yogurt, strawberry and aloe Soju. My favorite was the yogurt because it did not taste very strong but little did I know it was. The aloe one tasted alright, a little strong and there were also bits of aloe in it as well. The strawberry one was decent and I have tried it at other places, it's all the same.

The kimchi fried rice was decent, I liked how it was not too spicy. There was some interesting stuff I noticed on the menu as well.. Fish liver? Ahaha I didn't try it but maybe next time.

My friends rang the button on the side to get some service and I found that pretty cool! Didnt know there was a service button. They failed to come to our table an went to another table instead because they did not know who rang it..we rang it again and it was fine this time.

Aside from all this, the place was pretty crowded for a Wednesday night! It was completely packed! I will probably be coming back soon.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
I love their kimchee chigae. Their spicy cold noodles are also damn good. And who doesn't love yogurt soju?

But full of MSG... 

Really? 

They'll deny it. But at the same time, their soups, including the kimchee chigae, "Wouldn't taste the same without it." (quote from the waitress who admitted this to me after I told her I was allergic to try and get them to leave it out.)

Damn... enjoy!
author: Maria A.

description:
Strong cocktail soju and good food. I am all for it! 

One of the better korean bars I have been to. It is kinda of small. Well....It is literally a fricking garage under someones house. I was so confused where the door was because it is all blended in.

Order the spicy fried chicken ( DUH! who can say no to fried chicken) and kimchi fried rice. Their seafood pancake is a must! It is so good! It is crispy and filled with seafood. The sweet and spicy sauce pair with it. SO BOMB!

Cocktail soju: definitely order the kiwi, peach, aloe, and yogurt. The yogurt one may seem plain but they make it really well! BOO to the aloe soju always getting clogged though!

Definitely will be coming back here. My only problem is that it is so fricking far away!
author: Dilys Y.

description:
With 1000+ reviews and still a 4 star rating, you know this place must be legit. With that in mind, we got there early (6ish) as we read that long wait times are expected. Now that is an understatement. This converted garage to restaurant is cozy, but more than sufficient.

We wanted to try so many items, but the waitress said that we already had more than enough. Portions are pretty good and naturally we ended up bringing most home. Kimchi beef fried rice is a must order. I've had kimchi fried rice at several places in Hawaii, but this one was a hand down winner. Next was beef bulgogi - tasty, especially with squid, but not something to drive over for. Jap Chae - always a must have for us, we can never get enough. This one was great, without the overload of oil. Fried chicken - yes, chicken as in WHOLE chicken. Nicely deep fried, yet moist inside. This one is head to head with KFC. Seafood pancake - another nice selection, this is great with the "spicy" dipping sauce. The sauce looks spicy but is actually pretty mild. Don't get this pancake mixed up with the texture of Chinese pancake. This Korean pancake is a different batter altogether.

The waitress "call button" on the wall is a nice touch to avoid having to flag down the waitress. I dig it!

My advice is to 1. get there early, 2. go in a big group of 5+ (so you can order more dishes to try!) and 3. be ready for some great Korean food!
author: Mark M.

description: Overall we had a good dinner. Beef Kim Chee Fried Rice was delicious. Not too spicy. Japchae very good and large portion. Seafood Kim Chee pancake was good but a bit soggy. Tonkatsu and Spicy Fried Chicken Wings were over fried but ok. We would recommend this place and come again. Wait staff very good too.
author: Cheryl W.

description:
The Garage as i call it, serves awesome Korean food.  The meat is fresh and thers just a symphony of flavors and textures that provides great contrast. nothing is bland or over seasoned.  we got the spicy fried chicken wings. crispy, mildly spicy and not oily.  came with some slaw.  also had the seafood pancake, a mix of crunchy and chewy from the veggies and seafood, mostly shrimp and octopus.  Lastly we ordered bugolgi with calimari. meat was seasoned well, not too fatty. also topped with plenty of veggies. ill be tasting this dinner all night.  banchan is on the smaller side. but they were tasty at least.

The garage is a tad on the cramp side. but there is mood lighting. waitresses were courteous.  I will have to comeback again to try more.
author: Jason C.

description:
When a restaurant has a long wait and many many pictures, you know it's a hit! I have heard so many great things about this place. Is it a hole in the wall? Haha, perhaps, since it is inside a garage!! :) Now, I'm not sure if it was a garage to begin with, or did they make the exterior like a garage... either who, I dig it! When my friends (first timer) went to get a table, they were so confused as to where the entrance was. HILARIOUS! love them. But I've been here two times now, and two times were on point! I recently came here with my college buddies, and one of them is a vegetarian. Hmmm, I thought, this might be a little tricky, cause when you think of korean, its bulgogi, spicy pork, and even bibimbap has meat in it... so we were thinking all out tofu and kimchi! LOL The waiter was extremely patient and nice with us! When I asked him, do you have any vegetarian dishes, he was caught by surprise LOL but still suggested some very delicious dishes. 

We had:
Kimchi pancake (first off, this was already my favorite, and was gonna order it anyway- i'm telling you, it's a MUST!! the best kimchi pancake ever!!! it's crispy yet soft, omggggg i want one now!)

Cheese corn- haha so no one at the table knew what cheese corn is, it's actually exactly when it says, corn topped with melted mozzarella and baked.... nom nom nom, but you have to eat this when its out, or it'll get hard, but overall yummy!

Japchae or aka korean glass noodle- so flavorful even with no meat, so i can't imagine how much better it is with the meat in it :D 

Tofu Soup- it comes out piping hot served on the stone, so be careful. Soooo flavorful, a little hint of spicy, but delish, my favorite part was the tofu, big chunks of it, yum!!

Chicken Wings, omg! how could i forget you! THAT WAS SO BOMB! I can eat it everyday, beats KFC, POPEYES by miles!! so tender and crispy. Never knew korean chicken wings would be so yummy, i'm sold! 

Yogurt Soju, I had two shot glasses that night, couldn't drink too much, gotta drive after, but it was as always yummy! :) 

I'd definitely recommend this place, but i don't think you'd need my recommendation as this place is already a hit itself, i loved it and will definitely come back :)
author: Cindy C.

description:
I come here often to get my soju fix with my friends and of course to get drunk! haha.I like this place cause its so hidden. Now they have a sign that advertise it but before they had no sign and when you are coming in it looks like a "garage" hence the nickname some people give it. I had great memories with friends here.

The soju cocktails are pretty good! Taste really good and they can mess you up. 

The food here is good! I love the seafood pancake and the kimchee fried rice. Its a little expensive but if you split it with friends and everything should be alright. The service is pretty decent. They have a button to call the staff to serve you so they always respond somewhat quickly. Def a great place to hang out with friends!
author: Daniel S.

description:
I seriously thought there was no good Korean food in SF...Until I ate at Toyose - this place is incredibly yummy! Located inside a garage, the ambiance offers an underground feeling that's casual without giving off a pretentious vibe. 

We started off with the chicken wings, which were finger licking good, pretty flavorful. The chicken wings are called out on Thrillest's list here, http://www.thrillist.com/eat/san-francisco/bayview/best-sf-chicken-wings

We also got the kimchi / seafood pajun, which you can think of as an Asian pancake. The consistency and texture of the pancake was just right.

Lastly, we had the budae chigae, which was delicious and filling. Ask them to add a 2nd packet of ramen so you have a better ramen to rest of yummy ingredients (spam goodness) ratio. 

Definitely want to visit Toyose again to try their fried rice!
author: Cathy L.

description: Fun spot for late night bites or taking visitors to. Tucked inside an unassuming garage you are transported to Korean pub food. Everything was good nothing out of their world amazing but good atmosphere and service. Will try the spam next time!
author: B S.

description:
This place is alright, I still prefer to go to spot lounge.  I've been here couple times I think the service was sup par and the food was ehh... 

I really dislike the service button in a restaurant cause servers literally just wait for the button to go off before they even take a look at you.  This place is located under a house and it looks like a garage but definitely a narrow restaurant.

The food was normal it wasn't too impressive the only thing I so like was the kimchi soup with ramen that was pretty good! They serve soju as well it's ok... Not bad
author: Jorlyn W.

description:
I finally had the opportunity to try out " the garage" everyone has been talking about!

So my birthday was on saturday and it was established that it would be a party of 13.  We called in 2 days in advance to reserve, making sure that a garage would have enough space for a huge party AND still able to serve other guests.  The lady on the phone was really nice.  I made the reservation for 9pm on Saturday night.  And she inform me that the whole party should be present at 9pm.

On the day of, 13 of us arrived at 8:40pm.  We actually got there on time and early cause finding parking was easy, luckily.  We parked a block away and walked to the restaurant.  2 of us went in and told them we were here, but apparently was told we were too early.  So we all waited outside for about 10 minutes and check back at 9pm.  And was told again to wait another 10 minutes.  Okay, I guess this didn't bother me TOO much since we were just chilling outside anyways, but most of us were pretty hungry.  Plus, shouldn't the table be ready if you told us not to be late? 

When we were finally seated, I realized there was only 2 girls working in the whole restaurant...ok thats probably why.  

We all decided what we wanted and ordering was quick.  Couple dishes worth mentioning:

kimchee fried rice - Portion was okay.  I think it was around $10/ plate.  It wasn't that spicy at all, but I did like the texture of the rice.  

Spicy chicken wings - delicious! Not really spicy if you ask me, since I can eat pretty spicy.  But the way it was fried was perfect.  I liked it alot.  There was probably around 10 wings in a order?  Our whole table ordered 3 orders to share.

Last but not least...SOJU!
We ordered 7 bottles of soju total.  2 bottles of aloe, 1 of strawberry, 1 of kiwi, 1 of peach, and 1 of yogurt, and 1 of mango. 

Aloe - my favorite!  there were actual aloe pieces in there! Plus it tasted just like the aloe juice you buy from korean markets. :)

strawberry - tasted yummy.  strawberry flavor was strong.  You almost cant taste the alcohol.

Yogurt - wasnt as good as i expect, but it was still delicious.  Have you ever had the yogurt drink?  You'll know what im talking about.

Mango, Peach, and Kiwi were a okay.  Kiwi didn't taste much like kiwi.  Probably my least favorite.  

Each bottle was $11.  They DO check ID, and they give out shot glasses according to the amount of people who showed ID.  They serve water in a large size plastic looking water bottle.  

Total time taken for the meal : 1 Hour 45 mins.
How much? $279 w/ gratuity

Happy soju Birthday!
author: Stephy L.

description:
The Soju Cocktails weren't that strong or big, but they were mighty delicious with a wider variety of flavors than the typical Korean place.   We got the usual yogurt, but the pineapple was the winner of the night.

The Stir Fried Octopus (Nak-ji Bo-kum, I think?) was really good, although some people might be turned off by the inside of the octopus tentacles being slightly undercooked - mmmm squishy goodness.  The Seafood Pancake was also delicious with lots of seafood, although it stuck to the paper below.  The Kimchi Fried Rice with bulgogi was good but small and had more beef than kimchi flavor, although admittedly I prefer spam with my kimchi fried rice.  The Spicy Chicken Wings were very crispy and burning hot but not spicy at all.   The Ddukboki (+$2 each for egg or fishcakes or ramen?!) was just alright - it wasn't bad, but it wasn't the best, but thumbs up for being extra spicy.

All dishes run around the standard $10 for Korean joints, as were the Soju Cocktails.  Surprisingly, we got seated within 15 minutes even though we were quoted a 30-60 minute wait time around 8PM Saturday - yay for people giving up in front of us!  The service and kitchen were pretty slow, but the staff responds very quickly to the discrete Service Button on the wall.  All-in-all, a good place to eat and drink for awhile with friends in the intimate dimly lit booths with the blinds drawn- maybe that's why the wait is always so long.
author: Kevin W.

description:
At first sight, Toyose is a garage that blends into a row of other garages. Look for a tiny sign that leads to a door that leads to a beautiful room lit by fairy lights.

We had beef kimchi fried rice, which came with an egg. It was lightly spicy and so tasty that I could not stop eating.

We had spicy chicken wings, which were crispy and tasty and moist and so delicious.

We had yogurt soju, which was tasty as anything.

Everything was so tasty and seemed to taste better because we were in such a unique environment.
author: Christina S.

description:
This place is also known as the Garage, right??

Walking by this place, who would've thought you'd find the best Yogurt Soju and a pretty bomb KimChee Fried Rice?! And you know what else is bomb? Their french fries (without the garlic/cheese)! Try it and you'll know what I'm talking about!

The wait can be pretty long, but the food and good time you'll have there is worth it!!
author: Athena L.

description: I WILL NEVER COME BACK again. The food is not bad but the waiter's attitude is really bad. Just now it was raining heavily outside and we were waiting for our uber after eating here. We are all girls and the waiter told us to wait outside while its still 10 mins before their closing time. This is not how you treat your customers. There are so many similar Korean places in SF, stay away this one if you can.
author: Chloe M.

description:
Wow, this restaurant really IS located in a garage! 

I came here on a Tuesday night around 7PM and were lucky enough to snag a table. It's hard to choose what to eat for a table of 2 because the dishes are a bit pricey and large in portion-sizes. We had the Spicy Pork over Tofu, which was delicious and had the right amount of kick to it. They definitely didn't skimp out on pork, onions, or tofu. The kimchi and beef rice with an egg over the top was equally as delicious and a great accompaniment to the pork and tofu. We also had the yogurt soju which was good, but you can't really get soju wrong. You also get free popcorn!

Service was fast, efficient, and very no-nonsense. It was a bit awkward when our waitress noticed we stopped eating the popcorn and grabbed it from our table as we were eating our dinner. Does that mean they re-use their popcorn?! 

Overall a great place for Korean "bar" type-of food and soju. Afterwards, head over to Polly Ann's for some ice-cream!
author: Stephanie L.

description:
I'm going to keep this short and sweet because, quite simply, if you haven't eaten here, you're missing out! The food here is amaaazing!! We ordered the following:

- seafood pancake (not the best I've ever had, but is pretty darn close. MUST ORDER!)
- seafood stew with udon noodles (this is enough for 3 people if you're ordering other dishes and is equally delicious!)
- spicy chicken wings (it's actually not spicy, but SUPER crispy and delicious!)

The wait here can be a bit long, but they're open til 2am, so pick an off peak time and treat yourself to an awesome meal! :D
author: Ty L.

description:
Heard about this place from a couple friends: Korean restaurant inside a garage? Like literally, AND it's open until 2am. I had to check it out. Came here on a Tuesday night at 7pm and thankfully there wasn't any line.

My friend and I ordered a spam casserole (every table whether it's of 2 or 5 people had one of these casseroles!), chicken wings and fries with garlic and cheese. The spam casserole was HUGE! And delicious. So many ingredients (ramen, rice cake, sausage, spam, cabbage, tofu) and not too spicy. Fried chicken and fries were nothing out of the ordinary. 

I highly recommend coming here. Cute little place. We spent $30 each on dinner? Very decent for the portions. 

Note: Around 8:30/9, tables were all full and there were probably two parties waiting.
author: Joanna H.

description:
This place is a veritable food Narnia. From the outside it looks like a typical Sunset garage but when you open the door to the inside you are transported to a fancy Korean restaurant. 

While getting seated can be a little dicey sometimes the food selection is amazing. From sizzling grilled eel to huge pots of noodled soups to mouthwatering kimchee fried rice and even the delicious, yet simple "corn and cheese."

Watch out for the soju, it is delicious and dangerous!
author: Andrew K.

description: We ordered only a spam soup which was too big for two of us to finish. We will definitely come back to have a pancake!!
author: Kurumi O.

description: Low key exterior and really cute interior. I was really surprised! Food was good, but nothing excellent. I felt like there was a tad bit of flavor missing from each dish. Got the kimchi fried rice, fried chicken wings, and eel dish.
author: Cassandra M.

description:
Love this place for groups - just be sure to make reservations and tell everyone to bring cash so there's no issues with paying the bill later. I hate it when people don't bring cash when you warn them beforehand!

I had my birthday dinner here in 2010 and have been here for different friend get-togethers. It really is random that this place is in a garage, but once you experience it, the novelty wears off and you no longer accidentally drive by the place and enjoy the place for it's lively atmosphere and food. The area in the back can get kind of hot, with all the steam from the food, people crammed in and lack of windows, so dress appropriately. They take their reservations seriously here and will not give your table way 30 minutes before your reservation to some other party you'd have to subsequently wait for to finish. I always end up ordering the same thing here: garlic fries with cheese, spicy wings and kimchee fried rice. The fries are ALWAYS the last thing to come out, so save room for them or ask your server that they be brought out first. Cheese is sooooo flavorful and packed on there. The food can be a bit pricey, so definitely order family-style so you get some variety to your order and experience.

I would say service here is great considering the tight space and the loud groups they have to juggle - they tend to give you everything you need at your table all at once(large water bottle, utensils, plates, etc) and you can just ring the server doorbell at your table if you need anything else. Place can get packed after 10pm and if you're sitting in the front, be prepared to have an audience anxiously awaiting for you to finish your food. Great place to bring out of town visitors to since it has the shock and awe factor and the food and drinks do not disappoint. One bottle of soju per person usually suffices ($11/bottle so very affordable). 

Soju Analysis: 
Love the strawberry and kiwi. Definitely must get flavors that will please the whole table.
Flavors that were A-OK: peach, pineapple, yogurt (mix the yogurt in with strawberry)
Stay away from Lemon - it tastes like floor cleaner.

It was just my boyfriend and I once and we were barely making a dent in the soju since he was driving and I didn't want to drink too much, so I asked the server if we could take it to go-- I felt stupid asking, but I had to (since you never know and the restaurant is already so unconventional)! She politely said no and I drank as much soju as I could before we left.
author: Ghia G.

description:
Had an absolutely huge craving for Korean food. My friend listed off several places and I mentioned that I had always wanted to try this place and so happy that we did!

The seafood pancake was slightly crispy on the outside but the seafood wasn't overcooked! Soooo much flavor and textures in that dish. I'm salivating as I type this and fondly recall the delicious pancake!

The fried chicken is tender and has amazing crispy skin. De-lish!

Since it was just two of us, we didn't think it was wise to order more food. So many more I wanted to try. I was also driving and didn't have the pleasure of trying the flavored soju which many friends have sung high praises about. :( Next time!
author: Kitty K.

description:
Before, I go into my review of this restaurant, I want to share with you my Toyose preparation checklist.

Checklist:
-dress in layers
-no wool
-no items that can't be immediately washed in washer and dryer
-wear comfy shoes because you may be standing outside if the waiting area in the foyer is crowded
-bring a DD so that you can enjoy lots of SOJU

That's just my personal checklist, feel free to share your own.

So, just be prepared to eat and drink well (seafood pancake), soju, Bimibap, soju, kimchi fried rice, flavored soju, spicy chicken wings... need, I say it again?  SOJU.

Yet, with all of the positives, there is some room for improvement:
-need a better system for logging in guests (seems that there is some randomness and b/c this is so popular, you can wait for an hour or more to get seated)
-reservations?  why can't this place take reservations? BE PREPARED TO WAIT.
-service - hmmm... not always the most polite.  Of course, if I were dealing with large parties of drunkards all night, I might not always be in the best mood, either.
-It's like a SAUNA...it's hella hot in there...layers, layers.  
-no formal waiting area...so, on cold, foggy SF nights, you need a jacket...or, go across the street to grab a drink at one of the neighboring places!
author: Hiromi N.

description: Went there for my birthday dinner with my friends. The food was pretty good but the service were not so good. The girl waitress didn't have good service. While I was sitting down on the bench near the entrance to wait for my table she was serving the table next to it. SHE PUT THE HOT PAN THING RIGHT IN FRONT OF MY FACE AND PUT IT RIGHT NEXT TO ME. That thing was HELLA HOT. And she just had really bad service but the guy was really nice. And I had to pay 18% tips( because we had 9 people) for that rude waitress.
author: Minnie C.

description: Waited nearly one hour and left. This place should take reservations. Especially since we came from across town. Thoroughly aggravating.
author: Jimmy K.

description: Food was great. Came around 6 on a Saturday night. No wait. Food came quick. Seafood pancake, kimchi fried rice and bulgogi/calamari. Soo good. Only complaint was they waitress changed my tip. I split bill with my friend and my bill ended up with an extra 10$. We both tipped 20% which is not 10$ lol. Called my bank to complain but they just gave me credit back since I have been a value customer. But I just want to make sure everyone else is aware of this. Keep your receipts if you come here or pay cash! Be careful my Yelpers. Dangerous place.
author: Richmond L.

description: One of the favorite spots to go to when you want to chill with some good Korean food and soju. It's a good hangout spot which is uniquely built in a garage. I would recommend making reservations before because they can get pretty full towards 9:30pm. Service is good and they have a huge selection of soju. The kimchi fried rice and garlic cheese fries are delicious. Definitely some place I will continue going to for years to come.
author: Shelly W.

description: I've been here twice but only had food once. Their kimchi fried rice and the chicken wings were SO good. My friends and I ordered those because we saw that everyone else on yelp had mentioned how good they were, and we were not disappointed at all. The second time I came, was because Tonight had an hour wait. I wasn't too disappointed because the soju here is delicious. All the flavors are good, so no need to be too picky. Everything is fairly priced and the portions were great. It's nice that this place is open late, but if you go during their busy hours, the wait can be really frustrating and awkward, because there's not much waiting room and you sort of just end up watching other people eat.
author: Cicily C.

description: When I first heard about this restaurant from my friends that it was inside a garage, I didn't believe them.  Came here, and was surprised that it was really inside a garage.  Food here is ok, not authentic Korean food which I thought it would be.  The best dish here is probably the seafood pancake, my chopsticks just won't stop going towards the pancake.  The spam stew or casserole is pretty good too.  Spicy wings aren't spicy, its just deep fried chicken wings.  Kimchi fried rice is just average, but not bad.  Yogurt soju is also good, probably can just buy those frozen yogurt drinks and mix it with soju at home....  My friends and I would go here once in awhile if we can't decide where to go eat, and since we're in the area, we just come here to grab food and then just call it a night.  Overall, food is alright, not fancy or anything.  Just casual "Korean" food....
author: Henry N.

description:
The minute that I heard that Toyose was in a GARAGE, I wanted to go.  Seeing that image of the angry chicken made it even more appealing.  The garage is surprisingly cozy, dimly lit, and charming inside, with lanterns, white lights, ropes, beer posters featuring Korean actresses (models?) and a somewhat nautical/cabin feel.

* Kimchi pancake ($10.95): flat and thin, an interesting variation on the usual pancake, liked the slightly crispy edges, and the warm and soft interior, with a soy based dipping sauce
* Shrimp fried rice - plain, just like Chinese fried rice, small shrimp used, I wouldn't order it again
* Sauteed calamari in red pepper sauce: Some calamari pieces were tough and rubbery, the round rice cakes rolls were chewy, also had onions, peppers, and sesame seeds, average flavor

Okay, so it's a drinking spot and that seems to typically correspond with very stingy and limited banchan.  Boo.  We were only given four (bean sprouts, cucumbers, cabbage kimchi, anchovies) that were never refilled.  We didn't get any complimentary popcorn either.
author: Lolia S.

description: Came in on a Thursday night after work with my co-workers. We had to wait about 20-25 minutes for a small table. It wasn't my first time there, so I kinda knew what I wanted. Our soju took a whole hour to make, so we didn't get our kiwi soju until we were done with our meal. We ordered mango and strawberry soju as we waited. Food: we ordered the seafood casserole, wings, gizzard, kimchi fried rice, and shrimp tempura. Nothing was "omg so good", but I did like the kimchi fried rice. That's pretty much it. Everything else was tasty, but nothing to rave about. The three bottles of soju did nothing to us, we left sober. Service was ok, our waitress was friendly, but never checked on us. It's a good place to go if you're already drunk with your friends and have the drunchies.
author: Pauline E.

description: Food is really good... But service was a one star. They are racist to Chinese people. That's what me and my family feel like. They only want Korean costumers. We have a party of four. I ask for more small dishes they said maximum is 2 only. We have four people and my little sister can only eat the small dishes because they wouldn't make the stew no spicy. Only less spicy but its still too spicy for my sister. The two waiters were both very rude. The stars are only for the food.
author: Potatoe Q.

description: Toyose is a good spot when you and your friends are randomly craving Korean food in the neighborhood on a late night and just want to go somewhere simple (they close very late).  I like the style of the restaurant and how it's kind of hidden/nested in a house.  Parking is pretty good since it is in outer sunset and food is average.  I usually get typical dishes such as Japchae, chicken wings, and tofu soup.  Don't expect to get great service there.  Sometimes, the waiters give off a grumpy vibe.   Overall, this place is a decent spot for korean food and casual eating/soju drinking.
author: Denise C.

description:
A friend told me about this place a few times. Didn't believe him when he said it was a garage. Lo and behold, it is. It's a house-turned-restaurant. Small and quaint with K-pop music playing in the background. The ambiance has a mellow feel (when we went, there wasn't a whole lot of people) mood, with the lighting not so bright, unlike some other Korean restaurant joints. It is fairly small, and probably holds about a total of 25+ ppl.

Food wise: when I went there not too long ago, same friend and I ordered their chicken wings, the seafood pajeon (pancake), tteukkbokki (rice cake in spicy sauce) and their spam kimchi fried rice. All were in good sized portions. All tasted great, especially the spam kimchi fried rice. The pajeon was a bit too oily for my taste, but that's just me. Still tasty, seeing as my friend devoured that and the wings. Lol

Must try the beef kimchi fried rice next time I stop by as well as their flavored soju drinks.
author: Shall P.

description:
First off let me say that if you're coming with a larger group, definitely call ahead and make reservations.

Came with a group of 7 on a Friday night, ended up waiting for roughly 45 minutes for a table. This place is on the smaller side. I'd say it has 20 tables total.
Everything's a little cramped with a larger group. Also you won't be seated till all members of your party are here. Found that out the hard way when 5 of our 7 were here and they wouldn't seat us till the remaining two showed up. Luckily they were able to beat the clock and arrive before our table was passed off. I understand that process, but if the majority of our group is here, we should be allowed to sit.

We were all starved so we went a little crazy with the food. Ordered the spicy pork, kimchi friend rice, the stew, chicken gizzards, and MULTIPLE fried chickens.

The spicy pork was delicious. Tons of flavor. We actually ordered 3 of these and they were a hit. The kimchi friend rice was standard and good. The stew was a good choice; they bring in a burner and place the pot on top. You watch and manage the stew cook. It had a variety of stuff. The thing that stood out was the octopus. Lot of the people with me were weary of trying the chewy tentacles, but in the end they succumbed to my convincing. The chicken gizzards were also the standard variety. Simply friend and served with the salt dipping sauce on the side.

NOW the fried chicken was awesome. We ordered 5 plates of this throughout the night. It was juicy on the inside and nice and crispy on the outside. Perfectly cooked. It. Was. Great.

Though it might've been the pure hunger talking.... Or the copious amounts of soju we had consumed.

Speaking of soju, they offer a nice selection of flavored soju. Yogurt, mango, strawberry, pineapple, peach, and aloe. We ordered the yogurt, strawberry, pineapple, and peach. From what I remember, the strawberry and the mango were the best. Order numerous bottles of it. The pineapple is worth passing on. Peach and Yogurt were good, but still preferred the other two. They were all well balanced. Not strong, and not too sweet. That perfect blend of dangerousness. You can't feel it so you keep drinking more. And next thing you know you wake up at home with fried chicken crumbs on your face.
 
 But that isn't necessairly a bad thing now is it.
author: Karma B.

description:
What else can i say about this place that I haven't already said? Nearly two years after my original review, I came back to fulfill a bucket list requirement. Everything is just as good. Seafood pancake, the casseroles (which aren't really casseroles, just soup with lots of good stuff), cheese corn, mussel soup, the deliciousness just never ends! They have since added more flavors of soju, and you really should try them all. 

I will miss venturing out to a garage three blocks from the Pacific Ocean just to satisfy my anju craving.
author: Angeline P.

description:
Eh. Toyose is this tiny little place that you probably wouldn't even think twice about just passing by it. We managed to grab a small table on a random weekend night.

As much as I would like to say this is a hidden gem, it is completely not. I'm surprised they even get that many customers. The chicken was insanely dry like everyone says it is, there is no hot sauce or anything sauce in this world that could have helped it. The soup I ordered was fine, it tasted much more like sodium broth than anything else. The mussels we ordered were good but not good enough for what they charged.

All in all, I'm not particularly fond of Toyose. Not particularly tempted to make another trip back over here but hey if you're in need, feel free.

And yes, I do have personal bubble space issues given that every table was about a foot apart from each other.
author: Winè C.

description:
4.5 Stars would be an accurate measure.

I love the kimchi seafood pancake here; of all the places I've had (personally) it is the best here. The Kimchi fried rice is average, you can get it at Bart Grocery for cheaper with more portion. The chicken wings are alright too, ask for a side of the salad dressing to dip it in since it can be dry. The tempura calamari is good too. 
As for aspects aside from the food, I'm not a stickler on wait, it's pretty much to be expected in SF, but depending on when you go it could range anywhere from 10min-1hour. However, I do really like this place because it is open until 2am and the atmosphere is very laid-back. As for service it is a Korean restaurant so they do have buttons on the wall to flag over servers when you need anything.
author: Chad S.

description:
So much to love about this place! One: the fact that they are open every night until 2am is awesome. Two: there are privacy blinds that you can roll down at each table. Three: even though service buttons are prevalent at the table for Korean restaurants, its always a plus when I find a place that has one. Four: my ultimate test of any Korean restaurant is how crispy they make their seafood pancake, and this place passes my test!
Of course we got the fried chicken wings. They had a crunchy coating and moist interior. My surprise favorite was the gyoza, they were also deep fried and delicious. I was surprised they were handmade of course this made me like them even more. The spicy pork came out sizzling on a hot plate and satisfied my craving for bulgogi (they don't have Korean bbq specials) and was a crowd favorite. Very reasonably priced, and large portions. Next time we want to come back for the soup that they bring out on top of individual bunsen burners.
author: Alexis D.

description:
I can't even tell if I was inside a garage since it was so dark outside. Soon as you walk in, keep walking straight down to be seated by the hostess. A very bus, and crowded place. 

kimchee fried rice and the omelet - Pretty awesome dish! It isn't spicy and you got the nice egg with the seaweed. I would recommend this dish.

kimchee pancakes - fried but they have the dipping sauce to make it a bit more spicy. It was ok but wow I didn't expect that this dish came out looking HUGE!

kimchee seafood vegetable soup - Tasty soup and loved the dried spongy tofu. Just don't talk and slurp, I almost coughed like crazy haha.

pineapple sake - my friend suggested, nothing spectacular it is just fruity. 

Great dinner and I would want to try their casseroles next time.
author: Eric E.

description:
Honestly, the food here is AIIIIIITE. 

Coming here, you would DEFINITELY miss it if you didn't know that the outside looks like a freaking garage!  So cool.  We ordered the chicken karrage, seafood pancake, kim chi fried rice, and this other dish i forgot.. but it wasn't that good.  Honestly all of these dishes were very bleh.  Nothing really stood out to us and the flavors were not poppin in my mouth!  Would i come back here again?  Maybe if I had nowhere else to go. but this is definitely not a place i would CRAVE.
author: Vivian l.

description:
The service here was not bad. Just kinda slow but there are call buttons at the tables if you really need something. What they do need to do is accept reservations, at least on weekends when the wait times can get pretty long. 
Their kimchi fried rice was DELICIOUS. Sooo good! And their japchae is really yummy too. They are notorious for their chicken wings, but we didnt get to try them because they wouldn't let us cancel our kimchi jjigae order so it would have been way too much food. Their food portions here are pretty gigantic. We didn't get any banchan with our meal which was kind of weird to me. And the kimchi jjigae was a huge disappointment. I have never heard of a jjigae being tomato based??? It was like they literally cooked pork belly and kimchi in a few cans of Campbell's tomato soup. Soooo strange and definitely not ordering that again lol. So for that, only 3 stars(it really tasted that weird, lol). Would come back only for the japchae and kimchi fried rice at a time when the wait isn't too long.
author: Hilarie L.

description: I was went there for dinner and hoping to eat a delicious korean food. It turned out to be a horrible experience. We were waiting for an hour and the service was sucks. The waitress was rude and didnt serve us well. The food wasn't that great, and I think that this restaurant is overrated.
author: Christofer K.

description:
Its like my favorite spot to take my friends from out of the city! I was never disappointed to their service and food! Love the environment and uniqueness of their "garage" atmosphere. Korean food may not be the most authentic, but it would be great for friends hanging out at late night, with soju drinks! 

Best and most popular dishes are the kimchi fried rice, I do believe they made the best out of all Korean restaurants I have gone to. If you have a group of friends, try the hot pot style with everything!
author: Lisa R.

description:
First choice after getting off the plane in the evening. Waiting around 1.5 hours at friday night, but definitely worthy. 
+++ customer service is awesome ! Their staffs are super friendly!!! 
+++ Seafood Strew is wonderful! Not like most of the Korean hotpot is too salty, their   seafood strew's flavor is just perfect. You can taste the OCEAN!!!
+++ Kiwi Soju is damn good! Not very sweet which i love it (i was worried about it's gonna be super sweet) MUST ORDER!!
+++ Price is reasonable!!!!! 
I will absolutely come back next time when i visit san fran
author: Raffy F.

description:
Love the kimchee fried rice here!

This place gets busy at night and the wait can be an hour long.

Parking is easy.

Service is above average but can be slow during peak hours.

It's a little pricey compared to places like Mom's Tofu House in SSF or Tofu House in Daly City but about the same compared to the Spot in Sunset.

This is a good spot for groups to hang out: eat & drink!
author: K L.

description:
Hour long wait? Not too bad. 
The atmosphere is very home-y, dim lit, with a warm ambiance.
It was slightly crowded but it wasnt a big issue.
The service is great, even on a busy night!
We ordered kimchi fried rice, deep fried spicy chicken wings, and bacon sausage
.
The bacon wrapped sausages were amazing, maybe just because I have a weak spot in my heart for bacon. The kimchi fried rice was very good as well, topped with an egg and seaweed. The flavors compliment each other well, and the kimchi flavor was not too overpowering. 
Okay, let me say the chicken wings were worth the wait alone. Perfectly fresh, crispy, and crunchy. Not really spicy but you do get a little kick from the spicy.
The food here is amazing and light. Definitely recommend.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Secret late night eats found in a garage in outer Sunset!

Yep, Lorna D. spotted Toyose during one of her late night drives and her curiosity got the best of her.  She dragged the BF and I there since safety is better in numbers...and besides, there's no English on the outside!  She needed her Asian power beside her in case she got turned away! =)

Toyose is located very much in the garage of a home and as you enter the door, you're not sure what to think.  Tables line up the left side and in the back.  A waitress came out to ask if she could help us, detecting our newness to this establishment.  We asked if they were still serving and she gave us the first table closest to the door.  (A bad choice since every time someone walks in, you get a huge draft!)

We ended up ordering 05. Calamari & Beef (Bulgogi) & Vegetables in Sweet Soy Sauce ($13.95), 42. Home Style Seafoods & Green Onion Pancake ($10.95), and two bottles of mango yogurt soju ($11/each).

The dishes were pretty grub and were a decent size to share for the three of us. Lorna D's choice of mixing up her favorite yogurt and mango soju was yummy too.

As the late night drew on and closing time was near, we had a feeling this place doesn't close at its advertised 2 am.  Young kids were still piling in as we were finishing up our food, so I think as long as business is good, they'll keep the food and drink coming.

My one complaint is that when we were ordering, I asked for hot water (I was coming down with a cold!) and the waitress told me they didn't have any. She explained they were closing up and they don't have any hot water.  (Uh...okay...)  Getting more regular water and more soju was a pain later on since we had to get up and look for the waitress.  (She was snoozing in one of the tables with the blinds lowered down!)
  
Nonetheless, it's worth checking this place out.  Drag a bunch of friends here 'cuz this is the kind of place you want to go with a mess of people.  We came late at night (after midnight), so no reservation was needed then.  Besides, I think this place works better for late night drink and grub anyway.

(I took pics of our food!)
author: Teri C.

description:
This is a hidden germ. Food is good with very reasonable price. 
Besides the popular korean bbq, the seafood pancake was excellent. Must try.
author: K L.

description: The food is moderate but the place is small so expect it to be very crowded! But if you are craving for some korean stew and rice cake, this place is not bad at all! I always get the chicken wings and rice cake! Spam stew is so good!!
author: Sandy W.

description:
I arrived at the place around 10pm and the wait is really long just to get seated because the place is really small, but I did expect that wait. The wait took 2 hours and the waitress told us about an hour and I didn't like that the people who would come in after us were getting told a "30 minute wait". There's no way of finding out who's getting seated next, so I think if there was a list, it would show the order and people won't feel like they just seat anyone. It seems like you have a better chance of getting seated faster if you come as a group of 4 or more with reservations. The food wasn't all that great from what I had expected, but their kimchee fried rice is definitely good. 

Not worth the wait, not that great of a service, and the people that work there don't really smile
author: Eunice M.

description:
Seafood & Kimichi Pancake?! Why you have to be so far from me T-T

Short: This place is awesome! Love the set up, prices, etc. We got the seafood kimchi pancake, tteokbokki, and this giant pot of spicy seafood soup that they cook at the table. So delicious and came with a lot, except the tteokbokki, alright but probably the worse tteokbokki I've had yet. Got the yogurt soju, so flippin' good man! Flavorful but still strong and came with a good amount, me likey! Service was alright, meh. Then again what Korean place isn't?

So I made reservations here for a friend's surprise birthday. We were late but they still accommodated us. I love the set up, very chill and they have buttons on the wall to call the server! They also have this wooden mat that rolls down for added privacy as it's pretty cramped in the front area. So much food and they have all of my favorite dishes, oh goodness! I love kimchi and seafood pancake, my mind was blown when I was told they had a seafood + kimchi pancake! Delicious, though the tteokboki didn't come with too much and wasn't very good. (I can make better at home.) The seafood soup thing we go was HUGE and full of delicious seafood critters, we had lots of left overs. I should have read the menu better, I didn't know there was giant pieces of pig intestine in it but it was my friends birthday so I just endured the stomach ache. 

The service wasn't friendly but it wasn't horrible either. The waitress was alright, though she flipped out over my friend's ID. She seriously looked like she was going to have a heart attack or someone just stabbed someone! She wouldn't let my friend drink because she didn't believe it was her and all my friend had was cash so no card to prove so. Because of this we didn't order the amount of soju we intended to and went to a bar afterwards instead. Also, they didn't give us any side dishes. Super sad, I love banchan!

Oh well, overall really chill spot for good soju and good food at a decent price! I recommend! 

(Next time I will definitely get the cheese corn :3)
author: Julia N.

description:
We went there two times; the first time the plates and services were good, so we went back for a second round and we expected something similar or even better, but the food and the service were below average. No enough waitresses for that many tables!
Just one waitress, and when we asked questions about the food and menu, the waitress gave us attitude.
Definitely we won't come back.
author: Richard C.

description:
4.5!  I absolutely rave about their kimchi fried rice (SO YUMMY).  Everything else I've tried here is delicious: seafood pancake, mango and strawberry soju, and the fried chicken.  The only thing that would bump this to a 5-star rating is if their portions were a bit bigger.

As previously recommended, if you're coming with a large group during primetime hours, definitely make a reservation.  However, if you come really early (as in right when they open) or late at night, you can usually get away with just walking in.
author: Can C.

description:
Best kimchi fried rice with sunny side up egg ever! Not overly spicy and perfect amount of chopped kimchi. Too bad the wait is always long. Luckily, there is a chinese massage place next door that is open late. Try a 40minute foot massage ($20) to kill some time. They have other dishes but the fried rice is my regular order. Eel is delicious as well.

They've very good at checking ID and don't allow you to share drinks. Even if you're over 21, without an ID you don't get to drink okay. If you try to sneak a drink and get caught, the alcohol will be taken away! This is all from observation, not first hand experience. They offer various korean alcohol including cocktail soju like lychee, strawberry, yogurt, mango, etc.
author: Eileen W.

description:
Toyose is one of the first Korean restaurants I've been to that isn't either KBBQ or a tofu house.  And if yelp didn't exist, I'd have never seen it.  Seriously, where's the sign?  It can't just be that (admittedly awesome) chubby winking chicken face on the wall, right?  Well, that's forgivable.

THE GIST: Delicious kimchi beef fried rice / Corn cheese sounds hilarious, but is delicious / Good fried wings

SERVICE AND SETTING

I went here for a late dinner on a Monday night.  When we went in, it was quiet, but barely full; later on a line started (late!) and it got pretty loud.  The restaurant itself is comfortable and somewhat clean.  Service was fine.

FOOD AND VALUE

Beef kimchi fried rice: As you can see in the photos, it's served with a fried egg on top.  It's just as delicious as it looks.

Duk boki with fish cakes: Surprisingly average.  I've never had an amazing duk boki but this one really didn't leave me wishing for more.

Spicy fried chicken: I don't know why "spicy" is in the name, because it's not at all spicy especially by Korean standards.  That being said, the batter was quite tasty and the chicken was moist.  It was good fried chicken, just not spicy.

Corn cheese: I laughed at the name, but I was so surprised to see this dish on an Asian menu that I just went ahead and ordered it.  And I did not regret it.  It's topped with gratuitous amounts of gooey cheese and the corn itself was definitely buttered before being topped with it.  Fat on top of fat cooked in fat, what's not to love.

As typically seen in Korean restaurants, prices are somewhat high.  However, the quality is also high and the portions were good so I felt it was reasonable.

CONCLUSION

Toyose sparked some more interest in non-KBBQ non-tofu soup Korean foods and I hope one day to return.
author: Brandon W.

description:
I ordered Ddeokbokki, Kimchi Fried Rice, and Kimchi Haemul Pajeon.
Everything except the Ddeokbokki was really really good. I never really had Kimchi Haemul Pajeon before. I mean I had Haemul Pajeon and Kimchi Pajeon but never together. I ate it 2 hours later and it was still really good
The interior of the restaurant is a bit low and cramped though but who needs that when you have good korean food.
author: Brian L.

description:
The Frie Chigggggin is finger licking good! At 12AM this restaurant is packed with people waiting outside for a table. From afar this place looks like a house (full on with a garage). 

Food: 
Only had the chicken wings and Kimchi fried rice. We ate before we came so we didn't order much, but it was so good we ordered a 2nd serving of Kimchi fried rice! The wings has what I call a light batter that does not come off. Very flavorful and though not too crunchy it is dry on the exterior and moist on the interior. The Kimchi fried rice reminds me of Kimbaps. Actually it's pretty much the same ingredients. Kimbap rice, kimbap beef, and kimchi! 

Service: 
Gotta love those Korean button things. Unlike many places in Los Angeles where they don't come to you even if you press the button they actually come over! 1 point off because they didn't give us Panchan! If you want to tell me they don't serve Panchan...then 1 point off for that! 

Environment: 
The place is pretty small considering the amount of business they have. The restaurant is pretty oddly shapes. I would shift to a bigger open space if I were them. They sure have enough followers to afford moving. Anyway the place has a party environment without a party setup because of the way the restaurant is structured. Definitely not a place you want to end up if you have a party of more than 4 (hard to get a table).

Price: 
I don't remember...only remember 11 Soju mixes which is a pretty good deal. Good food is always worth it's price! 

Will come back again! Need to try their other foods.

Food: 5
Service: 4
Environment: 3
Price: 4
author: Sam T.

description:
Five reasons why this place gets a five start rating in my book:

1.  The flavored sojus are fantastic

2.  Open late!

3.  There is a button at the table that you press to get immediate service (press button, get more beer? what's not to love about that)

4.  The whole "WTF, did someone really throw this together in in their garage?" vibe and ambiance

5.  The food is actually quite good ... and the menu has a good amount of items that can even be enjoyed by your less adventurous western friends who would otherwise never step foot in a Korean restaurant.   

In short: this may not be the best, most authentic Korean food out there.  But bring your friends, as it certainly is one of the most interesting, exciting and fun dining experiences to be had in San Francisco.
author: c h.

description: This hidden gem is BOMB! Amazing kimchi and cheap soju/beer. Great selection of traditional Korean cuisine (I would skip the American dishes like chicken wings and cheesy fries). The wait can be long since the place is practically in a garage so get there early.
author: Anastasia P.

description:
"It's Friday Night... Just got paid... Stomach's hungry... and I want some SOJUUUUU!"

TOYOSE AKA THE GARAGE! YES, I LOVE THIS PLACE!
Korean Food and Soju galore!

When my friends and I go here, we tend to get:
- The Kimchi Fried Rice
- Seafood Pancake
- Beef and Calamari Bulgolgi
-Garlic Cheese Fries
-Seafood Tofu Soup
-Spicy Chicken wings 
and of course...
-SOJU SOJU SOJU!!! especially mango and strawberry!

Everytime I've been here I was never let down, the food is always flavorable and tasty and the soju is ooh so refreshing! PLUS, they give you popcorn while you wait! 

Sometimes, the wait can be long a on a busy night, but HEY, I say it's worth it! Go to the Garage and who knows, you might enjoy what the Garage has to offer. =)
author: Rosalyn T.

description:
After going to Seoul for holiday, I came back constantly craving spicy stews with ramen, rice cakes, sausages, and all the works. omg nothing in SF will compare to the price and quality of the local places in Seoul. Seriously we paid less than $20 for 4 peoples worth of beer and refills of stew, adding ramen, sausages, etc. But, Toyose's stew was pretty damn good too. Price was around $20-$30 and we added more ramen so that bumped up our total by a bit. We also got their kimchi fried rice and some chicken wings too. All of their food is actually really good. We were soooooo stuffed. 

4/5 - My fault for comparing to the place we went to in Seoul, but hey. it was under $20 for beer AND food. But Toyose was really good too :)
author: Carmen L.

description: Came here with a group of friends. We ordered kimchee fried rice, spicy fried chicken, seafood pancake, and of course soju! It was good, come give it a try yourself!
author: Stephanie Y.

description: Definitely overrated. The wings were lackluster. No sauce or anything impressive. Literally just fried chicken wings. The seafood pancake was OK as was the kimchi fried rice. Maybe it's not as good since I got take out but there's nothing special about the food.
author: Rochelle I.

description: Kimchi fried rice was okay, their beef stew was really good as well. Little disappointed with their chicken wings and their corn cheese. I love chicken wings I was under the impression that toyose chicken wing are good, and when I had one of them I feel like I won't go there for a second time.
author: Ibnu A.

description: This place gets really crowded, but luckily I got here when there was no line and free tables! (I came around 6:15 pm.) The exterior is so nondescript, but the interior will surprise you! The space feels much bigger, and it almost has a nautical theme. I tried the beef kimchi fried rice, fried chicken wings, croquettes, and cheese corn. The best thing I had was the kimchi fried rice. The chicken wings were good and really crispy, but I wish they were spicier. The croquettes were perfectly crisp and had a katsu sauce on it. And the corn cheese was like corn fondue. At the tables, there is a little button to get the server's attention. That was really handy!
author: Rachel H.

description: Was amazed at this place, I mean think about it, a restaurant in someone's garage and has that family business feeling. Inside was dark and had a good ambience. Service was just excellent. I loved how the tables had a call button and then they would respond to your call in less than 5 seconds. I had the Kim chee fried rice which was really good, usually I can't really handle spicy food but this one wasn't too spicy and I was able to devour it entirely. I also had the cheese corn which was really juicy and covered with a thick white cheese and it was incredible. Overall food was great, ambience and look of the place was quite special, and service was top notch. Can't wait to come back and try the soju next time.
author: Stephen C.

description:
Enjoyed the Spicy Chicken Wings (not very spicy IMHO).  This is now my chicken wing joint!  The "Spam" stew was disappointing.  It's not real Spam (I know Spam and that wasn't Spam) and there were hotdogs floating in my stew.  Strange and not appetizing at all, skip that one.  The other dish was a beef bulgogi sizzling platter.  Not bad.  I'll be back to try the Whole Chicken.

Open to the wee hours, so that gets an extra Star.  We got there around 8pm and got seated in under 15 minutes.  It gets crowded after 9pm, so plan accordingly.
author: J Q.

description:
Two things to bring when you come: 

1) Wallet stacked with cash
2) Earplugs

Get ready to have your ears and wallets raped.

The food was atrocious at best, except for the spicy cold buckwheat noodle, which was actually passable.

Drunk Korean girl who was at the table next to ours: I can't be more thankful that I couldn't understand you, because if I did, I'd probably tell you to shut your damn mouth, because I could probably hear you from down the block. You were seriously using a 100 foot voice to a girl who was sitting 3 feet away from you! 

Don't come here looking for a quiet place to spend the evening.
author: Ben T.

description:
This place is bomb. It looks like a garage but is an awesome find. I love the kimchee fried rice & wings. 

Wait staff is really nice and fast. I do recommend making a reservation because it gets packed during feeding time!
author: Tam T.

description:
I hate to start off with service, but lets get it out of the way. It's not the best to say the least. With that aside, the food here is great. The wings...they are absolutely worth ordering each time you come here. Actually, if this is your first time here your number 1 priority is to order their wings.

As for the not so good, I'd say the gizzards and the casserole portion. The gizzards were still good, but compared to everything else it was definitely not up to par. It's something I probably wouldn't order again. As for the casserole, it's very deceiving. It looks like you're getting a hot pot that can serve 4 or 5 people, but if that's your intention, you might want to think about ordering more side dishes. If you're a party of 2, you could probably finish it with some side dishes. 

The soju is pretty good. I think of all of them yogurt, mango, and pineapple were the best. Strawberry, although tempting, I wouldn't order. It's not that good. And stiffness, it's one of the easiest to drink and I'm not sure if it was because we had a lot of food, but the soju is on the light side. 

Just a FYI, don't expect to get seated without your full party.
author: Wilson T.

description:
This is our last resort option when we're near Ocean Beach or out late at night. It is a predominantly Korean-filled restaurant and they love to come here to tip back good amounts of deliciously flavored SOJU! It is a very small restaurant but has cute private booths on the side. The menu is straight forward yet has a good selection! The food is what I imagine all of my Korean friends get to have as a hearty and home-cooked meal. It's a great find in the city and reliable late at night! 

WHAT I RECOMMEND:
- cheese & corn
- seafood & kimchi pancake
- kiwi yogurt soju
- kimchi fried rice
- kimchi ramen
- bulgogi 

PROS:
- great food
- clean environment
- open late night (2AM)
- quick cook

CONS:
- small space
- loud crowd if you go late at night
- possible there might be a wait (busy on weekends)

OVERALL: *Thumbs UP!!*
author: Alisha C.

description: I love the garage look and feel, it's definitely different. The staff is decent - not impressed by their service but the food is great. I like their food better than The Spot and Tonight. My usual orders are kimchi fried rice, seafood pancake, tofu soup, and casserole. All equally amazing. Drinking soju and eating good Korean food is always fun in a group setting - about 4-6 people max as it isn't a huge place.
author: Kristen F.

description:
Went here last night for the first time with a group of friends. The different sojus were okay, but the food definitely was ehh.

Like someone else said, it is a small place that has some cute decorations but all in all, very cramped. Most people just stand and wait to be seated in the entrance but this also blocks some of the tables and although there are screens to block the two sides, I think I would be a little irritated if I sat there. The wait time was not so bad since it was a Friday night...we probably waited for 20 minutes at most?

The servers are very nice - 1 star for them! They were cool to talk to...I definitely appreciate good customer service.

On to the food and drinks. They have a wide variety of soju - we got the strawberry, kiwi, pineapple, mango and aloe flavors. At least that's what I think we got. Other than the strawberry, I didn't like the others too much, so that's my excuse for not remembering the flavors. However, they surprisingly have more alcohol than I imagined so if your goal is to get tipsy, these are definitely for you. 

We ordered kimchi fried rice, whole fried chicken and labokkhi (sorry i never know how to spell this word!). I've definitely had better regarding all three dishes. The fried chicken was extremely and ridiculously dry. The labokkhi was very watered down - I can't really eat spicy food but I would rather have it spicy than so watered down that the flavor was just lacking. I don't have something in particular to say about the kimchi fried rice, other than I've had way better.

I don't think I would come back for the food, but the soju was okay and the atmosphere was okay as well. All in all, I think there are better places like this elsewhere that I would rather pay (a lot) for.
author: Cathy C.

description:
We were going to eat at another Korean place, but it was so busy.. after hearing rave reviews we had to try this place but I have come to the conclusion "OVER RATED" 

We arrived right before they opened and there were people sitting in their cars waiting for the doors to open. We were seated promptly in the rear of the restaurant and next to a door that we found lead somewhere outside. There was a cold draft coming in from the bottom of that door.

We were seated with the menus and left alone for a long time to make our selection. After skimming through the menu I wanted to leave.. the usual Korean dishes were absent from the menu and I didn't see anything I wanted to try.. The BF said we should just try it out since we were already there.

Luckily the place has call buttons at each table; we called for our waitress to take our order.

Clam Soup- more like clam shell soup.. though the broth was tasty, the soup barely had any clams in it, but PLENTY of empty shells. We got to the bottom of the stone bowl and there weren't any clams at the bottom. 

Calamari Bulgogi- we asked if this came with rice and they said yes. This item arrived on the table first and we didn't receive any rice until I asked for it. The flavor was good and the texture was on point.- best item we tried

Fried Chicken wings- NOTHING SPECIAL. They fried wings and served it to us.. no sauce, no flavor, just fried chicken

SERVICE: sucks. We had to use the button to call the girl b/c they didn't give us tea until we asked, our settings were given to us in stacks (they didn't give us each a plate, they just handed us a pile of dishes), They weren't very friendly and they just gave a condescending OK if we asked for things.

what the heck is all this hype about?
author: J-nine I.

description: It a nice spot and it's kinda small so plan ahead of time for your party group members.
author: Norland John B.

description:
I went here around 10:30pm on a weeknight, and I thoroughly enjoyed it! The whole "hidden-in-a-garage" thing really gave this restaurant an interesting feel. The service was good. Their soju drinks were decently good, even if they were a little expensive! Worth checking out, though. I was also pretty pleased with the portion sizes - lots and lots of tasty food for a good price!

I am a big fan of places that serve good food late at night, so if you're in the area I'd recommend trying Toyose!
author: Seán O.

description:
I used to frequent Toyose when I was in college yeaaarrrsss ago. My friend and I would go and drink a bottle of soju and just hangout. I've never once eaten anything there. I recently had the chance to actually sit down and have a bite to eat. We arrived around 7 or so and grabbed a seat in the back. There was a large party so it got a little loud and rowdy. 

The wait staff is a little slow. There were only 2 people serving the entire place. For food, we ordered the kim chee pancake, the tofu and kim chee and the corn and cheese. The kim chee pancake was okay. For me, it was spicy. The tofu and kim chee was probably my favorite because I love kim chee. The corn and cheese was literally a plate of melted mozzarella cheese with corn mixed in. It was nuts. Once you grabbed a spoonful the cheese would harden into a ball like substance. Kind of like playdo. The large beer was insane. A huge one fed the two us maybe 4-5 glasses each. 

Great place for eats with a group of friends to dine family style. Wait can be long. Wait staff can be slow too but the food here is pretty darn awesome.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Mmmm, LOVE this place!!!

Came here with a large group (about 11?) and the wait wasn't too bad, though we arrived pretty late in the evening. My girl Elli did all the ordering because she suggested this place. Everything was super delicious! Kimchi fried rice, kimchi pancake, the noodle soups (casserole?), mango soju, and strawberry soju! Mmmm, definitely Korean comfort food. Now I gotta find a place like this up here in the Pacific Northwest...
author: Karen L.

description: Hate waiting in the cold fog/ocean breeze. But recently figured out the coffee shop across the street serves wine. So we wine while we wait.
author: Jane N.

description: Spam casserole in a converted garage! Drunken sake night without regret for sure. The wait could be long but well when else could you tell people you're eating pub Korean food in a completely legitimate converted garage that's made to look like the inside of a fishing boat?
author: Taffany H.

description:
Decent Korean bar with good soju--the strawberry soju in particular was refreshing and tasty. The food is overall pretty mediocre. If you're really wasted you'll probably like the greasiness, but being kind of a Korean barfood fan I was disappointed. The chicken wings were bland and unremarkable (that said I like mine intolerably spicy). The pancakes were serviceable but had a mushy consistency. The seafood stew was fine but again bland with little heat. Kimchi fried rice--greasy and (again) bland.

The servers are heavily made-up and standoffish. Interior is cozy but nothing special, and not helped by the frigid staff. WIth all the great Korean places available in the Bay, will not be returning to this one.

BTW, it's not exactly a "secret" garage place as past reviews have suggested---there's a big "Toyose" sign in front, so to me it didn't exactly have a speakeasy feel.
author: R P.

description: I have had so many good nights at this restaurant/garage, I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place yet. I enjoy the seafood pancakes which is great for sharing and the chicken wings but they all come secondary to the soju. My friends and I have had all the flavors which include: yogurt, peach, kiwi, strawberry, lychee, etc. What we usually do is get one of each and then order seconds of the ones we like. My favorites is the kiwi soju since it is usually thick like a milkshake (but still seedy), peach and yogurt. Like others have said you can barely taste the alcohol.
