Everything about this place has gotten better since the last time I visited, which was about a year ago. The service was much better, staff was very attentive. The food was also better too! It was much more substantial and there more filling! With two guys and two girls at the table, I was almost afraid we ordered too much!

* kimchi fried rice - still delicious.
* whole fried chicken - it was cut up into about 8 pieces and fried - you must eat it right when you get it though otherwise the chicken will get dry.
* corn and cheese - this was disappointing. Nothing special - it really was just like frozen corn, peas, carrots topped with a lot of cheese. 
* spam, duk, sausage casserole - super filling! They put a lot more ingredients in here this time which caused us to happily consume MULTIPLE bowls of this just to finish!
* yogurt soju - c'mon. you have to get a cocktail soju with your meal when you go there. it's practically mandatory.

Definitely a better experience this time. Will definitely be back here again sometime in the future when I have Korean food munchies.
author: Julia K.

description:
Sf- Is this some of the best Korean food you got?

Why can't SF have some decent Korean dining!  Everything was good, but not fantastic.  If you're just looking for a dine and dash place this is a good place to go.  We all shared the bulgogi, seafood pancake, kimchi fried rice, spicy fried chicken wings, rice cakes and the strawberry and yogurt soju.  The chicken wings and rice cake was really good!  The fun thing about this place is that its located in a converted garage and decorated with seafaring rift raft.  Fun place to eat if you live nearby and/or are willing to make the trek all the way out to the outer sunset.
author: Nadiyah S.

description:
This is the best Korean food I've had since moving to San Francisco. The atmosphere and low prices made the experience that much better.

I've been here twice now and both times I've been here it's been extremely cold. Both my friend and I had to wear our jackets inside because it was so cold.
author: Andrew M.

description:
With over 600+ reviews this place is popping with customers. A quick tip: reseverations are welcomed. So call before hand or you might have a 1hr wait ahead of you. 

Funny note: While I was waiting, another patron that was ahead of us went up to a table and offered to take their credit card to the cashier. In his mind, he wanted the table and the slow service wasn't going to stop him from eating.
author: Uland W.

description:
After back for the umpteenth time, I decided to finally review this place [because I finally took some pictures].  Their infamous alias is "the garage", literally operated in lower unit of a house located in a residential neighbor.  

There is plenty of street parking, but sometimes the wait to be seated (especially for big groups - 6 or more) can be up to an hour on busy nights.  What's great about this place is that they open late - usually until 2am on most nights.  This place is pretty pricey for the portions they serve.  They serve complimentary popcorn while you decide on what to order (and you can always ask for refills).

Skip It:
Spicy Chicken Wings - I don't see what the fuss is about...maybe I have a spicy tolerance.  I ordered this on several occasions, neither of which have been spicy.  Its just deep fried chicken drumlettes/wings (8-10 pieces) for $13.  More than $1 per piece, worth it?  You decide.
Corn & Cheese -  It's literally corn, some peas and carrot bits melted in baked mozzarella served in a dot-sol [clay dish].  The crust looks like the top of a cheese pizza. It was too cheesey and overwhelming.  I know you guys might be like WELL THAT'S WHAT YOU ORDERED SILLY.  It was extremely disappointing since I've been meaning to try this dish here BUT it was SOOOOOOOOOOO ridiculously different from when I had it elsewhere.  It felt like something even I could make at home.

Worthy to Order It:
French Fries - seriously, I would not expect to order this at a Korean restaurant but they're pretty delicious!  Good appetizer to munch on while drinking Soju.  Only downer is $4.5 for an order of fries?  The order is pretty small.
Seafood Pancake - traditional Korean staple, not bad.
Kimchi Fried Rice - my friends enjoyed this dish, and they always order it.  It's fried rice with the choice of your meat (bulgogi) served with a sunny side up egg on top.  I'm not a fan of Kimchi so it wouldnt be fair for me to evaluate this dish.
Soju - there is a unique variety of flavors (i.e. Kiwi, Mango, etc).

Service is great because each table has a little bell you can ring for you to get their attention.  Make sure you leave your jackets in the car - I made the mistake of wearing it in and now it smells like Korean foood.  Overall its a pricey place for Korean food (I would prefer eating in Oakland), but I have yet to discover a cheap and delicious Korean joint in SF.
author: Steph L.

description:
Awesome Food! I love the spicy chicken wings and the ricecake in spicy chili sauce! All very well made and very good tasting. Everything else I had (pork cutlet, beef with calamari in sweet soy sauce, seafood pancake) were all very good! 

I have to admit at first I was a little unsure of eating at this "garage", but I am so glad I did!

There have this little button you can push when you need service. The service was very friendly and the food came out decently quick. 

I would definitely recommend this place!
author: Christina L.

description: Initial feelings of this place is what the..it's a garage. Once you enter, it's actually really nice. It's definitely a hole in the wall. You'd never expect this place to be a restaurant, since there's a only a rinky dink sign on the outside. Kimchee fried and fried chicken wings were excellent at night. This place closes late so it's on the top of my list for late night kick it spots.
author: Hans H.

description:
Have you ever looked at your dingy garage with pine panels and thought to yourself -- hmmm, if I stained these walls dark, threw some bamboo shades here & there, crammed as many tables & chairs in the space as possible, I could turn this garage into a restaurant!! -- that's exactly what the owners of this place did.

Welcome to Toyose -- mother daughter homestyle restaurant -- mother does all the cooking; daughter does all the order taking, serving, cleaning, ringing up the bill, dealing with drunks, who knows what else...

I don't get the hype - what kinda people are raving about this place?

The price is outrageous for the portions & selection. C'mon now, I'm eating out of your converted garage - don't I get a discount?? My bulgogi was REALLY watery -- that's not supposed to happen, right? Like isn't the hot grill pan supposed to make everything sizzle? And sizzle is the opposite of watery, right?

I read all the raving reviews here but now I'm thinking - maybe the reason I don't see the hype is b/c I don't have my beer googles on?
author: Cathrin P C.

description: Awesome little garage\hole in the wall. Cramped space and long wait especially Friday and Saturday nights - if you come between 7-10pm expect at least 45mins to an hour wait time. But overall great for soju, tons of flavors to choose from. And their kimchi fried rice is one of the best I've had.
author: Andy T.

description: Soooo over rated and you have to wait! Not worth it! The food was okay! Nothing out of the ordinary and the service was horrible! Never again! I had dinner here for my birthday and my gal friends brought me some bottles of alcohol! I decided to crack one open and poored myself some shots and bam the waitress comes over and snatches it from me and says"ill take that" no sorry we dont allow outside alcohol or nothing but instead told me i wont be getting it back until we left! Not even a corkage fee.... Nothing!!! Happy bday to me!!!! I gave the place 2 stars instead of 1 because the restaurant is actually a garage from a house so i thought that was neat! The food okay!!! Other than that never again!!!
author: Theresa M.

description:
Decent food, unique location in Outer Sunset, open late!

Toyose is a restaurant in a renovated garage...super cozy atmosphere, but if you're pessimistic you might call it cramped. I tried many of the dishes, from the spicy ramen and seafood pancake to the seafood veggie stir fry and spicy tofu soup. Everything was good, but not phenomenal. The prices were a bit higher that I would have liked for the quality. They had a lot of flavored yogurt soju which was yummy!
author: Jenny W.

description: I like the concept, the food is not bad, and the servers are mediocre. But why the hell am I sitting deep inside a outer sunset garage sweating my ass off eating a big ass bowl of korean casserole? I don't sweat easily, and it was very cold outside, so it made no sense to me that I wanted to get naked in a restaurant full of other people that apparently had more common sense than me and stayed away from the casserole in the back of the garage. I will be back in the future, but please sit me near the door because I don't want another episode of that again..
author: Eric C.

description:
Came out on late Wednesday night/Thursday morning and the place had a steady flow of people. 

We had kimchi fried rice and the tofu stew along with a bottle of soju.  Food was good but I felt it was quite spendy for what it was.
author: Linda W.

description:
I've been coming here for YEARS... I don't know why I've never left it a review. This is the place affectionately known as "the garage" to many people. 

It is a great place to chill if you are tired of hitting the bars and just want to have a drink (or two or three or more) and good conversation with friends. It can get rowdy sometimes depending on the age of the "large groups." 

All food here is way overpriced so I wouldn't come here for dinner but something to munch on while drinking is fine. like a casserole of hot dogs, spam, instant ramen and random veggies for $30?? i don't think so. The kimchee fried rice has shrank in size over the years but that fried egg on top gets me to order it every time! The bulgolgi here varies, sometimes it comes out moist, sometimes dry. Pretty much everything else is fried -- fried chicken, croquettes, fries, potstickers, etc. 

But like I said, I come here for the drinks. They serve OB here in the pitcher sizes -- the boys love that. The girls and I particularly like ordering the yogurt and strawberry soju and pour them half/half to get a strawberry yogurt drink. ha! One of the new(er) cocktail soju they have is the aloe -- it's way too sweet. You can pass on that one. You can also pass on the ginseng/chamilsu drink that comes in a teapot unless you really want to get plastered. lol. 

The staff has also changed over the years but they have all been quite friendly and quick to get what you need.
author: sasa w.

description:
Three words. 

Kimchee Fried Rice FTW!
author: Kalok L.

description: I came here on short notice with my bf during a weeknight. It wasn't really busy so that was good. We were seated shortly when we came in. Ordered a couple of my favorite korean food -Kimchi fried rice and seafood pancake. Also ordered the tofu pork dish. I used to think their kimchi fried rice was so good but that was years ago. I thought that it was not so good and pretty flavorless which was a total bummer. The seafood pancake was good though and I really loved the sauce that it came with -just right and not too salty. The tofu pork was not so great and pretty average. It's kind of sad but I think the highlight of our meal was the beer. Customer service was good but I don't think that's enough to have me come back though.
author: Carmen L.

description: Came here for a late night dinner. Ordered the Kimchi Fried Rice and Grilled Mussels with House Sauce. I shared the fried rice with my boyfriend, but we both felt we could each finish a plate by ourselves. The Grilled Mussels came with a heavenly creamy sriracha sauce that prompted me to lick the plate clean. I would come back for a late night snack, but I wouldn't come here for a proper dinner.
author: Jenny C.

description: What a meal.. Excellent food and exceptional service. I love this place! Not too fancy nor too expensive just priced right.
author: Zeke M.

description: I am very disappointed with Toyose.  After hearing how great their food is, I left disgusted.  I love seafood.  Their seafood tasted like it came from the gutters and there was no good flavor on all three dishes of the food.  It was quite disgusting they didn't devein the shrimp.  I love Korean food, some of my best friends are Korean with families that cook Korean cuisine every day.  I don't know what they're cooking with but the ingredients lack flavor in a major way.  Not to mention, I felt nauseated afterward.  Their shrimp tempura should've been popping with flavor but as soon as I was eating it - very bland.  It was very clear that they use ingredients and proteins that are deeply subpar.  Now that it's the following day, I awoke feeling like I've eaten dirt masked by a high price tag for their dishes.
author: Moni K.

description: Craved something spicy so ordered the "spicy seafood with vegetables." Spicy was no where to be found. Just a bunch of octopus in red and sweet sauce. Probably 3 small shrimps and they cut one piece of green mussels in half. Total fail. I rather drive across the bridge to east bay and go to my moms so she can make me actual spicy korean food.
author: Ella A.

description:
A restaurant in a freaking garage. 

The best thing about this place is the buzzer on the wall to get service. Need water? Buzz. Want to order more yogurt soju? Buzz. Want to go on a date with the waitress? Buzz.

It didn't work out.
author: Brian C.

description: I absolutely love the kimchi fried rice! Probably the best I've ever had thus far. I knock off one star for the service. I sometimes catch the girls rolling their eyes after a request for more water or something small. Other than the kimchi fried rice, I really like their chicken wings & seafood pancake. The food is a bit pricey here, but I don't mind it. They really need to improve on their service though!
author: cadence p.

description:
For Korean food, this restaurant was only ok. I tried all of the recommended items (kim chee fried rice and seafood pancake) and they were alright, not anything super amazing. 

The Fried Chicken was super flash fried and it was pretty delicious but I wouldn't still, this item alone woudn't sell me on this restaurant. Additional items tried were the seafood noodles which tasted normal. What  I really did like was the yogurt soju though. That was very smooth and refreshing. 

Thay only take 2 credit cards for large groups and does not take AMEX.
author: Roger L.

description:
Feeling hungry and thirsty at the same time? You can drink soju all night until you realize you're pretty drunk then order some spicy korean foods to satisfy that rumbling tummy of yours.  You may initially think that you're already drunk and high before walking into this place because you'll think you're hallucinating and seeing a house instead of a restaurant.  

The food is pretty tasty and satisfies your cravings for carbs. It's a fun place to hang out with friends. #12, #19, and chicken wings!
author: Cheryl Q.

description: It was my 21st birthday when I came here and I came with some friends to get the Yogurt Soju which tasted good but pretty much was like water and won't get you messed up. I liked the Kimchee fried rice with spare ribs which was bomb. I also like the fact that they give you popcorn with your alcohol. So pretty much it was a good experience for me. I think this is also called "The Garage?" I'm not sure but anyway this is a pretty chill place.
author: Jeromy G.

description:
I recently got take out from this place and just as a warning to those who are considering it.  DON'T DO IT !!!! well at least don't order certain things from their menu.  

DO NOT ORDER: 
1. rice cake with noodles - by the time we got the order and started eating it, the rice cakes were stuck together and sauce was almost dry. not very tasty.

2. garlic fries- the cheese harden and the fries were soft and mushy.  not yummy!!!. 

WHAT DID SURVIVE :

1. seafood kimchi pancake- tasted just like how it would have tasted at the restaurant

2. kimchi fried rice - still yummy. but a little cold which was expected.  

OVERALL: i love their food but not take out!!!! it just does not taste the same
author: JY L.

description: The whole fried chicken was so good and it didn't take that long to come out. Seafood pancake and budeh jiggae were also good. Wait can be pretty long.
author: Xteethx B.

description:
Came here based on reviews and ordered the fried rice and the chicken.  It's okay.  
Service was prompt!
author: Dorothy L.

description: The sesame oil made my japchae and my boyfriend's spicy calamari with noodles taste so good! The service was a bit slow but there is a red call button on the wall of every table. Press it! Arriving at 6pm it was quiet, but around 7pm the noise level went louder and louder. I really love the decor, it gives me a warm feeling as if I am at home which is misleading since I am inside a garage! What makes this place even better is that they have a clean bathroom!
author: Cindy L.

description: I am addicted to their spicy pork, the kimchi fried rice and the seafood pancake. This place is divine! Casual but popular, open till 2am and often full. But so worth the wait, the food is absolutly delicious.
author: Caroline C.

description: Quaint little spot. Usually get the seafood stew, kimchi fried rice, kfc and have tried all their flavored sojus. All good. Long waits.
author: Elaine L.

description:
Yum!! delicious kimchi fried rice and i  like their seafood casserole - it's like korean hot pot, if you are concern of spiciness, take out the jalapeno  before the pot starts boiling :)
didn't really like the yogurt soju but it seems popular, me and my friends liked the mango soju better!
P.S. it does get really.. really loud sometimes! ( you know... when people starts getting drunk.. :P )
author: Jenni C.

description:
This place brings me back to college summer of '06 we would come here every other week to hang out, drink soju and play drunken games. When we had nothing to do we would kick it at "The Garage" (nickname for this place since it looks and feels like you're in a garage)

It's funny I came used to come here so often, but I can't remember what the food tastes like. I'm sure it's decent enough for us to keep on coming back :)
author: Flavia H.

description:
I've been to this place a few times and each time i'm left extremely satisfied. 

The most recent time, I was smart and made reservations so we didnt have to wait a hour just to get seated. My party of 4 got seated right away. We ordered the kimchee pork tofu soup, spicey chicken wings, seafood pancake, and fish and rice cake w/ ramen. We also got a bottle of strawberry soju, but only cuz a friend of mine, who also happen to be dining here, saw us and ordered it for us as a treat.

Everything was delicious! I can handle a little bit of spicy so I thought the spiciness of the dishes were perfect. The strawberry soju was really yummy too and you can barely taste the alcohol, which was perfect for our table cuz none of us really drink. I wanna try the kimchee pancake and kimchee fried rice next time.

The only thing that I was disappointed about was our meal didnt include rice and they give us only 4 side dishes.

The place is really small (literally a garage) so either get there at 6pm when they open or make reservations.
author: Jean T.

description:
Soju+wine+a bowl of pop corn.
ask for some extra cups and bring some dice and get a game going!

ORRRR, garlic cheese fries and baked mussels, snack it up.

Maybe next time I'll come earlier so I can be hungrier to try more of their korean foods and late night snacks. Snacks are medium priced..can go from $4-$10.
author: Janelle H.

description:
I like the cool atmosphere of this place. When my friend and I walked in here, she really enjoyed how it was inside their garage and the nets and lighting and everything.

We ordered the kimchi fried rice, a chicken dish (don't exactly remember) and strawberry soju. The soju made everythign go down really nice and the food tasted like home-cooking (well neither of us are Korean but I can imagine it being LIKE home-cooking!) It was a pleasant experience and I'm sure we would be back again as it is a pretty nice hangout spot at nighttime
author: Wilson T.

description:
I've heard many good things about Toyose so I had to finally give it a try. I called around midnight and they first told me it would be a 20 minute wait which was totally fine but before I could end the call, the worker told me it would actually be 45 because they had reservation... At that time I was already 5 minutes away. So what else can I do? When I got there I couldn't believe it was literally a garage turned into a restaurant. Pretty cool if you ask me. Right when you walk in you just get this chill and laid back aura. We took our orders while waiting. 

We got the fried chicken wings, Seafood pancake, kimchi rices and calamari with noodles.

And let me tell you... For someone who's scared to try different types of food... It was like a Korean man cuddled with me after feeding me all day long. 

Although, one of the worker rushed us to finish and pay... I must say that the wait was totally worth it.
author: Bernie S.

description:
Fun place to eat with a group but get there when they open unless you like waiting. Which seems to be the favorite pass time of San Franciscans, based my experiences at the DMV today and walking past Tartine, Bi-Rite Creamery always. 

Kimchi beef fried rice with egg, spicy pork, seafood pancakes and mango soju were the things I remembered most fondly once recovering the next day.
author: Will R.

description: This place is just amazing. If you want to have great food and great service i suggest to come here. Its always hot and ready to go. Its prepared fast and has your taste buds rushing. You have to try their soju as well its deleicious, the peach is my favorite.
author: Alex S.

description: We got there at about 6:10pm, so we were able to get seated right away. I'd suggest people to go right when it opens because it got crowded pretty fast. Surprisingly, the menu didn't have kalbi, which is a usual at most Korean restaurants so I ended up getting the kimchee fried rice with beef instead and some strawberry soju, as suggested by other reviews. I'm glad I listened because it was so so so tasty. I can't wait to come back in the near future and try everything else :)
author: Gabrielle S.

description:
I gushed to my friend that this was the "best Korean food I'd ever had" when I first tried the kimchi pancake and kimchi fried rice here. 

This might have been a greatly hyperbolic exclamation from a starved student who was caught "in the moment," but upon retrospection and now with my belly full, I will stand by that statement. This place won me over due to taste as well as my perceived novelty of the items offered - they were unlike any other Korean dishes I'd tried (well, not to say that I have extensive experience - "Korean" to me usually means bbq and tofu hotpots). Regardless, it was savory, succulent, and so darn delicious!

From the outside, this restaurant is extremely easy to miss. Its nickname of "The Garage" is fitting and a perfect clue in the hunt for this place. Once inside, however, the place is surprisingly spacious, homey, and comfortable. It works great as a location for an intimate dinner or for a gathering spot for slightly larger parties. The food, as I mentioned, was delectable, and I have Yelp to thank for that since I had followed previous reviewers' recommendations. To echo them: It is a must to try the specialty "pancakes" and kimchi fried rice here!

The service was decent, although the staff will make it obvious through tactics such as politely placed bills, clearing off of the table, inquiries into your comfort, and surreptitious sidelong glances if you happen to overstay your visit. I don't consider this a blemish on my experience, though; there was a line of people waiting to be seated which I had not noticed at the time, and it was understandable for them to try to hurry us out. However, consider this a fair warning to you all who expect impeccably tactful service.

All in all, I'm definitely looking forward to returning and trying more goodies!
author: Amy T.

description:
I honestly don't see what the big deal is here...The food is definitely over priced. The portions are small except for maybe the soups but everything else is just ridiculous. I like the fact that they're open til 2am so I give them one star for that and another star for the cute decor and how its a garage converted into a restaurant. But I have to agree with one of the other yelpers saying how this could be a potential fire hazard. It's really stuffy inside and the service is not memorable.

I ordered the spicy chicken wings and the kimchee fried with beef. I have to admit the spicy chicken wings were pretty good but foreal? $12.95? For like 8 pieces? I can go to a chinese restaurant and get something similar for like 1/3 of the price. And it wasn't even spicy at all. Where was the spice? The kimchee fried rice was alright. The portion was really small and again, WAY overpriced. My sister ordered some tofu soup that had calamari and shrimps and it. I think it was worth it to get that though. 

The customer service was very blah... the reason why I deducted so many stars was because when we entered, there were 2 other people waiting ahead of us. The girl looks at me and my sister and asks "how many?" and we say "2" she goes "the wait is 20 mins" Ok, so I have no problem waiting but when we finally got seated, my sister noticed that the back room had like 4 tables that were empty. So I turned around and looked and I was like "WTF?" I mean yah maybe they were reserving it for a large party or something but it was like 12 midnight. Really?? The least they could have done was put a reserved sign on the table to let other customers know that its being used for later on instead of letting people question why the fuck we have to wait so long when there are clearly 4 tables NOT being occupied.

I'm assuming they are known for their drinks but I'm not much of a drinker and also there were so many obnoxious people who were drunk and burping like it was the thing to do. It seemed like if you ordered drinks, they seemed to serve you better. I'd really rather go to Drunken Sushi on Clement. They're open til 2am!
author: Fran N.

description:
It amazes me that I never knew about this place until my friend took me there about a week ago.  This is by far the coolest garage I have ever been in.

When you see the place from the outside, it's easy to assume that Toyose would be some sort of dive bar, but it's quite the opposite.  Upon opening the door I was immediately impressed by the interior decor and the amount of people crammed in there having a good time.  I couldn't hear any of this from the sidewalk, which probably explains why they can stay open until 2am.

The food was delicious.  The sake was delicious.  The popcorn?  Not so delicious.  It's almost like they serve you those stale cardboard-tasting popped kernels to set the bar low so when the actual food comes, you're like "Damn!  That's good!"

The doorbell for each table is the coolest thing i've ever seen in a restaurant.  It makes the lack of attention to the table more preferred than the traditional "how is everything?" walk-by every ten seconds at other places.

The atmosphere of the place along with the interior decor had me forgetting I was inside someone's garage out in the boonies of the Sunset.

Since discovering this place a week ago, I am making trip number three to Toyose tonight with some friends.  I'm not sure what it is about the place, but it almost encourages conversation at meal time.  There's no sense of being rushed, as if time doesn't exist any more.  Then again, it could also be from all the hot sake we drink...
author: Alex S.

description:
I can't come up with much that hasn't been written before, but I mostly use this site to keep track of where I have been, so here we go:

The seafood pancake was amazing

The fried chicken wings were good but not unique.  It was like mini KFC and could have used some sort of sauce

The kimchee fried rice was good, but better the second day stir fried with a couple of eggs and some hot sauce for breakfast.

The sake was poor quality but cheap.  I'll go with soju next time.

Attentive service and food came out quickly.

They only take reservations for groups of 4 or more.
author: Quinn S.

description: Went here the other day.. first time checking out a korean spot in the city... needless to say san frans offerings of korean spots were a let down. I came n checked this place out.. first thing i noticed.. whats with these random spots on dead streets.. aside from the location and being in a garage..waited with my friend for 20mins to get a 2 person table.. in the middle of the cramped space. Alright so.. sure its a unique experience.. so i wanted to give it a try. Was in the mood for some kimchi jjigae and got a soju. The service was just service.. nothing more nothing less. Well.. got the kimchi jiggae.. i can just say.. kimchi jiggae is never suppose to be so sweet.. what? It tasted like they dumped a jar of sugar in it.. didn't stay too long. Just asked for a check..  paid the over priced bill and tip n left. Not sure if I'd go back. Being generous with 3 stars..
author: Nate Lucas Park O.

description:
Who would have thought a good restaurant out of this garage?! Seriously, my friend wasn't kidding that it looks like a garage and that is why she refers to it as "the garage." 

After a night of disappointment, my friend took us here for dinner. I would say, this was the highlight of the night.

Great food + Great friends = AWESOMENESS!!!

To start off, they give complimentary popcorn for appetizer. Pretty cool huh?! I thought it was weird but at the same unique.

My friend and I split two entrees for variety. We had kimchee fried rice and kimchee pancakes. I must say, they were GOOOOOD! Both were a bit spicy, well duh, they're both kimchee. The kimchee fried rice comes with a sunny side up egg on top. And the kimchee pancakes are pretty thin and yummy. It comes with its own special dip as pancakes have its syrup. Mmmmmm. Very fulfilling. 

They also have variety of soju. We had the yogurt one. It was fantastic! You can't even taste the alcohol content. It reminded me of those little milk-like bottles called Yakult. Mmmmmmmm!!!

And oh, they're open until 2am. So after a night of happiness, and you're looking for some good grub, this is the perfect place!
author: Abby M.

description:
Small restaurant, this place is in a garage!
Food is good, kinda reminds me of SoCal Korean food. Noise level was high because people were drinking. 
We had spam ramen casserole and cheese corn.
author: Coco L.

description:
I hadn't been here for at least half a year, the food quality changed big time.  Maybe we have a big party and they are a little overwhelmed with what we have: 

1. #52 - i think is called dry favorite or something like that.  It is good snack for drinking,  not a good idea to share it with 13 people, that means one piece per head, and the whole plate is almost gone

2. sizzling beef - normal - not as good as brothers or korean village

3. casseroles -  normal -  i asked them add pollock when I made the order and they came back to me saying there is no pollock after they made it. 

4. Seafood pancake - normal - nothing special

5. chicken wings - good - very spicy and tasty

6. Whole chicken - bad - dry and taste like safeway chicken

7. Kimchi fried rice - good - the one and only plate that never fail is this one plate, best plate i ever had 

8. Soju - we tried lemon, peach, kiwi, yogurt, strawberry, and mango, they all taste good, but my personal favorite is peach.


not recommended for large parties, i think party size 6 and under is best for this place.  Expect to spend at least 30 per person.
author: Wasabi L.

description:
Open from 6pm-2am, this is a really good place to come for casual Korean dining. This restaurant is literally a garage amidst the restidential neighborhood of Sunset near Ocean Beach. 

Coming here on a Sunday night with a few friends, none of us had any drinks. Instead, we opted to just eat simple Korean comfort food. 

We ordered:
1. Kimchi pa-jeon (kimchi pancake)
2. Seafood casserole
3. Whole fried chicken (not rotisserie whole chicken, but rather a whole chicken hacked up into many pieces and deep fried)

I LOVED the kimchi pancake. It was so yummy. It's definitely my favorite dish out of all we ordered. 

The seafood casserole is a spicy soup with veggies (tofu, zucchini, mushrooms) and a plethora of seafood (shrimp, blue crab, squid legs, mussels, clams, fishcake), cooked on our table on a portable butane stove.  It was pretty good, we even got  some udon to throw in the boiling hot pot.

The fried chicken was fried well (very crispy without heavy breading), but lacked flavor. The most enjoyable part of that dish was the side of "moo" (daikon) we got. Reminded me of eating Tong Dak in Korea delivered to my cousin's house at 2AM. *sigh* Nostalgia!

The bill came out to be $14 per person (5 people total) including tax and tip.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Horrible service. Came in and no service what so ever. We sat there for a good ten minutes and no server approached to greet us. Another couple came in a little while afterwards and got seated before us.   We wanted to give Toyose a try, but after that first impression, we're never coming back.
author: Curtis G.

description: Let's Eat! ......Love the movie..... Love the food...... Love toyos.....We ordered yogurt soju, beef casserole , beef kimchi fried rice and  kimchi tofu.... Delicious! Nice ambient environment....a block from our house, lol....
author: Ben B.

description:
Been hearing about this place but never try it out til tonight.
Gotta say they are pretty amazing with food quality. We had Kimchi fried rice and Fish egg hot tofu, both are super delicious. Kimchi fried rice taste is just right, and hot tofu broth is really tasteful. 

My girlfriend also like Mango soju there. Definitely a great place to eat and get drunk.

Only thing I would complain about is the service. But it wasn't too bad since there is Happy call button.
author: Scott B.

description: Greasy, fresh, good ingredients.  Kimchee pancake was madballs.  Hite beer "bottle" is bigger than my head, pitcher is the size of a two-litre coca-cola.  Chicken wings were crisp and meaty little guys, good meat.  The space is kitschy and very neighborhood apropos -- ship themed!  Not too shabby for someone's garage in ocean beach.
author: Hillary C.

description:
This place is awesome. It's inside a garage that's turned into a real restaurant. They play korean pop songs all night long. This place gets pretty packed at night on weekends. The good thing is they take reservations. Make sure to make one or suffer waiting 30+ minutes.

The kimchi fried rice and kimchi pancakes are great.

The soju cocktails are mixed nicely here. Some other places I've been to seem to just pour the soju in then the flavor without mixing it. 

I've tried all their different casseroles and haven't found one that I don't like yet.

The garlic cheese french fries are great to try also.
author: Steven B.

description:
Bad service... seriously... very bitchy and the laziest waiters that I've seen in any restaurant. I went here few times before. The last one was around 11.30 pm around 2 weeks ago. Right after I came in, and waited to be seated (even when they were only 2 tables occupied) I smelled that fishy smell. Eeeewww.... almost run off but I was hungry and craving for the kimchi beef fried rice. I put up with the rude service and left with bad picture in my head. When I was eating, the two guys next to us was talking and laughing with both of the waiters... this is okay... until these two waiters start to drink soju shots with them. Gross... where is the level of professionalism? 
Their Seafood kimchi soup was very salty and sour without any seafood flavor in it. Gah...! For the price that we paid, we don't even get any banchan (side dishes)? What kind of Korean restaurant is this? 
No Galbi too? I'm outta here!!!! 
Order to go for Beef Kimchi Fried Rice. Problem solved!
author: Icey M.

description:
Great place to hangout with friends, eat, and drink. It's a good idea to make reservations because this "garage" is tiny and fills up quickly. We ordered a bunch of food and everything we tried was pretty good. It's probably the environment, but the food definitely has a very cozy/homey feel. Maybe it was the cod and tofu soup on a cold night, but my stomach was very happy.

The flavored sojus were delicious as well...strawberry, lemon, peach, yogurt, cranberry, pineapple....mmm..mmm...You'd keep drinking because it tastes so good and wouldn't even know you're drunk. And at $11 a bottle, it's a bargain! And when you're out of soju, just push the nifty service button by your table to ring for the waitress to bring you more.
author: Joyce W.

description:
wow, everything here is soo good! the peach soju has a crisp sweet taste! the casserole is especially nice on a cold night. The one i had contained chunks of sausages, spam, kim chee and ramen noodles. The fried chicken was seasoned nicely, but a little too burnt for my taste. 

overall, very good. I would recommend making a reservation before coming. since it's a converted garage, the space is a little tight.
author: Connie M.

description:
YUMMY YUMMY YUMMY! It's another HOLE IN THE WALL, Korean style. If you look at it from the outside...based off of it's appearance, it looks like a garage (that's why it's aka The Garage). Once walking into the place, it reminded me of staying at one of those cabins in Tahoe- full of wooden frames for the walls yet lit with lamp lights. Passing through some tables, you enter a bigger room (at most seating 30 people?) with ONE or TWO windows. 

If you plan on doing a candle lit dinner, I would not recommend this place, it get's pretty loud like going to an Irish pub. 

FOOD RECOMMENDATION: 
-SOJU- they have various selections of soju from the menu, very fruity (maybe watered down) but if you don't usually drink too much, they may give you the buzz feeling. 
-HOT POT w/ RAMEN- it's pretty cool, you can share this with another 1-2 people since the portions are pretty generous with this dish. 
-BULGOGI- Their Korean BBQ Ribs are soaked in flavor. 
-SEAFOOD SOUP- YUMMY!!! This is LOADED with tasty ingredients from shrimp, squid, vegetable, clam...you name it! The natural taste of all the seafood you can have in this pot is well worth your money.
author: Eudora Z.

description:
Good food and interesting that it is located inside a garage.
Service was decent, but weird that you had to use the bell button to call staff.

Unfortunately, we were seated near a large group that liked to talk about pubic hair for some reason. Not a point against the restaurant, unless they frequently have customers like that.
author: B M.

description: The soju here always makes me happy. However, the service on the other hand needs some work. Our waitress literally ignored us the whole night. I was not a happy camper.
author: Jenn Y.

description:
This review is strictly for their service.

Horrible...

Waitresses are so forgetful! I had to ask more than 2 times for both tea and the sake we ordered. 

I wouldn't come here by choice. I've been to many other Korean spots, like The Spot on Taraval that can provide 100% better service and I can bank on their food being better too.
author: Christina T.

description:
This spot's been around as far as I remember for last 15 years.  I was frequenting it a lot more a decade ago when I didn't care for the distance for drinking.  10 years later, lots have changed including me not drinking as much. But one thing that didn't change was the awesome recipe this place has for their food.

It's located on Noriega close to the ocean (like a block away) and it's located in the middle of residential area and the door looks just like a garage door. Behind it is the heavenly realm of soju and good foods. It's not that big but it can accommodate different size of groups. The look inside has somewhat of traditional asian feel to it. Most of the seatings except the back has their own booth setting so you can have some privacy.  It's a typical Korean bar setting where you sit down at your own table, order drinks and food.  So if you are expecting a bar scene, it's not the right place.

Most of their food is awesome. 
Ones I usually get are:
- Wheat noodle on a big plate with veggie and beef slice with gochujang (chilli paste) sauce : Jeng Ban Gook Soo (their flagship food)
- Fish cake soup : Ul Deng (One of the bests in the bay imo)
- Sea snail with veggies and gochujang (it's pretty spicy which is the way I like)

On a cold night when you need some hot side dishes and soju to fire you up, this is the spot. Also if you wanna have a relatively cozy setting where you can talk while drinking with your friends, highly recommend this place.

Most times there is a line and you need to wait. Couple weeks ago when I went there, they said they take reservation for the group of 4 or more.
author: Kyu K.

description:
A: let me ring the bell! I want to ring the bell!! Ready to order? cause I'm going to ring the bell!

*DIIING DONG*

Yes, they have a service bell. Amazed by most but don't let that steal your attention! It is the kimchee fried rice, kimchee pancake and seafood pancake that I go for. Best in town until proven otherwise.
author: Jenny K.

description:
This place is a pretty good Korean restaurant! It's a restaurant inside a garage of a house, and it has this Hole-in-the-wall feeling. Came here with friends. Ordered the Beef Kimchi Fried Rice, which was pretty good, but not as much meat. We also ordered the rice cake soaked with pork in kimchi sauce, which also tasted pretty good.

Finally, we had the cold buckweat noodles with pork and assorted vegetables, fruits, and two variations of cold pork. It may cost a lot (~$20), but it's a VERY BIG dish, enough to serve 4-6 people. Expect it to take about 30 minutes to make.

Overall, the food was good, and the ambiance was good. I will definitely be coming back here sometime soon. But...they're only open for dinner. And definitely make reservations or come early, or you'll have to wait!
author: Henry P.

description:
This place is amazing. I am talking about super delicious and affordable Korean food. That right there is a beautiful combination. 

It is easy to miss this place if you are driving by. You kind of have to know what you are looking for because the front of this just looks like a regular house. I am dead serious; the entrance door is next to their garage door. It's like going over to your best friend's house to eat dinner and drink soju except for the fact that they charge you money and make you wait to be seated. Other than those two things, it's pretty much the same thing!

They serve up the best kimchi fried rice in San Francisco. I am talking about buttery and spicy goodness. Plus this dished is topped off with a fried egg and seaweed. Man just thinking and writing about this dish is giving me some serious cravings. I can't wait to get married and put on sympathy pounds in support of my pregnant wife. I would probably eat this dish everyday once that time comes to pass.

My friends and I also ordered the dukboki, which are rice cakes served in a spicy soup. They kind of look like lifesaving flotation devices. In a way the duboki here does save your taste buds from drowning in an ocean of blandness and boredom, so I guess the comparison is appropriate.

We also ordered up a basket of the seafood tempura. There was definitely enough tempura to go around. The pieces were literally overflowing from the basket. The pieces were very big and meaty (you definitely weren't just eating fried batter).

Man this place is just too good. Everything I've ever tried here has been on point. I am definitely coming back here again and again. The kimchi fried rice by itself is worth the trip here! There are so many other items I want to try and eventually will try. Just like an old friend I haven't seen in a while, I will always have room at my table for Toyose's kimchi fried rice.
author: Allan Y.

description:
The only thing that i like in this restaurant is the soju. the food taste average. i ordered the pancake and i forgot the rest.. basically the good thing about this restaurant is that they open pretty late!

CONCLUSION = NOT RECOMMENDED!
author: Aris L.

description:
First of all, I would recommend calling ahead since there really isn't a lot of seating - after all, it's someone's garage! It's a little loud and the interior is dark so just keep that in mind before coming along here as well. It was a little confusing walking in here knowing what to do - the waitress did not exactly welcome us in since they were really busy but try to look for the waitress station and make sure you get your party on the waiting list. 

Other than the beginning of our visit, the service was good. We ordered an assortment of dishes and it was definitely yummy. 

Kimchee Fried Rice - delicious and I think it should be a rule to always order an egg with it. We had some fried rice leftover and it made great leftovers!
Ddukppoki - I'm always picky with how these rice cakes are made. I love them when they are just the right consistency and chewiness. This was made well and I enjoyed it. 
Kimchee Pancake - This was a great addition to our meal and something that helped fill us up. I realized that our meal didn't consist with any meat at all but when your full of kimchee, what else matters? :)
author: Tracy Joy K.

description:
A: "Hungry?"
B: "Yup"
A: "Okay, let's go to the garage"
B: "Huh? The garage?.... What's that?"

Yup, "the garage" is what Toyose is known as. In fact you may already know that and it's taken you this long to figure out their real name (cause that happened to me)! Oh the memories here, but I'll keep that between me myself and I. 

Okay, so their food. It's delicious. Here's what you HAVE to get:
1) Kimchee fried rice
2) Seafood pancake

I also really like their dok bok ki (rice sticks with fish cake) and their calamari and beef bulgogi are both really good as well. I guess you should also try their soju.... many flavors to choose from. 

And if they get too busy, there's a doorbell (YES! A doorbell!!! Isn't that cool??) that you buzz to let the waitresses know you need something. Thanks Jenny K. for bringing me here over 5 years ago!
author: Eugenia G.

description:
I like this place. 
U sit down, u eat some, u drink some. it's a great social thing, very common in Korea. 
Try the Aloe Soju, it's light and easy, so is the yogurt soju- $11 i think.

The fries are delish, chicken wings are Ehh... the cold buckwheat noodles with veggie tapered around it were good, the casseroles are decent and great for big groups.
author: Miss J.

description:
Eat + Drink + Play = Yay!

I used to come here almost every week. Lately not so much but I still make a monthly appearance or so.

This place gets super crowded at night and wait time can be up to over 1 hour. I like coming here because it's a nice place to sit down and hangout/catch up with friends. I prefer this place over some other Korean bars in the city because they have better food and location has very convenient parking.
author: Jenny M.

description:
Oh how I love, love, love Korean food. I've been wanting to try Toyose for a while after reading Yelp and hearing about it from my friends. We made a reservation for a party of 6 so the wait wasn't long at all on a Friday night. The decor on the inside was a lot nicer than I expected btw. Anyway, we ordered the kimchi fried rice, dukbokki with ramen, fried chicken, seafood pancake, and kimchi jigae. We also got peach soju and yogurt soju. I was really surprised at how fast the food came. I think it was the quickest Korean restaurant I've ever been to. 

I liked everything we ordered, especially the seafood pancake. It was fried perfectly with the right texture and thickness. Everything else was good, but not better than what I've had at other Korean restaurants. I admit though that I was a little sick so I might not have been in the right food state of mind. For now i do prefer Shin Toe Bul Yi more, but they don't have yogurt soju. The peach and yogurt soju were pretty good. It's $11 a bottle, which is cheaper than other places, but it's also smaller. The taste is worth it though, especially the peach soju. I really want to come back here and try the casseroles they have. 

If you're worried about parking, it's not too bad. As for the wait, i recommend getting a reservation; otherwise, you'll be waiting a while.
author: Annie C.

description:
Seriously good times, good drinks, and good food. The perfect combination to making wonderful memories with some of your closest friends.

Came here with a nice small group of 7 for a birthday celebration. Being quite hungry, we ordered a nice chunk of food that included the spicy fried chicken wings, cheese and corn, the kimchee and seafood pancake, fried rice, tofu stew, garlic fries, and some egg omelet bowl.

And oh, don't forget the soju. Peach, strawberrey, aloe, mango, lemon. Double-digits of shots later, we were all feeling good and toasty. Special shout-out to the mango soju, which is always a delight. And the aloe soju is surprisingly tasty as well.

The space inside is small and somewhat cramped and there's only one bathroom, but it does make for a more intimate and friendly feeling than you would get with other places. Here, you could drink, be loud, and laugh without inhibitions. That to me is the ultimate experience for when I'm out with friends.

Good food, good drinks, good people. Let's do it again.
author: Tom P.

description: An excellent way to end the night..or refuel to make it to drunk brunch the next morning. The fried chicken has so much flavor and is crisp. I like how it isn't saucy. Beware, wait a minute before ingesting...or else you might end up with 3rd degree burns. The kimchee fried rice is a nice complement to the fried chicken. Both are a must...only thing is wish they were a little bit cheaper and they stayed open longer. I guess here is to hoping for miracles.
author: Eve C.

description:
I came here about or month (or two) ago in celebration of a friend's birthday.  From the outside, it looked like some dude's garage.  Maybe that's why this place is sometimes nicknamed "The Garage."  

Once you step inside, it's like you're entering a whole other world.  Well, it's not like you've just walked through the Pearly Gates or anything, but it's definitely a very unexpected atmosphere behind what appeared to be a garage door.

To Order:
Some Random Noodle Dish
-Honestly, it was tasty but also very generic.  It didn't exactly stand out as something to write home about (or even write on Yelp for that matter!).  In short, it was forgettable... which is exactly what happened.
Vegetable Tempura
-I couldn't believe that they deep fried parsley... PARSLEY!  How the hell do you do that?  I dunno, ask Toyose.  They somehow pulled it off and made it tasty.  

For celebratory purposes, libation of choice?  Soju!  We had Pineapple Soju, which was quite flavorful.  It was very sweet, almost suspect with how its alcoholic effects would creep up on you while you're drinking what seemed to be a very innocuous juice - of sorts.  

They have this button that summons the wait staff to your table.  At this point, who cares about customer services and waiter / waitress quality.  Hell, if you have that button, and they have a 15 second response time, you're golden.

I enjoyed my time here with friends and staff.  4 Stars
author: Johnson N.

description: We had few people recommending this place to us and we finally decided to give it a go few nights ago. Most Koreans never heard of budaejjigae (spicy stew with beef, sausages, kamaboko, rice cake balls and ramyeon noodles) before but I was surprised this place actually had it in their menu. It was delicious and their yogurt soju cocktail hit the spot. *The plus is they're open until passed midnight.
author: Erik And Sarah Z.

description:
I've been here several times before in the past and I remembered the food was great. However my previous visit because it was Halloween night, the service was lacking. They gave us a table an hour before its reservation so it was a mad rush. We ordered the chicken wings (which is ok nothing special). Their "casserole" which is confusing because it comes out as a soup. And one other dish that I forgot since it wasn't that memorable.

The set up was cozy and cute but even if it was Halloween night, I can understand the mad rush but not the food. The food was okay. I don't think I'll come back. I prefer Omagari for Korean and it's closer to home.

The one special unique thing about this restaurant is that it's built right into a garage.
author: Hayden P.

description: the whole fried chicken was super dry, i wouldn't recommend at all. i rather do popeyes or kfc anytime over this place :(
author: JessePanda C.

description: OMGOODNESS. kimchee fried rice and the garlic cheese fries are the BEST drunchies. This place caught me off guard because of the location but none the less, the food is just too good. Also had the mango and peach soju. The peach one is a must try. Can't wait to be back!
author: Marilyn W.

description:
This place brings me back lots of memories,. especially from my younger years.

My friends and I call this place, the *garage*.  If you're driving down Noriega, you wouldn't even notice Toyose as a restaurant.  It's literally built downstairs of a house and the restaurant is located inside the garage.  Once you enter the door, you would hear hip korean pop music and the tables are also sectioned off where you get your own privacy.  Def a great intimate place to get to know your date a little better, with some korean food and soju to loosen you up. The decor reminds me of eating in a jungle, with ropes hanging off the roof and the walls being held up by tree trunks?! 

Anywho, my favorite dish is the kimchi fried rice, the spicy udon seafood noodle, chicken wings and seafood pancake.  Strawberry and yogurt soju, yummmmm! 

This place can get a bit pricey, so if you're wanting to splurge for some korean food,. this is the place to be!
author: Chanel L.

description:
I like this place....good food and great drinks...korean style bar food....but you can also get full meal....yummy :) 

Plenty of parking - it's outer sunset guys.....:)

FYI..they don't open until 5:30 or 6pm - last time I checked.
author: ji k.

description:
It can get crowded so make sure you make a reservation if you have more than 5 people. 
The food is gooooooood!! Haven't come across any bombs yet. 
The kimchee fried rice is really good, I highly recommend it.
author: Hirokazu S.

description:
soju, kimchi fried rice, carrousel, fried chickens, spicy rice cake...
I like the fruity soju and the kimchi fried rice but others are only okay. Good for sharing but the place itself doesn't support such a large gathering of friends. Make sure you have a reservation or you're going to wait for a long long time... The place is good for a fun party with friends such as me and my friends for last Christmas party but for a meaningful conversation? Avoid at all cost. The noise level can be quite frightening for little children
author: Cliff T.

description:
Wow - Finally learned what this place was called. All my friends refer to it as the "Korean garage place in Sunset". Anyway, I love this place! It's too bad that it's SO small that it deters you from going. The wait is usually pretty long, but I'd have to say, the food and soju is worth it! I love the big pot of ramen, which they call "casserole". It has spam and hot dogs in it so you can't really go wrong. I also love the gizzards. Everything else I've eaten here has always been good to great! Their "service" button is a nice feature, too. The waitress popped up within seconds each time we pushed it.

Tip: There's an Irish bar across the street, Flanahan's, where you can kill the hour or two wait.
author: Freckles H.

description: hoping for something good coming here.  my wife and i got here early at 6 and got seated quickly.  ordered the clam soup, kimchi fried rice and jook pal.  was not overly impressed w/ the food or the atmosphere.  clams were sparce in the soup, about 8 total w/ 1/2 a stalk of green onions, 2 pieces of fish cake and broth.  for $13 bucks i sort of expected more.  kimchi fried rice was good.  jook pal was somewhat bland even w/ the sauce.  i definately had better korean food elsewhere.  if your looking to have a good dinner, probably not the best choice but if your looking for a place to drink soju, beer and snack, this could be it.
author: larry s.

description: Very simple place but the food is excellent!  My wife and I are very picky on foods, everytime after we dine out, we compare our notes and rate from 1~10.  I would say 9.5!!!!  Next time we will try the hotpots!
author: Jerry P.

description:
I would come here more often if they were less crowded.

Service is excellent thanks to the genius call button at ur table

So when i get i here
I order a pitcher of flavored soju and an extra bottle of my girlfriend's bottle "fresh" chum chu rum soju. Fill half soju glass with chum chu rum and them other half with flavored soju. As u finish 3/4 of both bottles then start eating. 

Get the boo dae chigae spam hot dog casserole 
Bean pancake
Fried chicken not for me
Kim chee fried rice is good but will mess up my soju challenge. Too much food

This place is always packed so it's a fun place but also annoyingly loud I u r sober

I'll be back...
author: DOM d.

description:
Food is decent. We ordered all of the more popular items and nothing made me want to stuff my face... Maybe if I was inebriated, things would be different. 
kimchi fried rice: come to my house, I make it better
seafood pancake: pretty good, the sauce is dead-on
fries with cheese/garlic: very ordinary fries
chicken wings: no bueno

Overall, i think its a cool place to hang out with friends over some small eats... when drunk...
author: Emily T.

description:
Authentic Korean home-cooked style. Not your typical Korean BBQ place. What's really good? Get the Korean style kimchi pancake for sure, it was the best dish there. The seafood hotpot was really good too. Spicy fried chicken was delicious. Probably worthy of a top 5 Korean restaurant in SF and I doubt many will disagree. I'm also pretty sure that the people that give it a lesser rating are not even Korean. You know who you are. I mean, we are in SF. How many Koreans live here anyway? Like 10? Most of them live in Berkeley.

Anyway, Toyose is bomb.
author: Tery L.

description: Tried this place for Valentines day and it was really good! We came in at around 5ish and they just opened but the place was already packed! We waited around 30  minutes. Place is realllllly small and I saw how the host/waitresses/busser was rushing to get to every customer i felt so bad cuz she was the only one working!!! We ordered the fried chicken and kimchi fried rice and they were both so yummy :) i love a good fried chicken so crispy and juicy. Kimchi fried rice was also good i was a little hesistant in the beginning since im not a big fan of kimchi but i liked it a lot :)! Will come back to try their sojus!
author: Trisha B.

description:
Was here a while ago for a quick bday bite some months ago. The food is fantastic! I recommend the fried chicken and kimchi fried rice. It's so good that I'm still craving their kimchi fried rice. The yogurt soju is also good and not diluted at all. 

They take reservations. The place is tiny though so my group still had to wait with our reservations. Overall, its a nice cozy place for drinks and food with a small group. Will hopefully come back soon!
author: Kim P.

description:
I'm going to give this place 5 stars even though it was insanely loud the first time I was there. (you can't blame the restaurant for annoying frat boys and 20 somethings).

Eating here was *almost* like eating at home. Even though everything was just a little bit different from how my mom cooks (eating out can NEVER be as good as homecooked korean from mom!), it was pretty damn good. 

I had: Kimchee fried rice, Kimchee pancakes, Spicy kimchee stew with hot dogs and spam (yep), egg bake (I have no idea what the american word would be for this). 

Everything was delicious. I can't wait to go back there again to try some of the other home style dishes. There isn't BBQ, just homestyle food, so if you want to try something a little different than what you're used to having at korean bbq restaurants, I recommend dropping in here. 

Oh and make a reservation, we called in a table for 4 luckily, an hour before we got there on a Wednesday night. It was insane!
author: Joanne D.

description:
Finally found a place that does Tong Dak slightly resembling what they served at Koko House in Berkeley. The chicken was on the dry side though, and the thigh meat seemed to be missing. The pickled radish was great though.

Dukbokki was okay, served with ramen. The sauce was pretty standard, and it comes with fish cake, carrots, and cabbage. I tried asking for chol myun but they didn't seem to have the chewy noodles I love with this dish.

Bulgogi was pretty sweet, not the greatest I've had.

Only four plates of panchan, the two plates of cucumber and napa kimchi were good. No refills were offered.

This spot's probably a good neighborhood spot, but not destination worthy for me. 2am closing time everyday is awesome though.
author: Derrick V.

description:
More like 3.5, but I'll give it 4 because I'm korean. ;)

The Drinks: 
My friends and I are always in the mood for their flavored soju drinks. They are delicious and are def. 'creepers.' The yogurt, peach, and mango are my favorites. They are made so you can't really taste the soju that they add in them. You can't forget the 1.6L bottle of OB beer too (or is it Hite? .. whatever all the same to me) 

The Food: 
This place is supposed to have food that you'd normally eat while drinking. I really like the chicken wings, korean pancakes (with seafood or kimchee), kimchee fried rice, and these casseroles served in big pots with spam, hot dog, tofu, ramen noodles, and rice cake. Everything is pretty tasty - and it does go well with your drinks! I also tried the corn and cheese, which was oddly tasty. 

Its a fun place to come at night to just hang out with a group of friends and drink/eat. It can get pretty loud in there as groups of already half drunk parties stumble in. Its open till 2am almost everyday too so it makes it a perfect place to come and drink even on a weekday. 
Oh, i also love how its in a garage!
author: Tim B.

description:
I love restaurants that look like shacks, warehouses, or moving vehicles. Somehow, it just makes the food taste a lot better. Thanks to Toyose, I can now add "garages" to this list of desirable restaurant exteriors.

The restaurant is quite small and you need some luck to not get put on an epic wait list. My favorite items are the kimchi fried rice and seafood pancake. I had never had seafood pancake before, but people on Yelp said it was good so I had to try it. It's a bit on the salty side, but WAY WAY WAY on the delicious side, so it evens out. Everything I've ordered there has been genuinely delicious.

I think this restaurant is a bit on the pricey side ($10-15 for entrees and you probably need 1 entree per small person to get full), so I can't see myself coming here all the time. It is a great place to bring someone new to the city who wants to experience the non typical SF scene i.e. epically foggy residential Sunset.
author: Joyce Man H.

description:
My appreciation for korean food lately has been going up, and I've finally found a place up in norcal that can help me appreciate it more.

This place certain doesn't look like anything resembling a restaurant, and walking up to the place can certainly fool you into thinking that you're intruding someone's garage.

Besides that, besides the random bowl of burnt popcorn they give you to munch on, the food was awesome. They also have several flavors of soju, which is a great way to get a night started.
author: Allan G.

description:
Not sure what the hype is about this place. Maybe it's the soju? We didn't drink, so this review is based purely on the food. 

We ordered the kimchi fried rice, seafood pancake, and spicy chicken wings. While the kimchi fried rice tasted good, it came out lukewarm. The only thing that was hot on the plate was the fried egg on top. The seafood pancake was waaaaay too mushy. No where was it even slightly crispy. Maybe it was undercooked. The spicy chicken was not spicy at all - in fact, didn't really taste like anything and it was looked like it was over-fried. 

The location and atmosphere is really cute, however. It's tucked away behind what looks like a garage door in the Outer Sunset, but the inside resembles a really cool treehouse where people come and hang out. But sadly, the food will prevent me from coming back.
author: Cee J.

description: I m craving for hot soup especially in a cold, wind SF. My fd and I went there around 8. Surprisingly, we don't need wait and there are also few tables available. We order a spam stew pot, beef kimchi fried rice and chicken wings. The spam stew pot is good! It's big for two people. There are spam, sausage, kimchi, tofu and ramen inside. It tastes really good, hot and spicy is always my favorite. For the kimchi fried rice, I think it tastes ok. Nothing special than I expected. The chicken spicy is pretty good, but I expect it is more spicy. And I like it comes with some cole slaw on the side.
author: Cynthia P.

description:
This place is good for their Korean Hotpot!!! Worth the money and enough to feed 4 people.
The chicken wings and the cheese and corn is really good... I always have to order this when I come in. 
The only thing is not to come in on the weekends cuz it is packed and you would have to wait at least 30min to 1 1/2 hrs. until you are seated.  If you want to eat early and not wait... I would advise to come in when the restaurant opens. 
This place is like a little hole in the wall. You wouldn't believe it is a restaurant. A house turned restaurant that is not seen around the sunset anymore.
Soju are good here... So you gotta try it!!!! 
The cool thing about this place is that you don't have to wave the waitress down... You just press the button on the wall and the come running to help you. Lol...
But it is an experience to try... ambiance is like going to Korea....
author: Valerie A.

description:
Been here twice and the place is a great hang out for Friday/Saturday evenings.  Good soju, yummy kimchi fried rice and huge caseroles!

the favorite soju is yogurt and they have so many varieties of caserole and various plates.  the more people the better because the portions are large!

the garage of a house got converted into a korean restaurant... how brilliant!  be sure to get there early because it starts getting packed aroung 9pm.  you can also try and make reservations... the place opens at 7pm on friday evenings so be sure to call right away to reserve your spot.  :D

my most recent visit was with a few other ladies and for 4 people the total bill was around $20/person.  no damage at all for a whole evening of fun.

fyi... you WILL smell of spicy food when you leave!!!!!!!
author: Sandy L.

description:
First checked this Sunset garage out in the late 90s, a great spot for late night snacks, soju, hite beer.  Couple years later, the charm and intimacy took a dive when hordes of teeny boppers started going in hordes of 20-30 playing card games and cha-mui.  The place has gotten too commercialized over the years.  

I have sinced moved out the Sunset and looking for a soju place in the bay that provided the intimacy and downright 'garage' feeling Toyose use to exude.  

recommendation:  If you find to flavored soju to be somewhat bland, just buy a bottle of straight soju (jinro/chamisil) and mix it in...couple bottles of hite is good too. . . 

Lots of memories were made at this place during my college years and years after.
author: Max L.

description:
Just your average Korean soju bar. Food was okay. You would not want to go here unless you lived in the vicinity.

Ambiance - fairly crowded, lively, and clean bathrooms. 

Fried Chicken wings - a bit over fried and stale.
Dduk Bok-kee - not as flavorful as others, Korean friend said it was okay.
Strawberry flavored Soju  - tasted like they used real strawberries.
Yogurt-soju - too sweet.
Hite - the old standby.

There was this guy in a blue shirt that offered to let me go first for the bathroom. At first I thought it was courteous of him, but after I came out, I realized he was bathroom stalking a girl in our party. Way to go.
author: William H.

description:
This place is pretty indiscriminately placed and redefines the phrase "hole in the wall" because it is located in a Garage type...place? Referred to fondly as "The Garage" by regulars I had a hard time finding such a Garage that served food on Yelp. Lo and Behold here it is! And it has a real name!

Went here last night for a late night bite with some friends. Table of 4 seated quite quickly in the AMs. Kitchen was closing in 10minutes so we ordered fast and all the food (including to-go orders) came out really quickly. I was a little worried about the quality not because of the sketch place (inside is actually quite nice!) but because the waitress seemed pretty rushed and angry - well we were sitting down and ordering pretty last minute - but everything was pretty tasty! I got to try a variety of their specialities including their fruit infused Soju- we got mango-, spicy rice cake and noodles, seafood pancake and udon seafood soup. All were pretty tasty. 

All-in-All I say food is good, service is so quick you don't really care about that "required" smile or friendly demeanor at such an unreasonable hour from anyone - let alone somebody from the service sector haha. Soju was okay, I think The Spot's (on taraval) soju is better.
author: Tracy N.

description: If you're planning on coming here without a reservation on a Friday night, don't bother unless you're willing to wait two hours minimum (and that's with people ahead of you leaving around the 1hr mark). Other than that, the place is really cute inside with nice lighting, screens for privacy (since the people waiting can literally be standing right next to your table), good decor, and a helpful call button for service. The food is okay, the portions are huge so family style makes the most sense, but we didn't get to try the stew or soju. Still, this places looks like a great place to meetup with a bunch of friends and have a good time. I'll definitely come back with a DD next time.
author: Trisha K.

description:
How did I take so long to finally step in to this place?! I've discovered Toyose a while ago, but I've always been too shy to go in there myself because it looks so exclusive disguised as a garage. 

But the is THE garage. Inside, it's very cozy, like a cave; a magical cave disguised as a garage. They are also open until 2am EVERY NIGHT OF THE WEEK, which makes it all the better. I came here on three occasions recently and every time has been pleasant.

The first time my friend and I joined our friend for a few drinks with his coworkers to celebrate his 21st birthday. A waitress promptly comes with a shot glass and half-pint for us to drink with. We tried the pineapple soju and yogurt soju. Yum yum. I had already ate that day so I didn't get to try the food, but it looked delicious.

The second time, I went there on a Saturday and this place was packed! We were told it was going to be an hour wait, but my friend and I had nothing to do so we decided to wait it out. They took down our name and number to call us and we left to kill time. To our luck, we got a table within 20 min! We weren't too hungry, so we just ordered their fried chicken (~$13 ?), since we noticed a lot of other people getting that, and pineapple soju ($11). These chicken wings and drumsticks were pretty damn good! Better than the ones from those dessert places. The bill between us was about $30 which I thought was fairly pricey for just fried chicken and soju, but sooooo goood.

Third times the charm and I had an awesome time here, even though I got there at 1:20a on a Sunday night. Everything looked so good, but the kitchen closed at 1:30a so we had to decide quick. The waitress was very polite about informing us about this and we finally decided on #3 which is this calamari and vegetable dish with noodles ($13.95 + $3 if you add noodles). We also ordered a bottle of plain soju, peach soju and yogurt soju. The waitress probably thought we were crazy order so much alcohol when we only had 30 minutes to finish it.. but we did! Well, she was super nice and she actually let us stay until about 2:15a and didn't hurry us out too much so kudos to you for that.
author: Helen Z.

description:
Ohhhh, Toyose. How can I not have reviewed you before?

Being a lover of all things Korean, I made Toyose one of my first stops when I moved to the Bay Area. I took the Caltrain up from the Peninsula, hauled it out there on the N Judah, and walked about 15 blocks in the freezing wind and crazy fog when I got off at the wrong stop. But when I saw that glowing yellow chicken sign, I knew it was definitely all worth it.

You've got a special spot in my heart, cause this is where I first had that amazingly delicious yakult soju that has since become a staple in my drinking diet. I don't need that little soju glass that comes with it, just give me the whole bottle. I promise it will be gone in a few seconds.

Your fried chicken is consistently tasty and much better than the over-hyped San Tung.

Your seafood pa jeon is loaded to the brim with water-dwelling critters. And even though I'm not the biggest fan of squid or octopus, you make it find a happy home in my belly.

And that tasty tofu with sauteed pork and kimchi is the perfect way to wash down the slightly undelicious maek ju flavor that's all too common in my mouth. 

I wish you weren't so crazy crowded. And I wish that you were about a billion blocks closer to my apartment, cause I absolutely despise relying on the Judah to get to you and back.
author: Monica C.

description: Can't remember if I already tattles on this alt Korean youth hangout, but go and join the kids for great food and fun. Seafood pancakes til dawn
author: Fred  D.

description:
So I kept hearing about this place throu my son's auntie..oh how grown up u are now and drinking...lol! So I tried out the place and finally found time to catch up on my reviews.  I must say the strawberry soju is really good.  Not as strong as I would like it to be but very good and the kiwi is pretty tart.  I tried the pot stickers and the beef bulgogi with squid.  The cheese fries which a friend suggested.  

Pot Stickeres- i found to be alil lacking on flavor.  After being spoiled at Arang i cant go anywhere else for pot stickers w/o comparing to theirs.  Sorry...
Beef and Squid Bulgogi- It acutally works...its pretty tasty i would probably order this again.
Cheese Fries-- U would think it would be good right but ehhh...i dnt think i would order this again.

But i do love the fact they give u bowls of popcorn while u wait. Unfortunately they dont really give u lil plates of ban chan at this place.  

For sure I would go here to drink and hang with friends but would I go here to eat...not really... I have other favorite korean places to eat that are much better. 

Its geared to more the young sf state college students...but for sure I will go back for the flavored sojus...
author: Christine M.

description:
The novelty of being tucked away in a garage barely compensates for the expensive and less-than-generous dishes.

The atmosphere at Toyose, with its private booths and festive lights, is great for a party of around five.  The restaurant's close proximity to the beach makes it a convenient option, especially with the promise of piping hot and spicy dishes clearing away headaches caused by watching a sunset in the whipping winds.

Although the dishes we ordered, which included the kimchi fried rice, kimchi stew with spam and hot dogs, and bulgogi, were tasty, the portions were too small to warrant the price we paid.  

The kimchi fried rice was my favorite dish, but the amount was only enough to satisfy three people.

With the five of us sharing four dishes, we still paid almost $20 each. 

Since I am not made of money, I would think twice before reconsidering Toyose.
author: Andrew M.

description: One of my fav spots to hit up when with a small group of friends. Key word is small because if you have 6 or less people, you are automatically put into a small booth. Only able to get a big table if you have more than 6. Therefore, if you roll low, 4 isn't a bad number. Besides that it is really cool. It is located in a garage and the food is very fresh and fast. I personally like their Korean fried rice and yogurt soju. They have a huge list of different soju so there is always something to try out. If you like Tonight Soju, you will def dig this place. A big recommendation is to book a reservation. The wait can suck.
author: Sonlay V.

description:
The place is ridiculous. It's small, it's crowded, it takes a long time to sit down and eat, and not to mention, parking can be a problem at times.

Do I like it here? HELL YEAH I DO

All of that is SO worth the trouble of eating at Toyose. I believe they converted the garage and lower portion of the house into this restaurant, but what a great idea too! The seafood pancakes are to die for, same as their spicy soup thing that they have (I forgot the name). It definitely "enlightens" you sinuses. The spicy chicken wings are very zesty, and add to the experience of eating at Toyose. 

It's in a small place, but it gets really loud in there. It's a GREAT place to bring all of your friends to, and remember, the more friends the better, aka the less you have to spend, since you split up the bill :D)  

All in all, get there early, bring friends, bring lots of money, bring a big appetite, and bring a smile on your face. It's worth it.
author: Ryan B.

description: My friend brought me here once during the night, it was freezing outside. We had some korean food here. I was a bit surprised the place was underneath a house. The foods were good depending on what you get on the menu I think.
author: Serena Z.

description:
Yum! It's hard to notice this place, because it looks like it is someone's garage. 

The yogurt soju was delicious, and the Kim Chee Pancake was probably one of my favorite dishes. I came here with friends and we ordered the spam and hot dog ramen in spicy broth. So tasty! Definitely too large of a serving for 3 people though!
author: D C.

description:
