We didn't finish it.  Definitely too much for two people.  That one had a little spice to it that definitely crept up on me.  The chicken wings were good and not spicy at all.  I contemplated getting some of their flavored soju, but then I'd be the only one drinking and that would be too much for me.

It was an enjoyable meal and a very cute spot.
author: Kris L.

description:
SO YUMMY!

Must try:
Chicken wings
kimchi fried rice
#19
soju ($7 for a whole bottle! and they make it themselves!)

and a bunch of others. I have not found a dish I didn't like! 

service is pretty good considering its only 1 or 2(on busy nights) waitresses for the whole place, and they have this button you can press to get their attention. 

This place is always crowded, especially at night since they open till 2am! 

I found this place very odd at first because it doesn't look like a restaurant from the outside, but the inside is very nicely decorated and everything.

Negatives: expensive
author: Erica L.

description:
This place is definitely an experience.  After reading how popular it was, I expected a huge line out the door but it was not the case when we went last Friday night.  The restaurant exists in the outer sunset and you wouldn't really even know it was there if not for the small sign outside.  The door wasn't even open and no one going in or out so you wouldn't expect a restaurant.  But as we approached there were business hours posted and we opened the door... Wow - this place was packed and full of people drinking, eating and just being merry.  5-stars for fun and atmosphere for sure!

In my opinion, the BEST thing to get here was the soju.  We had the strawberry and the mango.  A huge bottle is served for the price and the flavor is so fantastic (like fresh squeezed juice) that you can drink a lot of this stuff pretty easily.

That being said, I don't think the food is as good as other reviewers have thought.  We had the bulogi, kimchi fried rice, kimchi pancake, seafood pancake, eel, fries and chicken wings.  The food was so-so and the only thing I'd want again is the chicken wings, very yummy.  The boys said the eel was also good but I don't eat eel so can't really give an opinion there.

So I would want to go back, not for the food, but for the good drinks and good times!
author: Carly P.

description: It was bomb.  It was authentic and I'm not even big on Korean, but the Katsu was top notch.
author: Farrell W.

description:
My first time coming here with my boyfriend for our anniversary was not the best experience. However, I'm not one to let one bad experience ruin my image of the restaurant forever. I came back here last Friday with my coworkers and it was better this time, mostly because they all knew what to order. 

We came right at six and were quickly accomodated to our seats. They recently hired a new girl since she was shadowing them and it delayed the service. However, it was not yet busy so we didn't mind the wait. I also love the free popcorn and small appetizers. 

For a party of 11, we order kim chee fried rice, fried chicken, potstickers, casserole, bottles and bottles of soju, and pork. It was all delicious but my favorite was the kim chee fried rice and potstickers. The casserole was actually enough for us all, though we probably would have liked more as far as portion size. The chicken wings were a hot grab at the table and it went so well with their side salad and the sauce. The mango soju was the best! I also liked the peach soju. They are sweet so for those who of you like it strong, you probably won't like it. The kim chee pancake was not my favorite, it was too heavy and should be kept at a lighter taste. 

I'll definitely keep coming back!
author: Connie C.

description:
The Garage!  I love this place.  So good, so good.    Yes, it's out in Timbuktu, but it's worth driving to the Sunset.  It literally looks like you're entering someone's garage (hence it's nickname), but once inside, I don't care if they serve food on a rusted rim, because the food is AMAZING!  

The spicy chicken wings with the cold radish is probably my favorite.  I usually order the same thing:  a spicy soup, some sort of app and lots of soju.  I even like the popcorn they serve with the drinks.  Reminds me of KoKo's (when it used to be around).   It has a very bar feel to the place.    No BBQ pits on site.   Just a bunch of drunk twenty-somethings getting their grub on.  

The hours are funky, I know they're open for dinner, but not for lunch.  And if you go on a Friday or Saturday night, the wait can be really long.  One time, I waited for an hour.   But, it was well worth it.
author: Soo Jin K.

description: Thumbs up for kimchi fri rice. Okay for the seafood pancake. Kiwi Soju really good. I felt the seafood pancake at Soju Bar is much better.
author: Alex K.

description:
When my BF is not home, I like to do some really naughty things.  Like eat forbidden foods.  One such forbidden food is, and consistently has been: Korean.  I don't know why.  He's such a stubborn ass.  I've tried and tried, I even tried making it at home with "safe" ingredients and less spice, and marinating the meats myself.  The minute the food is labeled Korean, he can't stand it.  

Well, tonight was such a night.  Not only was the BF away, but he left me his car.  Yes.  Little Asian girl in Big White-man SUV car.  It's as bad as it sounds.  

Lou and I pull up here after finding parking on the street in front of the ... crazy school?  after school day care?  smallest school ever?  I see signs up on the wall for 6th grade, 7th grade, 8th grade.  

It was about 6:30pm and we were properly hungry.  The place was nearly empty except for this soul-searching musician who sat in the "private" booth and read sheet music while drinking soju.  Right after we were seated, this group of 4 high school student come in and are seated in the same area.

Maybe they did things differently in Berkeley, but when I was in high school, I didn't have money to eat at places like Toyose.  It's not French Laundry, but it sure is not UC Berkeley eatery places.  This is real sit down, leave a tip, eat with utensils type place.  Classy, if you will.  The inside of the this garage was tastefully decorated in a nautical theme.  Think "Lost" Korean sea-side fishing village theme, hanging nets, cork floats, driftwood.  It didn't feel like a double wide parking place at all!

Back to the high school kids.  Maybe it's an Asian kid thing but they talked about their grades the whole time.  And they were not dorky looking Asians like I was, they were hard core ring-wearing, pierced ear, spiky haired, school cutting high school kids.  Who got an A on the midterm but then got a C in the class bc they never showed up.  

Food ordered: Korean seafood pancake, fishcake and rice cake in a hot sauce saute, fried spicy chicken wings.  

Our mistake:  I think the food would have tasted better with copious amounts of alcohol.  But then I would have had an even harder time driving.  

It was all really tasty.  I liked the Korean pancake.  It could have been a bit crispier.  And the fried chicken wings were a tad small.  I'm used to the south bay 99 chicken-drooling-messy-eating-lick-my-finger-salt-and-pepper-give-me-more.  The fishcake and rice cake had an excellent texture and seasoning.  There was the option to have it with ramen and an egg, which we did not exercise, because there was already so much food.  

After about 30 mins, I threw in my napkin.  However, Lou had been in France for a month and this was his exodus.  So he ate everything left on the table except for 1 lonely little rice cake.  It sat in the hot sauce, crying, begging for acceptance.  No one touched it.  

Final thoughts: would come back here with many more people.  And order much more to drink.  Prolly not the place to drive to but there's public transportation somewhere.
author: Christina C.

description:
The Garage, aka Toyose, is a cool little place for SF folks looking for some Korean food.  It used to be the "best" Korean food I'd had until I went to a spot in Maui.  The food there was just as good as Toyose, but half the price!  The only problem would be flying out to Maui each time I wanted some Korean.  

Kim Chee Fried Rice, Pot Stickers, Bulgogi are all banging.  If you like those pancake things, the seafood and green onion pancakes are good, too.  I've come here a few times and just had soju and hite.
author: ROB L.

description:
If you ever get a craving for some spicy Korean snack foods or some Asian style fried chicken, and would like to bring your night owl friends who have no reason to get up early in the morning on a weekday, this is a great place to go!

Everything I had there was pretty tasty, and the spicy level wasn't watered down either, there was definitely some beading of sweat on my nose... :)
author: Sophia F.

description: Girlfriend introduced me to Toyose as great Korean food served in a garage... which it is. My favorite dishes so far are the Kimchi fried rice and the seafood/kimchi pancakes. Wash it down with some strawberry soju and hit the beach next door. I only wished that Toyose would be able to some how expand to fit more than 10 tables. Must be saving quite a bit of money on rent, though.
author: Charlie V.

description: Because the food is so good, I can't seem to give it less than 4 stars. The kim chi fried rice, chicken wings, rice cake plates and the SOJU are all so good. I don't think you could go wrong with any of their dishes. The portions are on the small side and the little plates don't help as you're trying to pig out but it keeps you from over-eating I guess. The place is kind of pricey and the wait may be kind of long but the food is worth it. Sadly, you're just going to have to leave with a thirsty wallet and a full stomach.
author: Chris T.

description:
My girlfriend told me about a Korean Restaurant in the city that is called The Garage....so I went ahead and yelp'd it and made my way over there.  I phoned in my order for pick up.  We ordered the korean fried chix wings and korean fried rice.  I must say both orders were really tasty.  The wings were very crispy and juicy and had great flavor to it too.  The kim chee fried rice was yummy with a kick to it.  My only complaint is it is kinda pricey for the portions that you get.  The waitress was nice enough to pack me up some small dishes to go on the house :)

I loved the fact that front of the restaurant looks just like an ordinary garage than you open up the doors and ta-dah there is the restaurant.  Almost like a "secret" restaurant.  I will come back here again and eat there and try out some of their other items.
author: Tammy N.

description: I really liked the casual, cozy atmosphere here. The food is good but not amazing.
author: Olivia P.

description:
when u think about flavored soju, Toyose is the place! This hidden place is located in a real but resigned garage in sunset area. To me, this place is more like 3.5/5 because I think their portions could be bigger. However, the environment, music, and business hr are totally good for the young crowds. 

For ppl who are looking a place to go late at night with friends, believe me, toyose is better than bar! you can order some spicy food with their flavored soju, i guarantee u will have  a good time!     

Recommendation: 
spicy cold noodle (big dish, good for 3-4 ppl)
kimchi pancake
spicy rice cake
fried chicken    
Bulgogi KimChi Tofu (big dish, good for 3-4 ppl)
Yogurt soju
kimchi fried rice
author: Kevin T.

description:
I've been here a few times already and sometimes it can get pretty crowded. So I would definitely recommend arriving early. The food here is pretty overpriced for what you are given, so I would recommend eating here for a late night snack or something instead of dinner. Also, the flavored soju is pretty good and they offer a good variety of them too. We had the mango flavor, but I also liked the watermelon flavor which I got last time. I would also say that each bottle contained 12 shots each.

Give this place a try when you are hanging out with a group of friends late at night after dinner.

Free popcorn is also a plus.
author: Nick L.

description:
I've been coming here to drink and eat merrily with my friends for a long time now. I love this place. This laid-back built-in-a-garage restaurant is so homey to me and I've had many good times here.

I love the kimchi fried rice and the seafood pancake! 
And of course the flavored soju. I've pretty much tried all of them and I enjoy them all. Yogurt is always a fan fav.

A little pricey, but the food + drinks are totally worth it.
I like this place a lot better than The Spot on Taravel. I think the food and the atmosphere is way better!
author: Jamie W.

description:
Food is ok but they get the extra star for being opened till 2 in the morning daily!

Expect bar food and nothing fancy. It is a hangout joint for young'ins and those late night pigs, like me. I usually order chicken wings, stir fried octopus and chicken gizzards.
author: Katie K.

description:
Awful food.

......and the Oscar for the worst performance by a waitress in a leading role goes to - the freak-a-zoid who waited on us!  She couldn't / wouldn't answer a question, and if we lingered for more than 30 seconds on something, off she stomped.
author: Cinnamon Z.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night. The place was packed with a couple of large groups. The crowds get pretty loud, so its not the best place to come for a one on one expecting to have a conversation. This place is literally in the garage/basement of a house, which seems pretty funny. There didn't seem to be many open windows visible so it seemed somewhat stuffy as well. 

The food.. I had the munchies and wasn't in the mood for alcohol, so we only ordered two plates of kimchi fried rice and a plate of kimchee pancakes. The food was good and the kimchi in the dishes were pretty spicy, but it didn't seem worth the $45 we ended up paying.

Overall, by the looks of it, I'd rather suggest this place for the (soju) drinks and as a place to hangout with a group on a late night.
author: Nancy L.

description:
I always forget this place has a real name, besides the garage that is.

I come for the chicken wings. Great late night snack and I guzzle down some yogurt soju to get the night going. Yogurt soju is my favorite because it reminds me of my childhood. Minus the soju.
author: Pearl P.

description: I think people come here to drink, more than to eat... At least my friends and I do.  It's all about the soju!  The menu is filled with yummy, greasy food, like kimchi fried rice, chicken wings, and onion pancakes... Perfect drinking food!
author: Anne A.

description:
This is definitely not your typical Korean restaurant (it is a bar inside a garage after all).  So if you are looking for Korean BBQ, go somewhere else.  Anyway, boyfriend picked me up from work and we decided to go out for dinner last minute.  Of course, I turned to my trusty Yelp and came up with Toyose.  We got there around 7pm on Wednesday, 5/5/10.  Since a lot of people raved about their Kimchi and Beef Fried Rice and Spicy Chicken Wings, we had to try those.  The Kimchi fried rice was delicious and my favorite dish out of everything we ordered.  The rice was cooked perfectly and each and every morsel was deliciously seasoned.  On the other hand, their chicken wings were just alright...definitely not as good as everyone claims they are.  Boyfriend and I both agreed that the wings were not spicy at all (maybe you need to ask for it extra spicy?).  Anyway, we also ordered the Spicy Rice Cake with Fish Cake and Potstickers.  I've never had that anywhere else and it was very different from what I imagined it to be.  I've eaten spicy rice cake from Korean supermarkets but those were always dry.  This one was super saucy and the sauce was kind of sickening after a while.  Also, I learned that I prefer my fish cake plain (banchan style) and not stir-fried in sauce (but I digress).

Overall, the food deserved 3.5 stars.  Service was pretty minimal as well.  The two girls working there never bothered to check in on us.  They didn't even bring out the banchan until we were almost done with the fried rice!  After tax and tip, our bill came out to almost $50...so not worth it!  I think I'll just order one of those big casseroles next time instead.
author: Katelynn L.

description:
To tell you the truth, I don't remember much about the food.  However, if you want a little taste of Seoul, "The Garage" will take you there.  They had mouthwatering flavored soju.  They actually use a strawberry puree and mix it with the soju.  LETHAL!!!  

I do think it's funny it's a garage.  For the longest time I had no idea what the name of the place was.
author: Robin H.

description:
Long time no yelp!! Haha okay:)

First of all, i gave 5 stars for their setting.
The place is very cool, unique and warmth.
And the first i went in, I fell "Damn, I fall in love in this tiny garage Korean restaurant."
After I tell one of waitress who dresses very nippy, my name and how many people which is only two, me and my mom and wait for the seat!!!:D
Hmmm... after 20 mins... Hmmm... Finally people come out, yayyy my seat is finally coming....
Waitress:"Kim? Kim? 3 people? Oh okay, follow me.
My mom was like, wait what? This group of people are come later than us!!
Okay fine, they might get a reservation. And I keep waiting for 10 more mins..... No one come out..... And 5 more mins... A group of people come out again!! Yayyyy!!
Waitress come to the door and I am waiting for her yell out my cutest name.
"Jessica? 4 people?"
"Wtf, what?!! Is not my name??"
"Kary? 2 people?"
Okay take a deep breath, finally i can enjoy my dinner in a lovely Sunday night-_-

For those all, what I think is the waitress will serve the more people first, I am not sure but yea.
If I could call for reservation, I would rather do that. Because It's very not fun to wait for the line.

And they have a cute button on the wall which is you can press it and waitress come out!! Yayy, magic? lol

I only got a beef Kimchi fired rich which is many people recommend and a Assorted Seafood and vegetable hot pot which is my mom want to try to Korean hot pot.

The food is come average, not fast and not slow which is a good thing.
But I would recommend them come faster because I was very hungry for waiting 45 mins for the seat and wait addition 10 mins for the food.
Kimchi fired rich!! This food is very hit on the spot and tasted good! When me and my mom almost finish, the hot pot is arrive to my seat.
Okay, no. This is not what I expected. No! No! NO!!
This is just a soup okay?-_- Yes, really is just a soup with a stone pot.
My mom comforted me for rest of the dinner....
The soup is just put some chilled shrimp, chilled calamari and some other chilled "seafood" and the soup tasted very salty:( Sorry, this is not what I expected, and I order a rice which is I think they will cost that.

After finish, I pressed the button again and get the recipe. They didnt cost me the rice. Yayyy hahah okay. This is not what I expected too, but I am soo happy.

For those all, I think the price is alittle bit pricey. Especially for that soup which is strongly unrecommend, is just a soup nothing special and it's not a hot pot!!! However, I am just a High school student and it's just my opinion.

I will come back, Toyose. For the kimchi fried rich and seafood hoppot oh wait nooo!!
author: Kassidi L.

description:
korean bar food at it's finest.  hard to find entrance looks like a garage door.  ring the doorbell by your table for service.  

stick with the winners:
-spicy beef kimchi fried rice
-seafood pancake
-whole deep fried chicken

pass:
-casserole.  it's like making your own ramen at home after a night of binge drinking.  sliced hot dogs, spam and all.
author: Josie M.

description:
This is a great find - a HIDDEN gem!  I remember yelping for a late night eats in the avenues and Toyose came up.  I read the reviews about this place being inside a GARAGE and I was like...what!?  I love finding unique places like this!  The outside looks just like your typical house in the avenues but once inside, the transformation is amazing.  (I wonder if there's a hidden Karaoke room upstairs!?)  I'm a big fan of places that open 'til late and Toyose closes at 2am everyday...Yay!
I've been here many times and have also introduced many friends to this place and all visits were satisfying (except for the time when these guys were smoking cigarettes inside..WTF!)!!  They have some good Korean food - one of the best in the area.  When you're ready to order, there's a button that you press and a bell rings for the waitress to hear.   Isn't that cool!?  
I finally got to try the Soju when I recently went here for a group VDay dinner with other couples.  $11 for a Soju Cocktail...at first I was like "dang, that's an expensive cocktail" but when it came out, it was in those big bottles with the nozzles and you serve em up in shot glasses.  So yea, it was pretty much worth it!
It can get crowded, especially late nights.  I've had some good and bad experiences with reservations there and noticed that it's best to reserve as early as you can.
Recommendations: Beef & Calamari Bulgogi, Fish Cake Soup, Fried Chicken, Katsu, Strawberry Soju
author: jesiree b.

description: This is absolutely my favorite restaurant in SF! Food is great! Try seafood pancake! Service is always good, lovely girls! I can't help it, I just love this place!!!
author: Ana M.

description: Please do not try to eat any soup here. I do not know about any things in this place. I am a korean and i went to with my girlfriend. I ordered mixed stew. We shared the food but after boiling the soup for a few minutes, a cockroach floated on my plate. I do not know any things about the kitchen, but imagine a cockroach. After i told to the waitress, she took the plate super quickly without saying sorry and asked me to pay for other food that i ordered with. I through up everything because the cockroach was so big and discusting. It was the most awful experience.
author: Tyler C.

description:
Two blocks away from my house... and oh so good. 

The chicken wings must have crack in it because it is so darn delicious! The prices are a little bit high but who the heck cares since I always have a blast here. The girls are cute and attentive. 

Yogurt soju is still my favorite. For people who like it stronger... just get a side of chamisul and mix it yourself. The gizzards are also delicious on a hot plate served with a hot sauce and a sesame oil with salt and pepper. Drooling while I think of it... 

Tip: Make a reservation on Thurs, Fri, or Sat nights if you have a big party. I usually go around 9 to get a table.
author: Wanster L.

description: Awesome place to eat late night.  Whenever any friends from out of town to come visit me, this is the first place i consider. Why you ask? Reason 1: its a freakin garage in a restaurant! Now if it was a garage with bad food, that would be one thing buuut...reason 2: kimche fried rice!! And my recent favorite .. the cheese fries. Both of which are amazing. Reason 3: there are friggin door bells next to your table. That means no awkward waves to try to get the servers attention.  Other than that, the service is really nice, food is moderately priced but well worth the experience.
author: Chris O.

description:
Absolutely love this place. It's in a damn garage, but it's not bad.

The chicken wings...To die for. I will kill someone for their chicken wings. Oh, I'm serious.

But what I really love about the place is the electronic bell button things that you press to call over one of the cute waitresses. I wish that was in every restaurant. The waitresses, I mean.
author: Simon L.

description: LOVE this place!  I've been going here since I was in high school, before there was ever a name for it.  We call it "The Garage" cuz its a hole in the wall korean bar food place in a sunset home in a garage!  Food is always consistently yummy and the soju is good too!  My favorite is the Aloe soju here.  This is the only place I know that has it.  They have good soups, kimchee pancake, kimchee fried rice....so good.  Always packed even on random tuesday nights at 10:30pm!  So hope you get lucky and is able to get a table....its worth the wait!
author: Gina S.

description:
Ever since my friend said that I have to check out the Korean restaurant built in a garage with a winking chicken in front, I've wanted to come here.  I finally came.  

The decor was great, being able to ring a button for service was great too, but I found the food to be so-so.  The dukbokgi wasn't spicy enough for me, and the seafood pancake didn't have much flavor.  I'd probably come back, mainly to drink and snack, rather than eat a whole meal.
author: Ernest S.

description: Kimchee fried rice and soju all day!!! Also I love rice/fish cakes and they had this mix in a spicy sauce! Place is super tiny but food is worth it.
author: Roxanne W.

description:
I ate here once with a few friends & I really enjoyed my experience. The soju & the food was good. I loved the soup (I forget what it was called...but I remember it having ramen noodles & a spicy sauce). 

I'll definitely be back!!
author: Michelle F.

description:
This place was wonderful - a cool location and great food.  It is a small place - it seems like it is in someone's garage.  But the inside is charming and cozy.  The food is very refreshing and seemingly authentic Korean.  

The only problem was that it got very loud with a big party playing some drinking game, and the manager did nothing to ease the volume.

I recommend this place.
author: Robert N.

description: Ok this place isn't as good as the other reviews said it was. Service was bleh...the waitresses looked like they had better things to do. Food was overpriced and had small portions (the kimchi tofu soup didn't include rice...wtf). Taste was average. I would give it 2 stars but an extra one for the $11 yogurt soju, which wasn't too diluted and tasted great.
author: Cheri S.

description:
Definitely not the best korean restaurant.

Came here a few times. The first time I came here was with my bf, and two friends. But I didn't really eat anything because I already had dinner... and I honestly dont remember what I had (which meant it wasnt amazingly good). Second time I came here.... was a big mess... it was for my friend's birthday, and they reserved the back room.... yet we only got half of the back room, so a lot of people were not able to sit down. And it was ridiculously hard to get there attention to order food. 

Third time (which is what this review is mostly based on), I came here with my sister, and two friends. I made reservations, so we were seated right away. We had the calamari and veggies with spicy sauce and rice cake, the fishcake, shrimp, casserole with noodles, and the spicy friend chicken.

People said the chicken was good, so we ordered it. But it was not spicy (and didnt really have much flavor), and there wasnt that much meat on the chicken... but at least they gave us a lot of pieces. Still. not impressed with it.

The fishcake, shrimp casserole was ok, but we thought it was going to come with the ramen noodles, which was what my friend wanted. Since some of the other items stated "udon noodles" while this one just said noodles (guess we shouldnt have assumed it was going to be ramen). We ended up with udon noodle and ask for $2 ramen noodle. 

The calamari and veggies with spicy sauce and rice cake wasn't that good either and they gave us like 8 pieces of rice cake... which was what we really wanted.... not the calamari or veggies.... taste was ok, but not the best i ever had.

Getting the servers attention wasnt too difficult, since they have a button... but i realize that they dont know who presses the button, because they dont come to us and we still have to flag them down.

I dont think I will be coming back here... feels really rushed when they are busy... and not like their food is really good.... maybe only to drunk people.
author: Alicia W.

description:
They apparently converted someone (or their) basement into a restaurant. The interior has a nice atmosphere to it. Came here as two people, and we were seated quite fast (they didn't allow reservations for less than 4 people, which is reasonable).

We ordered their flavor soju and this wok-dish with noodles, sausages, vegetables, etc etc etc. From what I can remember (after drinking a lot of flavor soju), that wok-dish was really good. I think we ordered something else too, maybe some rice or beef dish. I don't remember the other dish to not be good, so it must have been good.

Be careful of your wallet. By that I mean, the soju doesn't seem that strong in the beginning. So, you'll keep on drinking! Then it hits. So you eat more and drink more. When the bill comes, you probably don't care what is on the bill, you just pay and go. I am NOT implying that the restaurant is engaging in some shady accounting. But, just prepare to pony up!
author: Sam W.

description: korean college food and flavored soju is always a good time!
author: Lily S.

description:
So, I used to live about 3 doors down from this place for a year. I lived with my girlfriend and her family and they were always annoyed with "The Garage" coz supposedly silly girls would get drunk and sick and puke right in the front door of the house and also make a lot of noise at 2 am. 

I also heard rumours that they don't look kindly on you if you're not korean. Yes, "your kind" is not welcomed here if you don't speak and look right. 

4 years down the line, a good korean friend held a meet up here. I was curious as hell and with several koreans to hide behind, I can blend right? So there I went, and woot! Did I love it. 

OMG, the ramen. Is a must. The fried chicken wings and the yogurt soju. It's noisy, it's a hole. I heart . Anyways- immediately texted my girlfriend who lived with me 3 doors down years ago and said "This place has good food!" Her reply, " I know, but I still don't like it!" 

Going here tonight again, with korean friends only of course, don't know whether I'd dare to go in here without them.
author: Len K.

description: Got the #19, Seafood pot. Miso soup based! Loveeeeeee it.
author: Vivian L.

description: I went here with the bf and ordered their famous seafood pancake and it was cold and not so tasty.  It also only comes with 4 side dishes.. quite on the little side compared to most Korean restaurants.  Also the side dishes were small with not much food on it.  We also ordered this sea bass soup with hardly any sea bass...  the bill ended up around $40 with these two orders and 2 small bowls of rice.  -Totally not worth it.  Not to mention it gave my bf a huge stomach ache right afterwards...
author: Jen L.

description: came here for dinner in a party of six. apparently they don't seat you at a larger table unless you have seven or more, so the six of us were crammed onto a tiny table that should really be meant for four. this did not stop us from ordering a ton of food and then proceeding to finish everything! we got two orders of the chicken wings, kimchee fried rice, seafood pancake, spicy pork, cheese corn, the calamari and pork dish, and yogurt and peach soju. everything was really good, especially the fried rice and chicken wings. the only thing i didn't really like was the cheese corn, which had really stringy cheese that was hard to serve and then got hard pretty quickly. i've definitely had better ones. can't wait to come back, this time with at least six others!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
Ambiance: 1/1 Loud, great for big groups and couples. It is very lively in here, with drunk people surrounding the premises. Luckily, they have screens which separate you from the rest of the parties around you, at least for half of the tables, anyway. 

Service: 0/2 Out of the multiple times I've been here, I have only met one server who has not given me attitude. The rest of them are cocky korean girls who think that they are too hot to talk to to you (aka take your order). If the food waas not so good, this restaurant would be shut down right away with the horrible service they provide. You have to go here to understand. Honey, you don't have enough plastic on your nose to act the way you do to customers here...seriously. Ugh.

Food: 2/2 OMG the food here is so delicious. Aside from the chicken wings becoming bite-sized, the fried rice, soju, pancakes, and casseroles are to die for. I love this place and its salty goodness. 

Amazing food, horrible service. Can't have it all, I guess.
author: Anna T.

description:
Man with the korean food overload the past few weeks, I thought it would all taste the same by now. This place still managed to entertain the buds.  We ordered the budae jigae (casserole w/spam, kimchi, hotdog, ramen, pork), kicmchi fried rice x 2, chicken wings x 2, and seafood pancake. It was just the right amount of food for the six of us. The casserole was full of flavor and big enough for 3-6 people. Kimchi fried rice was easily the best I've had. Chicken wings were great appetizers to start off with, very crispy. The seafood pancake was a little on the soft gooey side, I like it crispy on the outside. 

It was a sunday night when we went. Found parking a couple blocks away. Place was packed an hour into opening, was told it would be a 30 min wait. These guys are open for dinner 7 days a week 6pm-2am!! Service was decent, there were only two hostesses/waitresses/cashiers. There's a service button at each table but we found it more effective to wave them down. Will definitely have this on the list of late night spots.

SOLID 4 stars.
author: Phu H.

description:
5 stars for the soju alone! Honestly its alcohol content is probably something really low like 10% but they really are tasty. I think aloe and lemon are my top two (its more like lemonade). Mixed pineapple and mango I would put third and the rest are too close to rank. Haven't tried yogurt but I hear it's good. Little expensive if you want to get drunk, comes with a little bowl of popcorn. 
Seafood pancake is one of my favorite Korean dishes and they do pretty well here. Had some other snacky foods that were alright. I definitely want to try the hot pot next time! 
It's gets BUSY here so get used to the line on weekends. Getting the waitresses attention can be a chore if you're in a bad spot but I don't blame them. Ambiance is great and the outside appearance can be deceiving!
author: Andrew C.

description:
MmmMm...

for a lil place in a garage down by the beach... toyose, aka GARAGE, is surprisingly good. everything ive had here is delicious. from the french fries to the pork shank to the udon. they also have the BEST kimchi tofu pork ever... and their strawberry soju is yum yum yum!! i could drink it all day if it didnt make me so drunk... its a creeper...

theres always big groups here, but i like coming here with the fam or dinner dates. 

and id like to end with.. CHEESE WITH CORN!? uhh huhh!
author: Bobbie L.

description: Always a good place for korean food in a no window restaurant for some fun time with friends. The restaurant was basically built out from a house garage, therefore many people would know it as the "garage" then toyose. Service is not superd when its busy and even with the bell. But all in all, they do have some delicious meals to share or just eating the appetizers is already filling!
author: Linh D.

description:
5 star for a good ambience

2 stars for the food: Tried-
Tofu hotpot soup - tomato taste was overpowering. Koreans get the Red colour of the soup with chilies not tomatoes :(
Seafood pancake - Not thin and crispy enough
author: Insi L.

description: This place SUCKS!  I spent over $40 on Kim Chee Soup, Fried Rice, and Beef...... I get no fucking sides.  I feel fucking ripped off!!!  If  you want korean food, go to the one on Taravel St. or Aarang at Japantown!
author: Steven T.

description:
This place definitely looks sorta shady on the outside, but it's surprisingly nice inside. A bit crammed overall, but we had a party of 11 on pretty short notice get seated and fit nicely.

Food was really good. The abundance of fried options made it possible to bring along people who don't typically eat Korean food. And the garlic french fries, while a bit surprising to see on the menu, were super garlicly and good.

And lots and lots of delicious soju flavors that mixed together nicely. 

Pretty sweet that it's open til 2am nightly. Doesn't look like anything else in the neighborhood is open past 10pm
author: Ezra C.

description: This was the first meal we had in San Francisco on our vacation here. D.E.L.I.C.I.O.U.S! We had the Korean Fried Chicken and Kimchi Fried Rice. This is the best Kimchi Fried rice I've had! Their soju was delicious as well. We might come back again before we board our plane! Open one in Austin, Texas please!
author: Lizzie C.

description:
A co-worker introduced me to this little korean place in the outer sunset last year.  My wife and I have been back twice since then.  They've got great Korean comfort food (try the chicken wings, kimchi fried rice, and the seafood pancake), and the Strawberry Soju and Peach Soju wine drinks are absolutely delicious.

Considering that it's located in a converted garage, the owners deserve a lot of credit for giving the inside so much decor and character.  It's small and it can be a bit of a wait sometimes, but it is definitely worth it.
author: Tim N.

description:
I am still in my strawberry yogurt soju haze. 
I have to admit it, I was never big on Korean cuisine until last night when I ate a feast. What have I been missing? 
I had a fun opportunity to dine with a few of my favorite yelpers. 
The fried chicken was absolutely delish. I loved chicken gizzards, and the seabass soup! I am still full 
The service was friendly, fast and attentive. 
beware of the power of the soju
author: Jennifer S.

description:
You know that neighbor....the one who has his tools all lined up by size on a beautiful pegged wall in his garage. He polishes his band saw after each use and will not allow a car to enter his garage lest the oil stain his pristine concrete floor. His garage is the envy of the neighborhood and he walks around with an air of arrogance about it. Well, he would have to hang it up after a visit to this little garage way out there in the fog. 

This is some kick ass Korean food in an unassuming garage turned restaurant in the Outer Sunset. Everything we had here was excellent, including the 50 gazillion soju shots that accompanied our meal. The fact that I had been drinking did not mask the fact that this food would be awesome in a sober state. 

Please do not go here. I will be there, drunk and loud, with my friends and we want to keep this place to ourselves. Go hang out in your neighbors garage instead.....and don't forget to wipe your feet before entering and remember to put things back where you found them.
author: Drue C.

description:
Yes, it's going to be recorded in history books:

-March 22, 2007 - 

One fine Thursday night, Euge L. and Nance W. met up with a couple friends for some light drinking and conversations.

An hour later, after a few bottles of soju have been consumed, Euge takes Nance's soju and says, "Umm, honey, I think you're drinking too much..."

YEAH, WELL IF I WANNA TAKE A SHOT, IMMA TAKE A SHOT! Give me back my drink, dammit!

Holy crapppp. For the first time in history, Euge the Korean alcoholic thinks his Chinese girlfriend is drinking too much?! Euge, for the first time in history, is the most sober person at a bar?

What a shocker.

----------STORY----------

I never drank so much soju in my life. I'm warning you now, soju is effing EVIL! I have always remembered what happened the night before, no matter how much I drank, but this one particular night I blacked out numerous times when we arrived home. I don't remember demanding Euge to make me kimchee fried rice, trying to measure him up with an organic banana, watching Requiem for a Dream, having "Love in the Time of Cholera" being read to me, removing all of my clothing and straight PASS OUT.

At least one good thing came out of this: I am a lot more appreciated now for all I have to put up with when Euge gets drunk.

----------REVIEW----------

I really liked this place because it's only two blocks away from my house.

I like their food, not too spicy.

I don't like that they allow people smoke inside, but at least they don't let people do that until after 10pm.
author: Nance W.

description:
This place is only worth going for the novelty that its a resturant totally enclosed in a garage--wtf! Ive eaten here 2 times and the first seemed a lot better than the second, im thinking that it was because i was just fascinated that it was a resturant in a garage--wtf again! The second time, we went right when it opened. after 5 i think? Anyway they took forever to make some fried rice dish and some korean soup--50 min!??! 

WTF! haha, the food is just okay so i thinks I will never visit again, unless im in a contest to find the most hidden resturant in the city. A fun place but i dont have that kind of time to burn.
author: Amy S.

description:
yos. the garage. call it what you will, its one of the last remaining korean soju jeeps in sf. on any given night you could have older korean folks enjoying a nice gonggol dinner (big pot style dish cooked at your table, full of various stuffies), house packed with chinese foreign exchange students pounding down chamisul and hite or a backroom full of obnoxious drunks.  what can you say, its a great place.

surprisingly the food is actually pretty good. the menu basically consists of korean bar food. mainland korean folks hardly ever drink without something to eat.
author: Euge L.

description:
Toyose...AKA THE GARAGE!! 

I love how innovative Asian people can turn an ordinary sunset home garage into a place of business. AWESOME. This place is pretty hard to spot if you're not looking for it, because it's really, JUST A GARAGE.

I always come with a party of no more than 6 because the place is small. Think GARAGE sized business. Garage garage garage. I come here to get...

SOJU!!! (mixed with all sorts of juices but YOGURT is the best)
Kim Chee Fried Rice
Seafood Pancake (MY FAV)

Throw down a couple of soju shots, fill your bellies with scrumptuous Korean food and you'll be a happy camper...dining in a GARAGE.
author: Heidi C.

description:
Talk about a hidden spot. You can definitely pass this place up for being a house. On the outside, it looks like a garage of a house in the Sunset. Inside, it's a little cramped so not the best place for a big group. And it gets pretty loud since you sit rather close to other tables and have to talk over neighboring conversations. 

I went with a group of friends on a Friday night and it was pretty crowded. I didn't try the food since I had just stuffed myself at Patio Filipino for a graduation party. But I did try the pineapple and mango soju which were tasty. I'd give this place another shot, just because it's so close to home and parking isn't hard at all. Open til 2am is a MAJOR plus.
author: Valerie E.

description:
Yoboseyo!!!
Ding-dong
Ding-dong
Yoboseyo! Yugiyo!
Ding-dong
Ding-dong (Can't get enough of that service bell)
Soju 
Ding-dong
Ding-dong (Unroll the bamboo blinds for some privacy)
Hite
Ding-dong (I feel like I'm in Seoul)
Ding-dong
Soju
Ding-dong
WHOAH! They have seh-oo-kkang (=shrimp crackers)
Ding-dong
Napkins
Ding-dong...

And that's a night at the Yos.

I love this traditionally designed hole for drinking soju until 2am, 7 days a week.  

I'd drop 5 if there was some way they could get some OXYGEN in here for me!  Second hand smoke kills, yo.
author: Irene S.

description: You may have to wait until the next lunar epoch to get seated, but it's a nice, friendly, low key joint that is worth going to (especially if you know your dinning companion would enjoy seeing fire shoot out of your mouth...the food is hot, is what I'm saying :);.
author: Casey B.

description:
They kicked me out.

Yup.

I walked in on a Friday night at about 7ish, and there were like 3 empty tables.  I told the waitress, "Party of 3, please," and she said that there were no tables available.  Say what?!

Okay...

So I gave her the benefit of the doubt, thinking that these three tables might've been reserved or something.  And since I saw a couple of other tables wrapping it up, I asked her how the long the wait was.  "About 2 or 3 hours," was her curt little bitch-ass reply.  WHAT?!  Before I could even express my disbelief, she told me that she didn't think that she could accommodate us tonight, then she turned around and walked back into the rear of the restaurant.

So I guess I got kicked out.

I'm reporting them to the Health Dept.  ^_^
author: Ryan D.

description:
i am always craving for Toyose, since SF always have those foggy moment, i always wanted to go whenever the weather is not warth, lol. 
Our favorise order is number 16 The beef and veggie Hot Pot, this is a Heavenly good dish! must have! full with excitement, however we are all big eater, wish there are more veggie becuase we will never have enough .....
on think i want to find out is that do they charge white rice?? i've been so many korean resturant they never charge the white steam rice but this time and only them they charge us $1 each, which it is a pretty small one too, so i am confused? anyone know the answer
author: Melon P.

description:
I've always called this place "The Garage" until one day I actually took a look at it and realized it had a name!  It's a funny place because its literally underneath someone's house. I wonder if the owners live on top of it!
Def a great place to get 'korean bar food'. Not your best place if you want your traditional koren food though. 

I came here last night right when it opened! It was great because there was no one there! So getting a table was pretty easy. Normally I call here ahead of time to let them know I'm coming so I dont have to wait. So if you are going to come here during the rush dinner hour, call here ahead of time, otherwise be prepared to wait!

We ordered the whole korean fried chicken before (my bf loves this) and it comes with pickled radish - this is not too bad, but can get a little dry. I prefer the spicy chicken wings  because its just easier to eat. The seafood green onion pancake  here is the best! I've tried other places before and they do not compare! The Duk-Buki (chewy noodles with fishcake) was pretty good here and I asked them to make it medium spicy and they did! Perfect! The giant soup casserole bowls are also quite delicious here and can easily feed 4 people - my favorite is the one that has the spam, kimchee, hotdog, ramen, beans, chewy noodle, etc. But beware..it's pretty spicy! Kim-chee fried rice here is pretty good here too!

The flavored SoJu here is delicious..my favorite is the yogurt soju! All dishes range from $8-$22 depending on what you order. This is def a place to come here for some casual dining and drinking.
author: Betty S.

description:
Hmmm, is this the place that we went to after the pseudo-nomihoudai dinner back in October?  I remember because it was my serious yakudoshi birthday celebration.  I remember this place being a hole in the wall in the middle of BFE.  I remember eating some damn good KFC.  I don't remember too much else.  Well except nice Amy and her friend Midori picked up my truck from Millbrae BART and drove my slightly inebriated self and my truck to my home.

But I remember again tonight because I still have this big freggin' 1600ml bottle of Hite in my fridge.  Now Hite tastes like nasty shix when its fresh.  But two months old and flat, and it tastes like my dog's pee.  What's with Koreans making crappy beer anyway?  Hite is pee, and OB is, well, tastes like its name.... OB/GYN.

Come on Euge, FORTY MORE YEARS OF F'ING OPPRESSION unless you get this shix right!  Three more sips, I'm almost done.  Whew, I mean phew.
author: Bryan K.

description:
Eh... I really wanted to like this place, especially since I've heard it's one of the places to get better Korean food in SF.... but it just didn't cut it for me... The food wasn't all the good. The knock-off korean fried chicken was pretty good, but the kimchi fried rice and the boodaejjigae just wasn't very good... 

The atmosphere is weird. Maybe it was just the night we went (on a Wednesday), but it was just weird. Weird vibe. Weird crowd. Just weird. 

I won't be frequenting this place at all... no no...
author: Jen D.

description:
i love this place, this is like my spot for a late night munchies, instead of going to denny's or ihop, or bar hopping. i like to come here with a bunch of my friends or coworkers, it's a perfect atmosphere and the food is good. it can be a little pricey tho. when i come here i usually order the big hotpot and the wings and some other little bites, and GOTTA HAVE THE ALOE SOJU, it's heluh good. the sucky part is the wait can take forever, so you should call first before coming. 
if you get bored at night, don't wanna bar hop or go clubbin, go here,
author: Toni Rose M.

description:
Love this cute little hole in the wall Korean drinking spot. ALWAYS on the list of things that you must order:

Chicken Wings
Bu Dae Ji Gae ( Spam Casserole, soooo good)
Seafood pancake
Kimchi fried rice

soooooooooo good!

oh and don't forget the soju to wash it all down!
author: Cora M.

description:
if the place was bigger, it would probably be the best place ever. 

the soju = the best. i only really go here to drink with friends, but the food is not bad either. we don't go home until we have consumed about 3 hites, and x amt of soju bottles hahahh.

strawberry is good, so is pineapple, and yogurt, and almost all the flavors are good :D just try them all!
author: Jackie C.

description:
Damn you!!!

Always giving me crazy hangovers in the middle of the night.  Those yogurt sojus just go down like water.  And I need a lot of water after hoovering through your Kim Chi Fried Rice and hot off the fryer gyozas.

I cant say this place is exceptional.  But I always, always have a good time here because those soju mixes are straight up delicious and totally creeps up on you.  It's like you got hit with a silent tranquilizer.  One moment, you're enjoying the perfectly crisp chicken wings, next your head falls to the wall almost hitting the doorbell.

This hole is perfect for social get togethers when you want to shoot the shit and cuss away all your bad days.  Those 4-letter words totally spill out after your 3rd bottle.  Service has been shotty... it depends on the 2 main waitresses.  The younger one will accomodate anything for you.  The older lady once said to us that they ran out of tea.  But she had plenty of lazy in stock.
author: Chris T.

description:
Ever wonder where the late eateries are that are not diners? Toyose is one of those that caters to the afterhours crowd. All the classic Korean items to order. Seafood onion pancake and fish cakes in spicy sauce and ramen are my 2 staple items. Really great place for friends to munch, chat, and drink. Shooting the shits comes to mind.

It is easy to miss while driving. Just look for a garage and a birdie on flag. Parking is quite easy. Park close to avoid freezing in the unforgiving Outer Sunset fog.
author: Cathy H.

description:
If the unassuming facade of a garage door in a typical Sunset district neighborhood isn't enough to lure you in, then how about the plethora of Korean foods and varieties of cocktail soju? On cocktail soju alone you have a choice of aloe, yogurt, strawberry, mango, peach, etc. 

Then you get to the food. A lot of it is perfect snacking food for drinking (assuming you're over 21 years of age, of course). The chicken wings here are, in one word, awesome. And that's not me speaking from the perspective of having one too many sips of the cocktail soju (at least not entirely). They are battered nicely, tasty, and come out hot. 

Every time I have been to Toyose it has been with a fairly large group of 8-14 people, and we always have a rambunctious good time. Like others have stated, try to make reservations before (and follow up the day of). On my last outing there, our party of 12 was seated, but the party of 8 before us was turned away when the hostess could not find their reservation.
author: Mike S.

description:
Ok, when I talk about finding hidden gems shrouded in the fog of the distant outer sunset, this is what I mean.

At first glance, you might not even know Toyose is a restaurant.  It's essentially in the garage of just another typical Sunset house.  And even if you noticed the sign, you'd probably be too scared to go in, as there's no windows and no telling what's behind the door.  I mean, it could be some dude oil-changing his car and directing you to a single, wobbly workbench while his mother cooks food in the kitchen upstairs or something.

But no, it's actually a real restaurant inside (albeit a narrow and windowless one), with a real attempt at atmospheric decor that comes off a bit like Trader Vic's.  And the menu and waiters are reasonably well-versed in english.  Still, Korean food newbies might have a tough time deciding, especially as the prices can be a bit formidable.  For instance, the $22-25 "casseroles".  Those are actually giant hot pots that they cook on a portable grill right on the table, and they're easily enough for two, full of all sorts of delicious stuff.  In fact, you're probably best off coming here with a group or for a party when you can go for the all-out feast.  

And then there's the $11 Soju.  Turns out $11 gets you a 750-ml bottle, complete with a pour spout, which isn't bad.  I tried cranberry and I have no idea how alcoholic it was but it goes down so easy it's got to be a good way to sneakily get someone drunk. 

So, in short, prices are high, but portions are large and the food is great (right up there with Shin Toe Bul Yi) and so is the Soju.  Plus, service and decor is a cut above your typical OSAD (Outer Sunset Asian Dive).  Also, I was here on a Thursday and it was half-empty.  But I'd make a reservation just in case, cuz with a place this small, you never know.  As long as you can effectively judge how much you need to order, you'll have a great time.  Oh, and I must reiterate, bonus star for the extra-hidden location.
author: Wes M.

description:
45 minute wait to enter the garage.

Peach soju for an appetizer. a friend from bio class just kept talking about the soju here for the past 2 weeks, so we went here to see if its really all that.

ordered the Ramen with rice cake and fish cake in spicy bean paste(YUM!), seafood pancake (MORE YUM!), and udon (not that yum), and another bottle of soju, yogurt flavor this time. 

highlights were the ramen with rice cake, just the right combination of sweet and spicy in a thick sauce. seafood pancake was good when it first came out and was still crispy, not so good when it was soggy and stuck to the parchment paper. and out of the two sojus we tried, the peach was the best. just like drinking peach juice

the service was very nice, probably helped that my friend knew the girl. i like how theres a doorbell type button at each table so you dont have to wave them down. just press and they come running
author: David D.

description:
** Update**
Came back on Friday for my sister's bday dinner...it started off nice, we had a party of 10 and the first table we were at was so tiny and we were all smashed together..I think the waitress noticed and she moved us to bigger table.

We all ordered our food and were surprised how fast our food came out, thumbs up!  Things started going downhill after we noticed that 2 people in our party hadn't gotten their food yet...I'm thinking..okay it's coming out any minute...as I finished the last of my kimchee fried rice...STILL no food for the 2 peeps in our crew.

We ring the buzzer and tell the waitress we haven't received the rest of our food, to which she replies, " I know! I know! I know!" ummm...'scuze me? what's up w/ the 'tude?? Minus 1 star.

Later on we get the bill....as we're all getting our $$ together, it just wasn't adding up, good thing we double checked the bill because we were charged for an extra bottle of soju - that we DID NOT order!  Minus ANOTHER star...

My second time here was not fun....I dont' think we'll be back!

*******************************************************************************






Cute little gem of a place a couple of blocks from my pad!

I've had this place bookmarked for awhile and finally got to come and try it out last sat nite since we were craving some korean food...so happy I did!

So me, the bf, my sis and bff all headed over here a little after 6 when they opened...I really didn't know what to expect inside..I've always driven by and just saw that the joint looked like a converted garage!

So we walk in and it's pretty cute inside, there's about 4 booths lined up to your left and then there's more tables in the back room where we sat.

The first thing we noticed were the handy dandy buzzers on the wall...so you can ring your waitress anytime you want - yes!

We checked out the menu and decided on:

beef and calamari
eel
kimchee fried rice
chicken wings

The kimchee fried rice with an egg on top was delicious! I couldve just ate that alone!  The eel was cooked perfectly, the beef and calamari was tasty and the chicken wings were yum!!!  

We thought that we didn't order enough food, but we pretty much polished off everything and were stuffed! 

It's a tad pricey but definitely worth it!!!  They are open until 2 am...next time I gotta try the different soju's!
author: Jade B.

description:
well... 3.5 stars...

The stuff I liked...  

$11 bottle yogurt Soju....  big bottle... pretty good deal... could use more alcohol though.  I taste pretty good... doesn't taste like there is alcohol in it.. but I know there is since I'm a little buzzed right now.  

Spicy fried chicken wings...  its a little pricey, for $12.95 you get 12, but it is tasty.  Fried when you order, it was neither oily or fatty.  I guess they could have been a little more spicy though.  

Staff.. the one waitress that was working was very nice., service with a smile.

the one thing i didnt like... 

Calamari with veggies and noodles.  It wasnt what i expected, it was served cold.  The onions were raw and it came with a bunch of greens that taste weird.
author: Janet S.

description: Wow this place is out in the middle of nowhere. On top of that it's literally in a garage! The problem with living in CA is that you get used to the fact that places are non-smoking, however this place feels like being in Vegas. Now I don't mind smoking so much if a place is well ventilated but the ceilings are mighty low here. It's also packed liked sardines on a Friday night. Came here after a significant amount of drinking and to get the late night meal. Good chicken wings, seafood pancakes, and soup. I think this place is probably better as a mid week hangout as you can avoid the crowds. 3.5 stars.
author: Kim N.

description: I can't say I hate this place, but I can't say I love it either. It was definitely an alright experience. When my friend drove me by it at night, it looked like it was closed, but it wasn't. The space was definitely cramped and if it's cold outside, don't worry, you will be sweating inside. The food was definitely big in portion but not so much in flavor. It's not the greatest Korean food I've had. I do like the fried chicken though that I will admit to. It was the right amount of batter and the right amount of salt. The Soju was good in mango flavor, not so much in the yogurt flavor.Service wise wasn't great. I think the waitress was tired and was a little cranky when she put our food down that she spilled our Soju. I didn't really come there because of the service, but it could have helped the ratings.
author: Nha H.

description:
If this place wasn't so far, I would be back allll the time! I made the trek through some INTENSE fog to try Toyose, and it was totally worth it.

The two of us ordered the seafood pancake, duk boki, and some soybean tofu soup with seafood. Obviously we did not know that the portions here are huuuuge, and we basically took stuffed our faces until it hurt, and took home the majority of the soup for lunch the next day. 

Their seafood pancake is amazing--you must order. It's a huge portion, and goes great with the dipping sauce they give you. Duk Boki is soft and chewy, with sweet with a hint of spicy flavors. Sooo good. The soup was nice too, but I was expecting something similar to soondubu because the waiter said it was like it, but it definitely wasn't. More like a broth based soup with seafood and pieces of tofu.

All in all, a great place if you can make the drive out there. We got there at around 7pm and the place was absolutely packed by the time we left, so get there early or be prepared to wait!
author: Stefi C.

description:
I hate you Toyose, I don't care what my friends say!

You made me spend $20 on  you and I still had to eat jack in the box afterwards!  Keep wining and dinning my friends, I know the real you...
author: Michael N.

description: Fun setting, big portions, but food is very average. Perfect for the last stop on a night out, but for good Korean try To Hyang.
author: Christian A.

description:
This is a garage converted into a restaurant. Late night dining and great foods. For some reason, it seems as if there is a wait period for everyone. I'm not sure how busy they really are that they have to make people wait for an hour. 

Service was average. Seemed like the waitress kept forgetting to come back to give us stuff.

Soju/Chicken wings are a must. The other sauteed stuff is typical korean food. Nice kick to it too. I wish they had a larger selection of food though, but what they did have was tasty.
author: Shine S.

description:
Who doesn't love great food that's open late? I know I sure do. A chill Korean spot that's open til' about 2 am. I've always been a fan of Korean food and soju. I came here with a group of friends. We walked through the door and we instantly were hit with the magnificent smell of all the dishes that were being served.

We noticed that every table we walked by while getting to ours all had a big boiling pot of soup. As we sat and looked through the menu we all agreed to order the assorted seafood with veggies in a spicy chili paste broth served with ramen noodles (which serves about 6-8 people). Like many other Korean spots they served bulgogi. We ordered the beef & calamari bulgogi, beef kimchi fried rice, spicy chicken wings, and french fries topped with melted cheese & garlic. We ordered two of everything. While waiting for the food like most typical groups of people we were chatting away. Once the food arrived it suddenly got quiet. With that being said you know everyone was either hungry or was just enjoying how amazingly good the food was. I think it was both! We then ordered a bottle of their yogurt soju. Yum, yum, and yum! I love me some soju. The taste is subtle not too sweet or bitter at that. The place is remarkable!
author: Cassie D.

description:
I thought the food was okay. When we paid, at least 3 people in my party counted the cash to make sure we were leaving more than enough for the tip. But  when we had just walked out the door, the lady that was serving us ran after us and said that we didn't leave enough tip. It seemed that the cash was 10 dollars off. Who knows what happened? 3 people miscounted - somehow the 10 bucks just disappeared, whatever. 

Whatever happened, even if a party did not leave as much tip as one thinks they deserve, I think its extremely rude for any server to run after people and claim they did not leave enough. Its called GRATUITY, lady.
'
author: Frankie S.

description:
I've been here various times. Most times are good and fun mainly because the loads and loads of yummy flavored soju they offer and what's good with alcohol??!! a ton of korean food.
 
But another time the service was very very rude. Basically what happened was that my friend ordered one thing and we received another. Simple miscommunication we thought..But nooooo..they did not handle the situation very well. We brought up that they we didn't order this item it was seafood---my friend is allergic so obviously he didn't order seafood, what he actually wanted was the item below it. Usually at restaurants i've been they just take the order away and bring the order you actually wanted. But no, the waitress started verbally attacking us and giving us attitude, like saying "you should pay attention when you're ordering" and continually blaming us for receiving the wrong order. My friends and i didn't want to make a scene so we just accepted it as our order and let my other friend eat it while my friend that supposedly ordered that item ordered what he really wanted. She continued to give us bad service that whole night...so we left her a dollar tip for a 200+ order. 
I hope the next time i go, it will be like the all good nights we had there not like that bad one night.
author: Julie B.

description: This place is fantastic, a great venue to have a 'pitcha' of beer and kick back with some snack type dishes (though you can totally have your fill of dinner here.) The ambiance is similar to OB Chicken in Oakland (kind of a drink-restaurant.) We had the big sliced pork thing (forget what it was called; it came with garlic), ddok with ramyun and a seafood stew of some kind. It's expensive like most "Korean for Koreans" joints are, but that's okay with me. This'll be my "post-Cal Academy Nightlife" go-to place starting tomorrow!
author: Josh K.

description:
As we parked the car, I kept wondering to myself where the entrance to the restaurant was as I looked around.  I see the bright, lit sign, but no door.  Oh wait!  There it is, the entrance is a garage door...WTF!

Tonight, my friends (Linda and Ronnie) picked me up from work and took me to Toyose where we met up with a co-worker of his, Frank.  I guess Frank knew someone who has been here and liked it a lot so he invited Ronnie, and Ronnie invited Linda and me to come along too, SWEEEET!  I still can't get over how cool the place was, it was a garage, but didn't feel like a garage at all inside -- felt more like a sunken ship or something.  The coolest thing about it was the doorbell at each table against the wall, so if you needed something and the waitress is nowhere to be seen, there's a bell to ring.  I also liked the music playing in the background, Korean techno, perhaps... I'm not sure, but the four of us found ourselves bopping our heads to the beat without even knowing it!

We started with a pitcher of Hite (bottled beer made with naturally fresh water) as we munched on a bowl of complimentary shrimp chips.  The food was good, I had a basket of shrimp tempura with white rice.  The batter was not crispy, but was light and filling.  

This restaurant had a delightful ambiance and I would totally go back -- a definite "hole in a wall" :-)!
author: Celeste M.

description:
I was here two times in a week, you know how much I love this place;)
It's really small and dark inside, but it smells really good inside.
I came here for their pot with everything inside:p sorry, I forgot the name of the dish...
I absolutely love this dish!!!we also tried bulgogi and kimchi fried rice...they are alright...
overall, i think this is a good korean restaurant in SF, not the best service cause they are always sooooo busy, but i would always come back when i crave for korean food.
author: Christy Y.

description: Great chill environment. Awesome soju. Food is decent.
author: Stephen Y.

description:
this is my all time fav. restaurant!!  Talk about hole in the wall restaurant.  i heard a lot about this place while i was in college, and i finally came here with my Korean friend. i NEVER thought that i would ever love korean food, but this place changed me FOREVER! 

if you make reservations here, you HAVE to tell them the correct number for the party. or they will not be so happy.  i had friends drop out on me last min, and i guess they could've given the table to a bigger party.

 love everything here! i love the Korean pancake the most. i have no idea how the make it but if i were to be stuck on an island for one month, the one food dish i would want with me would be the Korean pancake! Everytime i go back now, i ALWAYS order that.  in the past i can never tolerate spicy food, but everything here is so good, that i have a pretty good level of tolerance for spicy food now.  However, i dont think this place is vegetarian friendly, so don't bring your vegetarian friends here. this place is so cute, with it's doorbell service at your table. just press the bell and the waitress will be at your table.  i recommend the rice noodle dishes here too. but  just a warning it's pretty spicy.  the kimchi fried rice is good here too. the best time to come here is on a foggy or rainy day, perfect food just to warm you up =)
author: Belinda C.

description:
We call this place "The Garage" because it is literally the garage of a house transformed into a restaurant. Didn't even know the real name of this place until I looked it up on Yelp just now. If you're coming here with a big group, make reservations. Otherwise you will end up waiting anywhere from 30 mins to an hour...if not longer.

I always order the same thing when I come here. Chicken Wings, Kimchee fried rice, and Bulgogi. You will not be disappointed. 

This place has the best flavored soju. Call me soft, but I just can't stand the green bottle. The yogurt and peach flavored soju are the best. Its actually pretty strong too but you can barely taste the soju.
author: Gary K.

description:
What a weird, yet kind of cool, place. 

During our first driveby, I thought the place was shut down given that it is housed in a converted garage. But the lights were on and the sign said it was open, so we ventured in.

There is only one girl in the front of the house, and looked like 1 cook in the back of the house, so getting seated, getting water, getting food, etc, probably took as long as actually eating the meal itself.

We ordered corn and cheese, spicy sauteed chicken gizzards, house pork w/special sauce, and the "casserole" with hot dogs, spam, rice cakes, etc. Everything was delicious and, according to my korean bf, authentic.

I'm just learning all the nuances in Korean food, and apparently the type of food they serve here is equivalent to bar food.  I'll admit, it was a bit disappointing to not see kalbi on the menu, but there were plenty of other items to keep me stuffed.

Menu is kind of pricey, but the portions are huge. You could probably spend all night here drinking, and sampling the menu, which is what I recommend.drinking. That way, you won't be bothered by the slow service.
author: Sabine S.

description:
by far they have the best flavored soju i have ever tasted.we tried strawberry mango and yogurt pineapple and my favorite one will be the yogurt flavor.me and my friends like to go here if we wanted to just drink the night away.
we always get the bulgogi with calamari,.it has the sweet taste and flavorful beef,which is good partner for the soju.
kimchi fried rice was OK.they usually give a lot of side dishes but for some reason they just give kimchi,sprouts and radish.i remember they use to have the anchovies potato pickles and such..etc 
Place is very cozy and very unique since its a garage restaurant.what a brillant way to put up a restaurant.ha
But It gets a little bit crowded and noisy since you all will seat like literally next to each other.and you could basically hear each others gossips.lol 
but if you would like a place just to drink catch up hangout dinner with friends...this is a very good place to go.
author: Enah N.

description:
Toyose is a restaurant that has an intrigue that few places in SF can lay claim. Known as "the garage", this little korean restaurant is tucked behind a residential facade, luring you in with its awning and cute mascot sign. The interiors are decorated like a Disneyland ride in Frontierland. It's really cool. You get seated, ready to order, only to be disappointed by the food.

I found the food to be just okay, lacking in the kick you expect from Korean cuisine. The soups were bland. Same with the kim chi fried rice, and the seafood pancakes. But hey, the food really serves as a sidekick to their awesome alcohol selection. Most people come here to drink and have some food on the side. They have a huge variety of yummy soju smoothies (yogurt!) made for shooting back. And I guess that's the reason for Toyose's existence: tipsy dinners.
author: Derek L.

description: I came here for the first time a couple weeks ago and it was pretty good.  I pretty much knew it would be since there was quite a wait (around 10pm on a Friday night) and because there were many Asians there and we all know they know real Asian food.  I had the seafood udon soup which was a good size and shared calamari, eel, and strawberry soju.  Service was fine and the place was pretty loud.  Looks like a good spot for late night cravings.  The garage look of it on the outside is unique and tricky.
author: Daisy D.

description:
UPDATE: i've been rejected from their 2x now, & honestly, i think it's cuz i'm not korean. they don't even want us to wait for a table! & were quite rude about it. whatev. no matter what they offer, i want to be treated fairly.

i dig the funky zany underground-ness of it. but mostly b/c it's OPEN TILL 2 AM EVERY NIGHT. it may be FOB central, but chicken garage, u comfort my soul. i have to thank yelpers for telling me about this place b/c i would NEVER have gone in otherwise.

FOOD: not the bestest korean food, but damn good for late nite. typically overpriced, but u walk away full of bbq & beer.

~seafood & green onion pancake: yummmmm. good, fried taste, but u feel semi-healthy b/c it's loaded w/green onions & bell peppers! love the chewy texture.

~whole fried chicken: one of my FAVORITES. while not as good as my old korean bar in berkeley's, the crispy skin dipped in salt is pure heaven. the meat is surprisingly juicy (except for those dried out breasts...god forbid anyone ever refer to me this way) this chicken made me get philosophical about chicken, & i am a devout chicken lover.

~udon: if i was dying for a bowl of noodles late @ nite, i might get the udon again. but i realize, udon noodles r too thick & chewy for me, & the broth & extras weren't that great. i think bbq is the way to go here.

~BEEEER: this place makes me want to drink beer. what's funny is @ most places, the "small" size is a regular bottle, & the "large" is one of those bigger bottles of beer. but here, the "small" is the bigger bottle of beer, & the "large" is a fricking jug u need to hold w/2 hands w/a handle on top that looks like it could quench the thirst of a small country. gotta love it.

SERVICE: spotty b/c only 2 servers. i was annoyed last nite when there was no line, & she told us it'd be 45 min-1 hr wait. i was like, is this b/c we're not korean?! it didn't look like the wait would be that long, so i thought she was trying to dissuade us from eating there. we ordered takeout, & 10 minutes later, a table magically opened up which she offered to us. good customer svc is about setting expectations, but i forgive the chicken garage b/c they're OPEN TILL 2 AM EVERY NITE.

DECOR: wiggedy-wack. wooden, wood, woody. low ceilings (b/c it's a garage). i like using the bamboo screens in the booths for privacy. i've never had to sit in the back, & i think i'd rather wait for a booth.

BATHROOM: i just hate going in there. something about it is gross. prob b/c i know so many drunk ppl use it so i'll need to do some cleaning before i can sit my ass down. i hate the mirror in a picture frame. & if it's occupied, there's really no place to wait b/c it's a narrow aisle w/servers running up & down.

OVERALL: another reliable late nite joint that i'm glad to have in my back pocket, esp b/c it's 5 minutes away from my friend's house! life is good when i can get a deep fried chicken & personal keg of beer pretty much anytime!
author: miss b.

description:
If you were to walk by the street and open the door, you'd be amazed at what they did to a garage in a Sunset home. When you get in, you'll feel as if you just entered the dining area of a pirate ship. My friends and I usually refer to this place as "The Garage" because, hey, you're eating and drinking in one.

I usually get pretty smashed in here. We normally order a bunch of bottles of Soju and a few large pitchers of Hite. The food here isn't bad either. Try their seafood pancake and chicken wings. They're damn tasty when we get drunk. 

Oh yea, and this place is also a Korean restaurant. I forgot to mention that. When it gets late, people usually start smoking inside, so if you aren't good with dealing with 2nd hand smoke, I would recommend coming here early.
author: Andrew W.

description:
I finally ate at the garage.  I'm not sure they ever had 10 people show up already primed from a day of drinking in Golden Gate park but that is exactly what they got this past Saturday.

The food was okay.  The sauce on the first dish we got was great, although I got the sneaking suspicion it wasn't exactly made from scratch.  Doesn't matter though because I don't think this place puts itself out there as a palce to get the best korean cuisine in the city.  The wings were good and I'd love to order a pile of them for the table and drink it up with some buddies someday.

It's a place to get your soju on, smoke some cigs if it's after 10pm, and eat just enough food to let you keep drinking for hours on end.

*they do have spam on the menu and I will be back to order it!
author: Luis M.

description: The food is too little for the price. Very stingy on side dishes compared to other Korean restaurants. The waitresses are not rude but they are not polite either. For that price, Shin Toe Bul Yi on Taraval Street is much better. PS: The restaurant is more like a slightly classier version of bubble tea stations for teenagers are youngsters.
author: Myint L.

description:
mm garage... 

overpriced soju, ok food, out in the friggin boonies.. im far from the avenues.... still i must give it 4 stars.. why? how do i love thee? let me list the ways:

im too lazy to make my own flavored soju.. 
they serve korean beer-water.. OB & HITE
free shrimp chips
i get to make the TSAHHH sound after taking each shot.. [if you don't know the sound.. watch sassy girl again eheh]
ding-dong.. the most awesome invention EVAR.. doorbell next to each table for service.. it's hard not to press it for fun.. 
spicy ramen soup with rice cake and whatever else.. yum
author: Donna H.

description:
hole-in-the-wall restaurant is what this place is. actually it's a garage, turned restaurant. Whatever it is I LOVE this freakin' place.

I've visted this place on mutiple occasions and i can say that they are very consistent in food, service, and occupancy. I ALWAYS have to wait at least 30 minutes to eat there, and i usually go around 10 or 11 *WTF*. I love each and every of their appetizers, they are all so tasty and go really well with soju..(however the hell you spell it).. on to my main course!
