The pork shoulder was presented beautifully on the plate but it was a vegetarian nightmare and it was served cold. Ugh. I'll chock that up to inexperience with korean menus. 

As a people, the Koreans must be great conservers of water and have marvelously low baseline blood pressures because the salt content is HIGH. I didn't realize this fact until about 4am when I woke up dying of thirst. If you're like me, keep a glass of water bedside but definitely don't let a little sodium chloride keep you from Toyose.

Great place for a salty singles v-day dinner.
author: Corey F.

description:
Toyose hits the spot.

Two visits so far, each one very satisfying.

I've tried both the peach and pineapple soju, very smooth and tasty. $11 a bottle.

I dig the kimchi fried rice, good stuff. The seafood Udon is great if you feel like having soup. the seafood tastes fresh and the noodles are chewy. I've had Calamari and the Kimchi Pancakes and found those dishes appetizing as well. The bill tends to add up but Toyose is worth each and every visit. Next time chicken wings and Strawberry Soju for sure.
author: Ruel D.

description:
This is what you can call a hole in a wall. A korean restaurant and bar in a garage. The soju is awesome here, and reasonably priced, the hite and OB .. MY FAVORITE BEERS OF ALL TIME! The food is good. The Seafood pancake was delicious... the fried chicken wings, the friend pot stickers... just everything was great. 

I would've given this place 5 stars, if it weren't were the smoking that's allowed inside.. gross... coming out smelling like cigarettes.
author: Brian P.

description:
I've walked by this place so many times on the way down to the beach, and if not for Yelp, I'd have no idea what it is.  Seriously, who builds a restaurant in a garage?

Well, I'm damn glad they did.  

There were only two of us tonight, so we only got two dishes, and they were both delicious.  I was not sure what to expect from the calamari and bulgogi saute, but it was really good; the two flavors worked extremely  well together.  It was definitely freshly made and hit the spot.  We also got the kimchi chige, which was exactly what I was expecting -- hot, spicy, and full of pork, tofu and green onions.  A very good thing.

We got a few dishes of banchan with out meal, most of which were tasty, but I just can't deal with those little fish.  If only they'd served some of the cucumber or daikon kimchi instead....

In addition to the great food, the service was friendly (though our dishes took a little too long to come out), and I loved the country-style decor.  I will definitely come here again, hopefully with a group so I can sample more of the menu.
author: Zach P.

description:
So I love that this is a very discreet place and that the ambiance is so warm inside.  The food was pretty good...not the greatest Korean food I've tasted 
(i feel this is legitimate for me to say since I went here with a korean), but other than that...it's not as though the food was disgusting.  I was very satisfied with the taste and still left smelling like korean food with a smile on my face =D 
a little pricey, however...but i guess when you're in san francisco, it's easy for good korean food to get pricey? if you're from the south bay, though, i'd just drive down to san jose and get some cheaper bbq fix there.
author: Melissa N.

description:
Went here for a friend's birthday today, it was pretty packed at around 9-10 pm on a Sunday night. Good thing another friend came earlier to wait for the tables. There is a surprising amount of space in the little garage. Although the outside looked like a garage with a cheap scratched up sign hanging in front of it, the decor on the inside was similar to many other korean restaurants. I prefer this dimmer lighting styled restaurant than that of the brightly lit, white walled TOFU HOUSE in richmond - it just reminds me too much of a hospital. They had nifty little doorbells on the INSIDE of the place, spaced out along the walls - this was quite useful because the whole night I only saw one waitress for the whole place.

The food was okay, pretty mediocre and a little on the expensive side for what you get. I tasted two different types of pancakes, forgot which ones but they were pretty good. The chicken wings are a little dry and crunchy on the outside for me but still very edible. The Korean fried rice was more like bibimbap with a sunny side up egg on top, but it was tasty and had a nice creamy texture and taste because of the yolk melding with the rice. The eel was again mediocre, I did not even remember the taste after I ate it. The bulgogi was soggy on the bottom of the pan, and I prefer mine a little less wet. The soldier soup casserole thing was a rip off though, $2 for an additional pack of ramen?? I'll just bring one from the corner store next time (although it is the shin raymun brand instead of top ramen). 

We had the yogurt flavored soju, which had the same flavor as those Asian yogurt drinks in the little plastic bottles with the red foil cap.

- One waitress, but the food service wasn't slow, you just had to press the indoor bells to get extras (ie: napkins, water, etc)
- I hear this place gets very crowded, but it probably wasn't today, less than half hour wait for a table for 11
-Nice place to hang out and snack on stuff with your friends, especially if its later in the night and you guys have already had dinner or most other places are closed

Overall 4 stars (3.5 for food, 5 for mood and atmosphere, 3 for price).
author: Colin H.

description:
went here to other night to grab some wings to go before i start drinking

CRACKIN!!!!!

they look dry at first but damn, not at all, hella flavor, but $14 for a box of like 12 wings? wutevr though they were hellla good, and korean food is always expensive so it was expected.
author: Randy N.

description:
it was alrite

service was good

food, i had teh spicy chicken wings and they were ok, i have had better chicken. the soju was good though had yogurt and strawberry. yummy. but we overpaid for the  place so it kinda sucked.
author: Stella J.

description:
as said before, this place is literally a converted garage.  but once you set foot inside you forget where you are.  it's a pretty cozy little place.  

grub:
seafood pancake - pretty tasty
spicy chicken wings - okay (i expected a bit more from all the hype)
beef kimchi fried rice - the highlight of the meal...delicious!

quenchers:
kiwi soju - tasted like juice
pineapple soju - the alcohol was more prominent

overall i would come back and try their extensive menus. my cousins have both been here and really like the place, and it made for a great runner up for dinner since her first choice was closed.
author: Sheri N.

description:
Friend: "Let's get Soju."
Me: "OK." 
.....Later on.
Me: "WTF. Why are we at a garage?!"

Don't let the outside fool you. Toyose [ or Chicken Garage as my friends and I like to call it ] is legit. The inside is bigger than I expected and is actually decorated really decent.

I don't come here for the food but I have tried the pot stickers, calamari and cheese corn. All really decent. 

The soju is where it's at though! It's juicer/more watery than The Spot but still really tasty. They have lots of flavors: strawberry, lychee, yogurt, mango and more. 8 of us went in and ordered 6 bottles and 4 appetizers and walked out the door and paid about 9 or 10 bucks each. NOT BAD.

The crowd is super asian but the staff is really nice. They have these cool buttons at every table the calls a waitress to you. Convenient, much?!

I still haven't decided which place I like better. Toyose or The Spot. I love them both!
author: Jo Ann E.

description:
omg can't believe i never ate here till now. small place and at 6pm it gets packed already. 

kimchi fried rice u are to die for and the beef fried pot stickers. yummmmmmmmmmmm! How i love u so much!
author: Karen H.

description: If your looking for some good soul korean food...this is as good as it gets! Their kimchee fried rice is not too spicy and not too salty. Their chicken wings are not too greasy and has just the right amount of tender and crisp. Down all this with their pineapple soju and you got yourself some good down to the core korean soul food. Just make sure to make reservations, or else you will have to wait a long time for a table...cuz once ppl sit down to eat and drink...they will not want to get up.
author: JENNY P.

description:
Hoooooooly crap! this place was good!

went with a friend and ordered.

food:
the deijee bulgogi, some seafood pancake, chicken wings, and chicken giblets. That's ordered from best to last best.

I only say giblets were my least favorite is only because everything else was soooooo good. i really enjoy places that surprise me and this place was just that.

drink:
got the peach and strawberry soju. granted this is the first time i've had it before, but dayum those drinks is TAYSTEEE!
gotta try clay pot next! and i'm bringing the calvary too!

4 dishes plus the 2 soju? round 95 bones... ehhhhh it could be worse, i know now... deijee and soju... mmmmmmmm
author: Watty Y.

description:
I've been coming here for years. Whenever I can't decide were to hangout I come here. This is my sure bet backup for when I feel like going out but can't figure out where. Now let me clarify, this is no "backup", this place is awesome! The food is good, the drinks are good, the ambiance is excellent, and the waitresses are friendly helpful and know me as a regular.  
 The thing that makes toyoses service so good and efficient is that they have a typical Korean restaurant button system. You push the button they come, simple and to the point. 

The food and drinks here are what keep me coming back.

The Spicy Chicken wings are delicious, though they were bigger years back. 

The Duk Bokki is good and spicy, even better when you add ramen noodles. 
 
The Seafood pancake is ok (I've had better).... However I thought I would mention it on the list since my gf likes it.

The kimchee fried rice is an excellent complimentary dish to another main dish. 

The flavored Soju here is the best I've had. Now I haven't explored many places that offer it but the few I have been to (5 or so) have not come close to the quality that toyose offers. The Peach, and Yogurt are my two favorites however the other flavors or worth trying. "To each his own" You might like the flavors better.

Toyose will always have a place in my heart, and I wish them well in the future. I will continue to enjoy my nights there.
author: Jeff G.

description: Garage dining at its finest! Tried many of the recommended dishes and drink and was pleased. Food suits the semi pirate vibe , hubby says nah, poor fisherman village. Anyways, seafood pancake was loaded with squid, krab and onion with a sesame oil-based dipping sauce. Perfect with the clean, refreshing  mango soju. The spicy chicken wings were fried and a bit hot, delicious without any messy chili sauce. Great with beer. Octopus stew loaded with the tender cephalopod, also in a chili sauce,  featued peppers, carrots, onion and mushroom. The serving size was enough for 6 at least. Yelpers overwhelmingly recommended the kimchee rice, a very comforting dish. Bits of beef in a saucy rice overtopped with a perfect sunnyside up egg. The dish stands alone and was my overall favorite. Four dishes of banchan were served, pickled seaweed, soybeans, kimchee and dried fish. All were fine, none outstanding, but the pickled daikon served with the chicken sure was! Definitely order more! Service was efficient and friendly. No reservations taken for two though yelp facepage says they are. Note to diners, tiny place, arrive at 6 or get ready to wait. Very popular with locals.
author: Kelly K.

description:
BF and my favs

Flavored soju drinks : yogurt and strawberry 

Dishes:  Seafood pancake, chicken wings and fish roe tofu soup

And go at opening time to ensure ZERO waits!  

I've tried other places in SF but this places has the right taste to everything!
author: Tessa M.

description: This place may be good for late night grub with drinks but the food Is just okay. Have had much better, kinda pricey.
author: Ge I.

description:
Went here on a Sunday night around 6:15pm (they open at 6pm) with on of my friends. It was good that we got there early, because when we left there wasn't a line, but most of the tables were full.

Yes, it is a garage, but a nicely decorated garage. The waitress was nice and we ordered the udon noodles with shrimp, a beef and calamari dish, and the seafood pancakes.

Now the udon noodles and seafood pancakes were both really good. We got the beef and calamari sans calamari and it was good, but it was sweet. I'm not a big fan of my meat being sweet but it was good for people who like that sort of thing. 

What was really cool is that there is this doorbell on the wall that you get to press whenever you want to get the waitress' attention. 

I likely won't be coming back here (it was my first time), but it's not because of the service or anything specifically bad about the restaurant, more just because I just don't see myself as a fan of Korean food.
author: Radha S.

description: the review is for the rude customer sevice. we were a group of four nice girls, but one got the flu last minute so she wasn't able to show up. nowhere did they say when i made the reservation that it was four or more only. so we show up only to have a waitress tell us NO TABLE! in a very mean way and walk off. we didn't know what happened since we ahowed up for our reservatiom and had been waiting for half an hr to be seated. we had to walk back up to ask what happened to another waitress as the othwr one avoided us. they said we had to wait over an hr to be seated. a kind appology, or alittl warning would have been fantastic so we could have found someone else to fill the table ahead of timw. but instead we were all treated so poorly and they quickly gave our reservation to a larger group. we chose to find another korean restaurant near by where the people there were so kind. a friend who went here ahead of time said the food was good but they were pretty rude and short with them too. despite i will not be returning EVeR again. i work at a cafe and deal with difficulr customers all the time, where we have to be kind even when the customer is awful. but here we are just kind nice girls wirh a reservation that we put in weeks ago. and we are the ones being treated terribly. why would i wver give terrible service my $$. never again
author: Brittainie B.

description:
I loved the food here!  I'm not too sure of the names of the food I ate since my friend from Korea ordered for us, but I heard their wings are really good.  However we didn't get the chance to try them because we too full after our first round of orders.  But I will definitely make sure to stop by again next time I'm in SF to try out their wings.

I have to note that even though I've never been to Korean my friend whose currently a foreign exchange from Korea told me he felt like he was home again the moment he stepped in.  So it was nice to get a taste that atmosphere from thousands of miles away.
author: Victor T.

description: Crowded at night. Pretty good food. cute waitresses! Kim chee fried rice, fries, pancake?! yeah love it. kind of hard finding parking but its worth it!
author: Eva L.

description: Great restaurant even though I wonder if it's the best idea for business to have your restaurant facade looking like a garage door.  Inside, you'll find a nice cozy little place that's great for small or large groups.  I recommend the kimchi beef fried rice, seafood pancake, and bulgogi.  We also had the fried chicken wings but they were just ok.  The kimchi fried rice is unlike any other that I have had before.  I used to have Korean food in LA a lot and it used to have spicy kimchi flavor in it but Toyose did not have that.  However, whatever flavor it is (I don't know how to describe it) was very very good, just not what I was expecting.  Bulgogi was also spot on.  We also ordered some strawberry soju but they have a bunch of different flavors and it was pretty good.  Parking was also a breeze.  I'll definitely be going there again.
author: Derrick C.

description:
Background:
I went here recently with 8 friends for a birthday on a Saturday night. We made reservations for 8:00 pm and were not seated until 8:30. Thirty minutes is a ridiculous amount of time to wait when you have made reservations. The waitresses were very cold and unapologetic about it.

Atmosphere:
The atmosphere is laid back and I actually like it, which is my reason for 2 stars instead of 1. However, it is a little cramped If you sit in the front, it may be a little uncomfortable and awkward because many people wait inside so expect someone to be facing you while you eat. Sitting in the back is better.

Food:
The food is decent/mediocre but severely overpriced. Expect the entrees to average about $13-$14 each with medium sized portions. The side dishes are very small, unappealing, and flavorless. They give very little with no refills. We ordered several bottles of soju and I found them to be very inconsistent. We ordered the same flavor twice and one was weaker than the other.

Service: 
AWFUL! We were ingnored on many occasions. There is a call button you can press and the waitresses will come over. We pressed it many times and it was canceled at least 3 times. Also, we asked for popcorn 3 times only to have the requests ignored. In the end, the waitress finally came out and told us they only give you one small bowl of popcorn per bottle of soju. We ordered $280 of food and alcohol and they refused to give us popcorn which costs very little. Seriously? We ordered 6 bottles of soju which costed $11 each and they can't give us a little popcorn? I have never seen a place so frugal up to the point where it actually infuriated me. When we received our bill, they overcharged us for 9 bottles of soju instead of 6.  My guess for the bad service is because our party was already paying gratuity. They feel they can give us bad service while taking our money so that can focus on tables where they have to actually EARN their tips. 

Instead of trying to do things that will get customers to come back, they are only worried about milking you for every penny at that very moment. I don't find this a good business practice and because of that, I don't see myself going back. There are several other places like similar to this place and I suggest trying those first before trying this one.

Also, when we were leaving, everyone waiting for a table looked very pissed off. From what I see, once people sit down, they don't leave for a while so expect a long wait.
author: T H.

description:
I've never been here without Koreans to lead the way, so I've never experienced terrible service or horrendous waits, which I've heard about from other friends ... so that's just a disclaimer for my review.

This is my favorite Korean snacky place!  Their soju cocktails come in cute little glass containers (my fave is yogurt), their pajeon (sp?) is delicious and they remove all the shrimp tails thank the lord, and their fried chicken is tasty and crispy!  Oh god!  If only you weren't so far away, Toyose!

It's also located inside a garage, though they've cleverly disguised the inside to... not look like a garage.  

Overall, I like it.  I like it a lot.
author: Michelle N.

description:
3.5 stars. 

So, for my quarter of a century joint bday celebration with a friend we decided to have it here. FIRST it was going to be at Farmer Brown's, but because of their stupid policy of each person spending a minimum of $30 and a ridiculous coordination fee of $50 we decided to be a little more considerate to our birthday guests and go elsewhere. I mean c'mon Farmer Brown, how RIDICULOUS can you be? Anyway, moving on...

I called the night before the dinner and they made reservations for 20 EASILY. Now, you ask... is it really in a garage???? YES! It is. But it doesn't really look like it from the inside, they do a very good job of decorating / designing it so it doesn't look like one. The food is pretty good... there were a few dishes I didn't care for too much, and then there were some that were soo good!

Get one of their "casseroles". It's more like a huge pot of spicy soup with meat and ramen and veggies in it. It's pretty spicy, but very yummy... it's large and meant to be shared. The kimchee fried rice is also a good one to get, and isn't that spicy for those who can't take the heat. The bulgogi and calamari was alright... the spicy pork was very tasty.

Going with a big group is fun, and I hear they are open until 4am (but yelp says they open until 2am) so it seems like it would be a good late night joint for the party peoples. Def. a place to check out.

Thanks Toyose I'm so glad we chose you to hold our 25th bday celebration!
author: Kimberly F.

description:
Wings are the greatest here in all of Sunset! If you're a fan of wings covered in a sauce though, this is probably not the place for you. They've got a slight kick o them.

It gets a bit noisy during regular drinking hours and usually, there is a wait time. It's a great little hole-in-the-wall and the service is fast and efficient, mainly because you can press the button to get some service.

The soju flavors are all delicious. It's funny how it's served in an olive oil container. My personal favorite is the rice cakes with ramen noodles! Can't go wrong there! 

Bring a small group of friends, pull down the curtains, and have a good time!
author: Grace L.

description:
This place is more for drinks than actual food. Its a chill korean restaurant with all types of soju, korean drinks and hot pot style spicy korean food.

We had the meat combo soup platter that had: Ramen, spam, sausage, tofu, kim chee, rice cakes, and it came on a hot pot burner, large enough for 6 persons.  it was really salty due in part to the spam and sausage and not cheap $26.
The fried chicken wings were also suggested by our waitress so we ordered that and it was tasty, and another tofu soup dish that tasted just like the meat combo spicy tofu soup. 
We also ordered the lamb shank and unfortunately this turned out to be a disappointment-it was cold!  the guys were dying for some gumption and ordered this but it was more of an appetizer than an actual entree albiet it was ginormous!

We did have some korean wine called bo bo cha chu? that was very tasty, and even as a non drinker I enjoyed it.

Bill ended to be about $20 something a person, this place is small and the outside looks like a garage so if you miss it driving by drive more slowly -) Overall this place was OK I dont know if i would go back again at least not for dinner. Service was not so great either- you have this button at your table that you press and THEN they come to you. What ever happened to dining SERVICE?
author: Petri Y.

description: The food is good. We ordered the seafood pancake, chicken wings, japchae, and spicy pork. They were all very delicious, but our favorite would be the seafood pancake. We were in line before they opened, so they we got a seat right away. They table across from us was so unbearably loud and their sojus didn't even arrive yet. We didn't get any banchans.
author: bob k.

description:
I love this place. I go here once a week because the spicy calamari with noodles is very addicting!!!I I usually order the spicy chicken wing, kimchee fried rice, spicy calamari with noddles and pork and vegetable spicy soup. The food is very good and the soju is awesome! 
Yogurt and strawberry are the best flavors.!!! On Friday nights it gets really pack so i suggest arrive early because the wait is long and people are having fun drinking so it takes awhile........The service is kinda slow sometimes......overall its a cool spot to drink and eat.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
3.5 stars. 

I do like this place but I have a bad first impression of it (see my review of Arang for details). Here's what I've had at Toyose:

Kim chi bokkeumbap - Tastes really great but the portion is really kind of small for being 10 or 11 dollars. If it was 1.5x bigger I think it's totally worth it. I really like how they put a nice egg on the top. 

Seafood doenjangjjigae - This one is really great at Toyose. Probably my favorite thing I had here. I'll order this every time. 

Spicy  fried chicken  - Nice and crispy, it could be a little spicier but doesn't really matter. I love the pickled radish and side salad that comes with this. 

Ohjingeo bokkeum - This one is tasty too, and good variety of veggie in there. 

Lemon and Yogurt soju cocktail - lemon is tastier! it's 11 dollars for one oil dispenser sized portion. they also have peach, pineapple, cranberry which is more selection than Arang.

The waitress working here on Monday night was really friendly and nice. And my friend thought she was cute. I think the one at Arang is cuter, btu that's just me. But there's one working here on weekends that isn't very nice at all. 

So food is pretty good here and fun atmosphere too (come with a lot of friends) but a little pricey because it's like same prices as the really quality Korean restaurants like in Oakland.
author: Mastiff B.

description:
Pros:

Kimchee fried rice is good. 
Croquettes are tasty.
Service bell at your table to call the waitress over.

Cons:

Long wait, chain smokers.
author: Christine C.

description: They have the best kimchi fried rice EVER!!! I will definitely be coming back! KOREAN!!!
author: Derek C.

description: I temporarily live with my friend now so I've been checking lots of places in Sunset. So far it's the best Korean food I've had in years. Means are outstanding! I HIGHLY recommend trying this place. It's always packed so reservation is desirable.
author: Vladimir P.

description:
I came here last night with some friends. If it wasn't for them, I would have never found it. It's got a sign on a garage that is all in Korean and apparently that says Toyose :) Well anyways just because I couldn't find it doesn't mean no one else could, because this little whole in the wall place was packed.  It was a little cramped cause I think it actually is built out of a garage, but still pretty comfy. The food was really good though. I was told fried chicken is their thing. It was good, not really too greasy (not like a kfc) and tasty. I also had their turnip pancake. That will a bowl of Kimchi rice .. oh It was excellent. I would definitely come back. 

** Even though it is a little cramped, I didn't come out of their smelling greesy or oily. ... Well at least I don't think I did :(
author: Greg G.

description: I Love this place!   I would say this is one of the few Korean places we go to  just so we can chill and chat with friends and good company.  When you need something to order, you have a door bell ringer on the wall to request for your waitress. The food is amazingly good.  It's cozy and small.  We're always ordering the fried whole chicken with the sweet radish on the side (extra sweet radish please!).  The place gets packed so get there early.  Parking is good since it's outer sunset. Again the food is amazing!!  I haven't found anything that I don't like.  =)  I just love this place cause it's cozy and we get VIP treatment!  yay!
author: Paige L.

description:
Came here the last night my family's in town. They were dying to try Shin Toe Bul Yi, but it was closed.

Ordered everything that we would have ordered at STBY, but after tasting every dish, we kept saying...the one at STBY seems to be better...

The service is not sufficient: 1 tiny girl waiting, taking orders, distributing food, cleaning up, ringing up, and everything else, is not enough. Poor girl!!
author: Yuchi C.

description:
suburban garage turned korean restaurant? hellooooo!

going to toyose is like going to the house of the grandmother you never had. provided that your grandmother is korean, technologically savvy and slips soju into your koolaid.

hidden in the boonies of the sunset, it's a trek to get there so if you're planning to go, go by car. it's literally a garage in a home in the suburbs that's been converted into a korean restaurant. and each table has a buzzer menu that helps to facilitate ordering. 

while that's appealing in itself, toyose serves the best korean food in the city. if you're going for one thing, definitely get the kimchi fried rice - it's a very hearty dish with pieces of bulgogi and kimchi, topped with a fried egg. crazy delicious and comforting. the bulgogi is also incredibly tender and delicious.

the soju here is also among the best i've had, period. usually soju can be harsh, but this goes down so easily. the best part is that it's served in a olive oil-esque bottle, and you pour it into shot glasses, whose bottoms are lined with the faces of korean singers and models. surprise!  there are a ton of options, from strawberry to mango to yogurt. the yogurt is my personal favorite. it's somewhat similar to yakult. 

the one thing i've tried that i wouldn't recommend is the seafood pajon. it's more batter than seafood, which is kind of disappointing.
author: Jessica S.

description:
The concept was nice and comfy but the service was not so good. We needed up having to wait for a long time to get drinks and our food.  
The food was also not that great at least not fried rice. I will say that their chicken wings were really good. I will go again for that but I am not a fan.
author: Marie-Claire R.

description: This place is a nice chill restaurant to grab dinner and a couple of drinks with friends. i prefer going on weekdays as the wait on the weekend can get pretty long. The food and the cocktail sojus are all great. I prefer the rice rolls in spicy sauce, add ramen and pot-stickers. For the soju I like the strawberry.If you get the booth next to the entrance, you can see all the graffiti on the wall which i find entertaining.
author: David N.

description:
Hole in the wall, and awesome Korean restaurant--

Expect a long wait to be seated on Friday and Saturday nights.

Expect to spend an average of $20-25 per person for drinks and food.

I LOVE their Soju drinks--the Strawberry Soju's my favorite.

Somebody else mentioned the Spicy Chicken Wings--I know those aren't exactly Korean, but those wings were TIGHT! 

The Kimchi Fried Rice is really good, too.
author: J K.

description: OMG!!!! Toyose, the whole in the wall. I mean literally. I came here when  my homeboy called me up after the Giants won. Go Giant's!!!!! The food was great like their Kimchi Fried Rice and Pork and Vegetables. Also to top it off we had pineapple Soju. The place was great even w/ their own bamboo dividers by the door.If you never tasted Korean food before, I really recommend checking this place out. When you drive up to the spot, don't be discouraged by the garage door. Its part of the allure.
author: Matt B.

description: Went there a year ago....I know... Hope this review is not too late. Great ambience - in a garage. Very popular. Long line. Food is good. We had kim chee fried rice, a spicy tofu soup and Korean pancake. Service is good and friendly.
author: Mark W.

description:
I've been hearing a lot about how great the food is at Toyose so I was dying to come here. I came here with my sister and we ordered the fried chicken wings and kimchi stew or soup. We were expecting the chicken wings to have a sweet glaze so were disappointed. It had great flavor and crispy texture but I came for the glaze on top of that yummy crispiness! The kimchi stew was good it tasted similar to soondubu (soft tofu soup) but without the soft tofu. THe kimchi gave the soup a more ferment-y and vinegar like taste. I enjoyed it but I came with such high hope for the glaze on the wings and soft tofu in mind but left with either things satisfied. 
It seems to me most people come here with a group of friends and order food with soju so I guess that might make it a good place to hang out and eat good food but to satisfy my soft tofu craving I wouldn't come here for that especially for the price. We ordered two plates but end up paying $28 (w/ tip) just for the two of us.
author: Donna C.

description:
So korean is a favorite cuisine of mine and I came here on a Thursday late night for a midnight snack. I got a seafood pancake and a kimchi fried rice. To-go though, we weren't staying to drink and I was getting tired.

-First off, this is a straight hole in the wall. Or more like hole in the garage. The place is so inconspicuous. The only thing that stands out is the backlighted duck sign. But when you walk in, you'll be surprised, its not as jenky and rundown as you would image. Its actually a nice spot.
-The food was good. First of all, the seafood pancake was packed with seafood. It would be great if it were not for the sogginess of the pancake. And I know what you might think, I got it to-go so it might have been sitting in the to-go box for a while. But no! I ate it like 3 minutes after we got it. 
-The kimchi fried rice was pretty good. One of the best I've had. With a runny yolk egg and some seaweed as garnish, it was a great dish. The rice had a good amount of spiciness and it was flavorful.
-Total bill was $25 bucks for two dishes. A little pricey for the food and I'm not really sure if its worth it BUT...
-Soju bottles are only $11 bucks. Thats pretty cheap if you want to drink in an intimate little place with a couple friends. I don't suggest large groups. Max 6 or 7. But great little soju bar if you wanna chill, eat and get drunk with some people. 
-Service was cool. But I wish I knew how to speak korean. I'd have definitely gotten a hook up!

The price may not be an attractive factor but I recommend trying it out once and you can determine for yourself. I'll be coming back to try out the noodles. And the soju. Haha, I think you need to drink here to experience the full flavor.
author: Aron L.

description:
This is my favorite place to hang out. When I was younger, this would be just for drinking, but now I've come to enjoy the food here also. It's not really the hang-out for people in my age group (mid-20s), it's more for young twentys and older korean people, but  I'm never going to get sick of this place. 

I greatly enjoying drinking here  because you can sit down and eat too if you wanted to. The drinks are cheap also, and not cheap as in bad tasting. 

The food's awesome here. I love the chicken wings and the seafood pancakes are my favorite. I love the shrimp chips they give you on the house when you're drinking also. 

It gets really really crowded here on weekend nights,  so if you know you're coming here in advance, it's best to make a reservation. It's a very small place. I tend to come here on Thursdays because if I don't make a reservation here on Friday or Saturday night, I'm not getting a seat. People who get there at 10, don't leave until they close at 2. People go there to drink at that time. 

Would I come here again? All the time! Give me a bottle of hite and soju and I'm good to go!
author: Calvin L.

description:
One of the best Korean places in SF!  I've been here a few times and every time I am amazed at how the restaurant looks JUST like a house. Such a trip. But it's a really nice hole-in-the-wall type Korean restaurant.  I love the kimchi fried rice and the rice cake dish. Yum! 

Side note: one thing was kind of weird, we asked the waitress for more tea and she said it would take 20 minutes... what kind of tea takes 20 minutes?? Needless to say, we never got our refill of tea. Hm.
author: Christy H.

description:
When my homies and I are super bored, we always find ourselves at this hole in the wall - also known as "the garage." I'm not sure exactly why we come here so often. It's not the food, I'll tell you that much. It's the alcohol! Toyose is a great place to drink some yummy flavored soju and have fun with a group of friends. On a Friday or Saturday, you can be sure that you will have to wait at least 30 minutes just to get a table, so call ahead to see if they have space for you. 

Recommendations: 
Strawberry, Peach, and Yogurt Soju
author: Lisa T.

description:
I been going to this spot since it opened up about 10 years or so ago.
One of the friends family spots where I always got treated well.
(buddy Alan's aunt & uncle's spot) To bad Alan isn't working there anymore. I went 3 weeks ago with a special lady friend and enjoyed the food.Not much has changed in there except the tables and seating are much nicer. Been about 4 years since I last visited this place and only the service has changed. The waitress who I never seen before was not very friendly and a bit cold. I am wondering if this place changed to new owners? Humm i'll find ousoon enough and if that's the case it explains the service.Still good eats and in the sunset.
author: Peter J.

description:
I am a little bit surprised by a lot of the reviews that this place has received on Yelp. Quite frankly this restaurant is underwhelming at most. Below I have detailed out the reasoning behind my rating based on all of the elements that I feel contribute to an overall great restaurant experience.

Location/Appearance - Yes this place is located in what looks like a garage. Once one gets over the fact that it is a funky location and appears like a garage you will realize that you are deep in the Outer Richmond eating in a crammed restaurant. Three of the tables are actually located right next to the bathroom. This restaurant is very small. The tables are somewhat fun because of the way you are seated. However, the overall size and proximity to the bathroom really brings down the rating in my book.

Food - This was probably the most disappointing part of Toyose in my opinion. I cannot understand why so many people are leaving positive feedback about the food. It is truly overwhelming when compared to the reviews that it has been getting. We tried the Kimchi Fried Rice, the Spicy Pork, and the Katsu Chicken. I enjoyed the creativity behind the Kimchi Fried Rice, but quite frankly the overall flavors from the rice dish were nonexistent. It tasted like something similar to what you can get at any fast food Korean or Chinese restaurant in the area. The Spicy Pork was good but not outstanding. I think there are many other places that I would go for spicy pork as opposed to Toyose. The Katsu Chicken was even worse as it had a horrible flavor to it. The food also arrived really quickly which of course gives me the feeling that it was not very fresh at all and everything was likely pre-cooked.

Service - The restaurant has an interesting system for getting the attention of the hostess and waitresses. There is a button at each table that enables you to call on the waitress whenever you are ready to order. This makes the ordering process flawless and quick. The service was actually very good. They did make a mistake on our original order but fixed it very quickly.

Overall - My thinking is that this place is known as a late night place to grab food and drinks with friends. It seems that because it is open late it has become a destination for small groups looking to grab a few beers and eat some filling food. However, for any purpose other than grabbing late night food I would pass. Toyose just does not do anything really the great.
author: Bennett D.

description: Is it just me or is this place a bit overpriced?? I mean seriously! they didn't even have my B.B.Q Short Ribs! what kind of a korean restaurant doesn't have short ribs?? Let's see...the famous fried chicken is not so great...I rather eat KFC Hot Wings. n then ordered some seafood pancake with green onions which is not bad...and we also ordered beef bulgogi and peach Soju which came out to $56! seriously..with tips it came out to $66! wow..that was some expensive SNACKS! I still don't get what the RAVE is all about with this place. Maybe if I have extra money and want to spend it on SNACKS..this is def the place to be! Be Prepared To Leave HUNGRY!
author: Rika K.

description: i came to this Korean restaurant with my friends. it is a great place to have Korean food for dinner, and the food really tastes great. i will come again even though the street parking is hard, and the restaurant opens late.
author: Janet N.

description: So we went here on a Sunday @6pm (right when they opened). it took them 10 minutes to even come to our table & offer us to order drinks or anything after I pressed the service bell on trhe wall a few times. The kimchee fried rice was excellent-probably the best part of the evening next to the pitcher of Hite. The bulgogi was good too (not the as good as Wooden Charcoal on Geary/11th Ave). Their tofu soup & udon were a miss. The udon was in a salty broth & the tofu soup was not quite spicy enough.Tempura was just ok as well-nothing special This place came huighly receommended to us by a few different people, seems like maybe we caught then on an off night? I expect a lot more for my money (e.g. side dishes like kimchee, sprouts & steamed rice included). The garage ambiance is interesting-cool concept. Keep in mind street parking may be tough & you may have a long wait to get a table. We may try them again sometime.
author: Maria T.

description:
Toyose is deserving of 4.5 stars! Heard of this place for some time now, so I was very very excited to finally make the trip out there with a person whose been several times. A lot bigger than I imagined given it's a Sunset house garage. Cheesy decor, but you get past it when you see the screen that can come down for more privacy and the wait staff call button..and of course the food and soju! 

My companion and I order the following: 
- Green onion seafood pancakes - Not a fan of seafood usually, but the tentacles and the like embedded in the pancake were well masked with the actual pancake and sauce. I'm glad we ordered it as it appears to be one of their specialties. 
- Kimchee fried rice - Love the raw egg atop it; makes it more like bi bim bap and I LOVE bi bim bap. Flavors were right on point and I helped myself to a hefty portion of the platter. 
- Gyozas - Nothing to sing about, but definitely done right in terms of crispiness and arrived pipping hot. Generous portion too, if I recall. 
- Marinated pork with tofu - Mmmmm...unlike any pork dish I've had at a Korean restaurant. Tangy and sweet and overall well seasoned pork with fresh tofu pieces. I'd order that again! 
- Yogurt soju - Very good flavor. Though not the best I've had. Prefer it to have a thicker consistency. 
- Other flavored soju (most likely peach as it's my and my companions second favorite usual flavor): The fact I can't truly recall makes me conclude it wasn't that memorable. But we did finish off both. 

Overall, the portions were generous, and we brought leftovers in the fried rice, pork/tofu and pancake. The wait staff weren't super attentive, but did respond quickly to the "call button". Go early on a weekday for quick seating. I'll likely go again as the food seemed very authentic and I agree with the many that have said, "...it's like eating at a Korean mama's kitchen."
author: Marie B.

description:
This is a true hole-in-the-wall.

Come here for late night snacks (Korean snacks). Fried chicken (HIGHLY recommended), soups, meats, and alcohol. Mainly soju, and Korean beer.

Please don't come here for a 5 course meal, and expecting to consume a gourmet feast. This is the Korean version of American bar food. 

***A hint to non-Koreans. Koreans don't wait on tables, like Americans. You literally have to call them over. Them come right away, about 95% of the time. The words to yell is "yogi yuh". It literally means, "over here". It's not rude in our culture, and it's pretty mandatory if you want service. This is why there is always a misconception, that Korean restaurants have bad service.***
author: Charles K.

description:
Driving from downtown to this place on the other side of the world somewhat satisfied my Korean food craving temporarily -- the seafood pancake, kimchi fried race, and chicken wings were scrumplicious (potstickers were good but not that memorable), but eating here is like eating at your Korean friend's house where the mom isn't happy to cook for you or pay you any attention -- which would be fine if compensated for in small dishes (totally key!) or more food for the $.  

I love shrimp chips; starting off the meal with them makes me feel like some rebellious teenager.  But then we got two of the tiniest "small dishes" I've ever seen, only after asking for them in Korean.  The food is yummy enough, but with the bill coming to $80 for 4 people including tip where we didn't order any bulgogi or substantial meat dishes and thus my inner carnivore hungering for something more, I think I'd prefer to go elsewhere.  One extra star for the fun and lively atmosphere (caused by the patrons filling their tums with food and beer).
author: Erica Y.

description:
Excellent for late night dinner or snack since Toyose open till midnight ! 

Toyose staple food :
- Kimchi fried rice (it's addictive) 
- Seafood pancake
- Fried chicken wing (very juicy & crunchy..nyummy!)
- Fruity soju (they do check ID though)

I think every table order at least one of them. 

The downside is the average-to-slow-service since there's only ONE server. I believe it's also causing a long queue..besides its small place. However, they should adjust the lighting too as it can bring dizziness (too dark and yellowish) @__@ Although the food is great, it's overpriced for Korean food. Prepare to spend $15-$25 just for late night snack.

Overall, Toyose is one of the hidden gem in Sunset area and definitely a must-try !!
author: Jazzleen H.

description:
been here three times with a buddy of mine who brought me here for the first time.....

one star for the ambiance/idea - kinda get a feel like ure in a lil korean village....very intimate setting given the small space and lighting....inside is small (converted a garage into a soju/appetizer bar) but really clean/fresh

anotha star for the cute asian girls that frequent the place and work there

third star for the really tasty soju ( assorted flavas, my fav is the yogurt and aloe) and appetizers (bomb chicken wings and korean pizza)

fourth star for da price (relatively cheap given that most korean soju bars tend to be a bit pricey - not really a bar in terms of set-up....there arent any barstools or bartenders or nething like that....setup is that of a korean restaurant with booths/seats but the menu is not a full korean restaurant menu.....theres plenty of stuff but jus which they offered more korean dishes....could be the LA Koreatown in me speaking...dunno)
author: Sang L.

description: They had garlic fries at a Korean restaurant. What a surprise! Yumm and i'm confuse please pass the ketchup, dude.
author: Ronnel C.

description: Good food, cocktail soju, and the atmosphere is just right. Love coming here with my friends when we just want to eat, drink and talk.
author: Jessica T.

description:
If you've ever been to Porno (aka Dan Sung Sa) then this place is probably 1 up, the ambience is pretty much the same with wooden tables and seats, but a lot cleaner. This kbar is settled in a very quiet neighborhood in a garage. the space is very limited thus there would be a wait if there are hella people.. the group I went with waited approx. 20-25 min for a table at around 1am.. 

The food is was really good, but we only ate a couple dishes.. the kimchi fried rice is bomb.. and we also had the bundae chigae.. which was also really good.. 

The peach soju is by far one of the best flavored soju's I've had in a long time.. pineapple was whatevers and the beer is like everywhere else.. they only have Hite/OB. However, I do appreciate it if more kbars can carry Cass.. 

Overall this place was legit. Good experience.
author: Chris L.

description: Why 3 stars because I have been getting ripped!! i discovered The Spot on Taraval which has a better food selection that is cheaper and tastes way better.
author: Rod S.

description: I really liked that the place is in a garage, that they are open every night of the week until 2 am, and the beef potstickers and kim chi and beef fried rice with fried egg is delicious. Definitely gonna be regular.
author: Priscilla M.

description:
I came with my girlfriend, who is korean, so maybe they have preferential treatment? It was great! Well, not so great on my wallet. For five of us, we spent 2 bills on food and booze. Not bad, in the end. 

the booze is reasonbly priced, and the bugged the fuck out of the waitress, with the buzzer, but she always came out with a smile!

The food is salty for a reason. For you to be thristy, and drink more.

Great place! Just go!
author: Kelvin M.

description: I've been hearing about this place for years.  I'm sad to get there so late, thrilled I finally got there.  Toyose met & exceeded my wildest expectations.  And they have the best fried spicy chicken wings in San Francisco.
author: HY L.

description:
Alright this place doesn't really need another thorough review so I'm gonna keep it short and sweet. Everyone comes here to for the flavored soju, the fact that the food is just frigging delicious is a just plus. I wish this place was opened for lunch, cause I work RIGHT across the street and my coworkers and  I would love nothing more than to go during lunch time and get in a few shots. HAhaha I kid. But seriously, I really do wish it was open for lunch! We'd be there everyday. For the food, of course.
A few tips:
1.) Dinner time is pretty much between 6:30-9. Anytime after that is just gonna be full of people drinking. But the wait is not as long.
2.) CALL AHEAD. Seriously. I've made the mistake of walking in at 7pm on a Friday and had to wait nearly an hour. Now I know better and call a day or two ahead to reserve a table. 
3.) Since it's kinda true most of their dishes taste like kimchi, expect their Kimchi dishes to taste especially delicious. Kimchi Jjigae and Kimchi fried rice, I'm lookin' at you!
4.) They're strict on checking ID's but not about the actual underage drinking taking place. My friends and I shared ONE shot glass before and we were right by the register/kitchen, impossible not to notice what we were doing. 

I love Korean food, and this is my favorite Korean place to hit up. Plus they play the latest kpop jams so no complaints from me! 

P.S. No one calls this place Toyose. It's either "The Garage" or "The Korean Garage" or "That Korean Restaurant in a Garage"
author: Jen L.

description:
BEWARE if you aren't completely inebriated-DO NOT EAT HERE!! food sucks! I ordered bulgogi with calamari- and you couldnt tell beef from squid (yes it was that bad) the bulgogi was too salty and the calamari was overcooked and rubbery.the boo ordered seafood tempura and got 2 slices of zucchini, more rubbery calamari, a big leaf of parsley, a few apple slices  and imitation crab all doused in fish and chip batter-it was as if they opened the pantry and went "hmmm what can I throw in fish batter to pass off as tempura??" GROSS! i mean cmon- isn't the point of having tempura having it in tempura batter..luckily we ordered some potstickers which would be the one redeeming factor..that and the anchovies..
I am actually writing this review while in the restaurant because the food sucks soooo bad I can't even stomach it and refuse to eat it .. so again - unless high off your socks or drunk as hell - save yourselves the trouble and avoid this place!! 
oh and also-don't expect any service unless you ring the bell!!
author: rain d.

description: Finally, a place that takes me back.... I LOVE this place for its quirkiness and great food. This is a true find!
author: SF Y.

description: This is a really small restaurant but the food is good. The kimchi fried rice is soooooooooo soooo good! The best I've had so far! And if you like cheese and corn then you should try the Corn&Cheese dish, it might seem disappointing but I personally liked the melted and seared mozzarella cheese over corn and some greens, would be even better on pizza. The soju here is always a must have with your food. The soju is like a yogurt drink that comes in many fruit flavors. Alcohol and meat is always good on cold nights in sf.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Good food, cute garage place, but sorry I have to say that I've had (much) better :(

Well their kimchi fried rice was great, and so was the ramen dubboki. They put so much yogurt on their soju yogurt, I like it, some might want more soju in it. But I personally like to make my own mix of calpico (or any yogurt drink) and soju.
author: Sendy K.

description:
Went here with my family a few nights back and i thought this place was alright. In terms of the food, it was pretty good. I had the chicken cutlet which was two pieces of deep fried chicken breasts with salad and rice. For the price, the portions were decent and the quality was good. I also thought their establishment was creative and unique. They were able to turn the garage of an Outer Sunset house into a small Korean restaurant and bar which is very cool.
But the place loses points because of the fact that it's small, a little too small in my opinion. I really hate it when people watch me eat. We were seated in a booth right next to the waiting area. People waiting to be seated were literally right next to us, facing our table, watching us. This was very annoying. Also, because of it's size, the wait is very long usually half and hour to an hour. So remember to reserve seats if you plan on coming here. Overall, I'm glad to have tried it, but I'm not going back.
author: Austin C.

description: What Angi said!  http://www.yelp.com/biz/toyose-san-francisco#hrid:86FW6b00FF3QpkxAX5vJiw
author: Amar P.

description: KIM CHI FRIED RICE! I liked it allot. It's a good combination of fried rice with a fried egg on top.The peach soju was good too. I wanna go back so I could try other menu items. the food was good there.
author: Matt D.

description: Went here recently...I was really excited to come here because of all the good Yelp.  Well, I could turn this into a long and painful story, but I won't.  Basically, if you're not Korean, you are not welcomed here.
author: Big D.

description:
I wanted to try this place for a long time and  I finally got to try it tonight. I was here awhile back with one of my good friend but, the place was too packed, so we ended up eating at another restaurant. Tonight, kind of packed too. Wait time was about 30-40 minutes.  we...

Ordered:
Kimchi fried rice X2 ~ 11 each
cold pork shank X1~  $17
spicy fried chicken wings X1 ~ 13

The food was GOOD!. Especially, the kimchi fried rice. We order a plate and can't resist to order a second plate! The cold pork shank was okay,  I had better. The spicy fried chicken was good too. 

interior: small
food: excellent
service: good

Definitely will come back. Highly recommend to eat here.
author: Sammi W.

description:
Toyose holds a special place in my heart. This garage makes me so happy!

Always a great time here, service is always super nice even though we're always late for our reservation and we constantly ring the doorbell thing to call the waitress over.

Highlights:
Chicken wings
Fishcake soup
Kimchee fried rice
Kimchee pancake (portion is huge!)

Tips to newcomers-
~make a reservation if you have a large party
~order a bottle of straight soju to mix with your flavored soju (they're not strong enough)
author: A K.

description: i love that everyone calls this place "the garage".  Always fun to come here and sit in a booth and ring the doorbell for service.  I still don't understand why korean food is soooo expensive, but it's always tasty.  the onion pancakes are flavorful and my friends loved the dipping sauce.  the chicken wings were ok, but i'm always expecting them to be like at the korean market, sweet sticky and garlicky.  these are just fried.  Their soju here is a must.  the mixed ones.  and i always like the yogurt one.  Better to go here with at least 4 people so you can share food and drink.  A great place to talk and nibble.
author: Susan Z.

description: this time our group got the seafood casserole, the strawberry and mango soju, the pork and kimchi hot pot, the seafood pancake, fries, and fried calamari. I found out they distribute free rice based on the amount of dishes you order. The seafood pancake was a little bit less soggy compared to last time. The casserole was basically a soup with a bunch of clams, mussels, crab, frozen shrimp, head-on shrimp, string mushrooms, and other misc stuff. It was ok for being one of the more expensive items on the menu although it was big enough to probably feed 3 people.  The fries and fried calamari want anything special. Overall this visit doesnt really change my view about this place: a little pricey for mediocre tasting but different and unique kinds of korean food
author: Robert Y.

description: Finally had a chance to try this place.  This place is so small that you have to wait for a table.  Ordered the chicken wings, casserole(spam, sausage,tofu,and ramen in spicy soup), kimchi fried rice, kimchi pancake, and yogurt soju. Let me say I came in here with high expectations and it was a let down. The chicken wings were too fried and it was tasteless.  The best was the kimchi pancake.  The soju was okay but wished it was sweeter.  they also give you free popcorn but it's not warm and it was burnt too.
author: Ann L.

description: After hearing so much about this place, I finally got a chance to check them out last night! It was really not bad. It's quite different from the other Korean menu.  But what we ordered, and I have no idea what we ordered was good.  I only remember the kimchi fried rice being really good!  Def. coming back.
author: AhLin C.

description:
Toyose, what an interesting little find in tucked away in the Outer Sunset. If it weren't for the Toyose sign and some Christmas lights, I would've driven right past it. My BF and I came here last night after hearing positive things from a friend. We got there early only to see that the place didn't open until 6pm, so we decided to sit in the car and talk. Once 6pm rolled around, we went inside and the place was already filling up quickly. 

The skinny on this place in a few bullet points:

Food - 3.5 stars
- Better than most Korean places in the city. 
- Seafood pancake was good, but too salty. Quantity was enough to feed about four people. 
- Corn cheese was good at first, but only the first couple of bites. Once the dish cooled down, it became big blobs of hard cheese clumps. It's a good dish to try on the first time with a bunch of people who can finish it off within minutes of being served, but we can do without during future visits. Dish would have been better with some tabasco or hot sauce on the side.
- Spicy fried chicken wasn't bad at all. The batter was crunchy and meat was moist. Contrary to some of the reviews I read about the fried chicken, quality was pretty good and it was a lot better than I expected. 
- Kimchi and pork chiggae was the highlight of the evening. Instead of pork bits, Toyose used pork belly meat. The choice of meat made the dish more enjoyable as the fat soaked up the flavors of the soup. Excellent soup for a cold day.
- No pan chan included in the meal. Mind you, this is a Korean drinking place, not a typical sit down restaurant. 

Ambiance and facilities - 4 stars
- I'm a fan of little Korean drinking holes. It's where my BF and I usually hang out at in So. Cal with friends, so it's nice to finally find one in the city. 
- Decor reminds me of a lot of Korean restaurants in LA/OC. Feels homey and makes me happy. 
- This place gets really packed, so if you end up sitting by the front entrance, people waiting to be seated will be standing right next to you while you eat and cheering for you to finish the meal quickly. Really awkward. 
- Restroom was clean and big. 

Price - 2.5 stars
- SOOOOO expensive for Korean food! Maybe it's because there aren't that many good Korean restaurants in the city, so Toyose has the ability to inflate their prices. Seriously though... $25 for a boodaechiggae? It looked like it would only serve 3-4 people too. 

Overall good experience. Average rating 3.5 stars, but rounded up since I will most likely come back again.
author: Teresa Y.

description: Open until 2 AM, good Korean food on the westside of SF, and an interesting staff to top it off.  I like spicy food and this place cures the craving.  Kimchee rice is slammin!
author: Mike R.

description: Just recently celebrated NYE/NYD at this place. Pretty small. Reminds me of a villain's hideout spot in comics or something. Anyway their kimchi pancakes were delicious, and my friends and I had soju for every flavor. I wasn't buzzed at all, I just had to pee a lot. Bummer.
author: Jamie C.

description: I don't know why everyone like this place... but this place is overprice and their drink are like the drinks at The Spot. I just find this place a rip off, I mean i know korean food is expensive, but honestly I hate this place. My reason are simple, food taste horrible, it cost wayy to much, it just plain bad...
author: Will C.

description:
It's kinda like a Korean drinking place for Chinese fobs..........
I have no idea why. When I walked in I was like huh? Mmmmmmm..... Huh? mmmmmmm..... Huh?
Then I turned to my bf: "How come it's all Chinese fobs? Why don't Korean people eat here?"
It reminded me of the LA Korean drinking places w/the bomb ass chicken, except there's no bombass chicken, and no Korean people LOL. I have tried a few things on the menu, My favorite here is the kimchi fried rice, because they put an egg on top.
The don't have the usual dishes like soon tofu or yuk gae jang (my fav!). I tried something like the kimchi jige, it was ok. I have also tried the casserole stuff, it's kinda like a korean hot pot. It was decent. The prices are not that reasonable, it's a bit pricey. I have discovered many more Korean places in SF and would not really be craving to come back here. Now I just wanna go to the Korean drinking place in LA and order a combo of 1 fried cornish hen (hella good), 1/2 spicy sauce chicken, fries, salad, and a pitcher of beer for $30! And I might not be Korean, but I get my 'service' too haha.
author: Jenny W.

description: It's late at night & i'm craving some korean & this was the only place open late. Everything ordered was so-so. The spicy chicken wing was not spicy and no flavor. KFC hot wings were more bangin than these sad chicken wings. The korean pancake was ok but nothing to rave about. The $20 sea bass hot pot was the biggest disappointment. It tasted watered down and not rich at all. Service was also a disappointment, we had to push the button when we needed anything. Plus they don't give you any korean small plates like other restaurants An over $50 dinner I expect a lot more.
author: Erica B.

description: We had the cheese omelette, mandoo, and a squid/tofu stew that really reminded me of soondubu (even though the waitress told us they don't serve soondubu there). It was all really good, and I can see how this place would be popular--especially because each table can turn into its own mini-booth thanks to those drop-down partitions.
author: Gee W.

description: I've been hearing about this place for quite awhile now and I finally tried it last Saturday. We arrived around 7:30 p.m. and was expecting the wait to be long but we were seated immediately. We ordered the beef kimchee fried rice and the spicy calamari and tofu hotpot. Like many Korean restaurants, they gave us the typical side dishes like pickled radishes. The food looked amazing when it arrived at our table. I've never seen food in person that was so red in color. The beef kimchee fried rice was delicious! Just the right amount of beef, rice, and kimchee. I'm not a pro at chop sticks so it took me awhile to eat it but if I asked for a fork, it would have been gone in a minute. The hot pot was pretty spicy and had a fiery red color. Just from smelling it, I knew it was potent. We were seated by the door so the waitress pulled down these bamboo privacy blinds which I kind of liked. It shielded us from the wind and cold when the door opened. Overall I had a great eating experience and left the place stuffed. I will mos def come back and try their kimchee pancakes and strawberry soju.
author: Raebern B.

description: The pricing is pretty good here, bout $12 for fried rice. It was the best I've had in years. This was the first time I had soju, it was flavored , bout $9 a bottle and delicious. Overall my friends and I had a great time here.
author: Keit K.

description: Sweet nectar that is their soju! Mmm! Their kimchi jjigae are yummy as well. I feel its a bit over priced compared to other places (plus they don't give as many side dishes), but what do you expect? It IS a converted garage of someone's home...
author: Albert C.

description: Spicy chicken wings.  O man, it's like a Korean chef moved to Memphis then St. Louis and mashed up the fried chicken recipe into an Asian one.  The crisp is like a Sizzler type fry, but 1,000 times better.  This is a must try.  It's like KFC had a secret Korean cousin!  Colonel Kim!
author: Isaac L.

description:
Kimchi fried rice + seafood pancake = DELICIOUS **4 stars**
Spicy chicken wings = Meets the expectation
Calamari and beef bulgogi, seafood casserole = A-OK
Bulgogi kimchi tofu, seafood udon and other spicy dishes ..... = Meh 
They taste the same after a while, maybe because they use the same sauce?!
Soju = I only tried strawberry so far and I thought it tasted like medicine but my friends love it for some reason. I will try other flavors next time. 

This is a nice hang out spot with friends. The food is a bit pricey but if you go with a lot of people, I guess that evens out haha.
author: Cris C.

description: Yay! Toyose is amazing! This place is my favorite party dinner place in the city right now. I came here on my birthday with 5 people and we had such an awesome time! We ordered sooooooooooooooooooooo much food and it was all so great. The standouts were the bulgogi, potatoe pancakes, kimchi fried rice, and the soju! I absolutely love the nautical, garage, just about clausterphobic feel of this place. It made it so cozy and fun. The table behind us was screaming around 8 oclock and which set us into a competition and by 10pm the whole restaurant was practically screaming with laughter. Such good vibes here. And I just have to comment on how awesome the push buttons were for service. It took a lot of self control not to push the damn thing just for fun! Our server was also a great sport and was in good spirits and very helpful to all of our questions. Toyose thanks for such a great Birthday bash and I will be back soon since I live super close! Fun times ahead.
author: Kristen E.

description:
I'm foaming at the mouth just thinking about their fried chicken!!! Whenever my friends and I come here we order their fried chicken, kimchee fried rice, kimchee pancake, and their Spam casserole. The last time I went we also ordered their seafood pancake and  bulgogi. Nom nom nom!!! I have low tolerance for spicy food but what I love about them is though is despite the above dishes being spicy-- it's not the point where I will have heartburn later which to me is quite perfect! Their bulgogi is tender and juicy leaving  a sweet after taste in my mouth! I find it amusing that they serve popcorn as your "appetizer" which really goes well with OB beer they serve there. Besides their food what I love them for is the door bells mounted onto each table. Cracks me up every time.
FYI: My friends and I fondly call Toyose the "gargage" because another Yelper pointed out it literally is in a garage!!!  I've only known this place as the garage... a friend once said "Toyose" and I SMH wondering what this place was...
author: selina n.

description: Do you ever find yourself jonesing for a salad-dressing bottle full of soju mixed with Kern's nectar?  Well, this place might be for you.  It's... cute?  Reminiscent of a dingy sake bar with faux nautical decor, nutcrackers, stuffed mice, stains on the walls and ceiling "concealed" by ruffles and paper artwork.  One waitress covers the entire floor, but despite that, service is reasonably on point.  Aided to no small degree by a sophisticated paging system, which involves pushing an electronic bell that looks like a bar of soap.  Still, I like it.  It's open till 2 AM, serves munchies and smells divine.  Popcorn's not bad, either.
author: Ben R.

description:
Totally relaxed, laid back atmosphere where u really do feel tucked away. Great for a tete-a-tete. 

Yummy spicy chicken wings are a must have here!
author: stephanie a.

description: Love the blind for some privacy. I like the combination of drinking and eating. The Korean food is great! I love the Kim Chi fried rice although I don't usually eat spicy food. The soju is very special and easy to drink (a lot =P). The service...well, people who go there to drink usually just want to hang out, to take their time. They have a bell where you can press and the server will come shortly. I don't remember anyone walk by and check "how's the food...everything ok....?" Definitely a good place to talk and get drunk!
author: Kylie N.

description:
i came here yeeeeaarrs ago and remember thinking "i'm going to come back to this place." except i never did. i think all the cigarette smoke boxed in that small garage space is a definite cancer inducer and i was turned off by it. but i remember it being awesome because it's literally located in a garage and they had those buttons at the tables to signal a server to come to your table whenever you needed. 

i'll be back someday, Toyose! i promise!
author: Regina C.

description:
This Korean restaurant is a Garage, very cute and clean hole in the wall place.  We have passed this place many times and you would not know it's a restaurant.  The decor was nice inside considering it's a garage!  The food was delicious.  Being our first time, we went with the waitress recommendation:
1) Kimchee fried rice
2) Seafood pancake
3) Spicy Fried Chicken (not spicy enough)
Loved the Korean music that was playing during dinner.  We would definitely go back to this restaurant and try some of the other dishes.
author: Em D.

description:
My Big-Japo Ass gets so hot after the great spicy fried chicken, kimchee and the pizza lookin' thing and kimchee tofu soup, in my bathroom, next morning.
No more, No less, let me get out of here!

I have been thinking to come here because I was thinking that Toyose must be a dive bar for Hard Ass Old Korean Dudes like the Bada-Bing on the Soprano's.
It's all because I have heard Koreans are bad ass short temper. Haven't you heard about this?
We all like those stupid rumor and end up believing the crap because Korean Gangs are really bad asses in Japan.
Well, Japanese Gangs are so bad in Korea.
Chinese Gangs are always bad in both.
So,
I was thinking Toyose must be look like a......
when you open the garage door, walk in to the dark, smells like a dirty sock with old kimchee inside.
To the right, it should be a old long counter with a slant eyes old skinny skanky tall female bartender with the parmanent hair, pink tunk-top is smoking cigarette and said, " What you lookin' at? ass hole!", and dirty red carpet,
3~4 old Korean alcoholics eating kimchee and the fried chicken.
To the left, small size pool table and 2 small old dark brown wood round tables & chairs, smalls old cigarette.
........................
But,
But,
But,
It wasn't like that at all.
Small, cozy, homey, woody, country style ( Not the country style in US), warm, charming, down to earth feeling.
I liked the food.
Great Spicy Fried Chicken.
Great service.
I like to come back again.
I think I was in somewhere like Toyose before in Japan.
author: Nobu K.

description: It's a garage with very drab decor. Strange, but true. A very narrow place with tables and good flavored soju. They also have good food too. Their fried chicken is crunchy and hot, but not spicy hot. Their potato croquettes are equally yummy without that sauce they serve with it. I really like this place because you can just sit here and drink all the soju you can drink (for a price), that is whatever you can tolerate. I still don't understand the whole concept behind serving soju with popcorn, but whatever, this place is cool. My favorite soju is the peach flavor, pineapple is good too, but nothing compares to peach. Try it, you'll like it...and push the button.
author: Kimberly H.

description: i like the garage set-up. It throws you off a little at first but get used to the idea that you're in a garage, and oh yes, there is a button that you push at your table to get service, which is kinda cool. and unlike the bell sitting at a hotel lobby, you don't feel douchie for ringing this one. i've come here for a friend's birthday party before and it does not work! much better for groups up to 4. good food for late nights when other places close. i particularly like the noodles that come in their casseroles, the kimchi fried rice, and the seafood pancake. the ingredients are pretty fresh and the dishes come at just the right amount of spicyness. my korean friend says this place is way overpriced but who knows.
author: Justine C.

description: This place is amazing! When i first arrived i was a little bit skeptical because the restaurant is literally locate in someones garage, i thought the place was shut down. But inside the decor is SO cute, i doesn't even look like a garage and the who place smelled so good. All the food was amazing and cooked to perfection, they had one of the best chicken katsu and chicken wings recipe Ive even had and the pricing is moderate. this was also the first place Ive seen one of those "call buttons" it makes it easy for you to get service when you need it. some advice, arrive early, seating is limited due to size (i went there around midnight and the place was packed! we got the last seat) and because this place is open late, the noise level is like that of a bar, so come for a good time and good food. BEST THING: the hours, this place is open late! WORST THING: noise level, i had to yell in order to talk.
author: Eliza B.

description: Came here for a girls night out. We got there at 7:30pm. My friend had made reservations. I highly recommend calling for reservations as they get very busy and don't have many tables. It literally is a bar/restaurant in a garage. We had bugolgi, seafood pancake, kimchi fried rice, and assorted seafood tempura. We also had yogurt soju and aloe soju. My friend thought the soju a bit strong, I thought it was very delicious. The food was good too. We had a good time. We were amused by the buzzer at each table that would summon the waitress, but it was nice when we wanted popcorn refills. It was about $80 before tip, which was pretty good considering we were a group of 5. Filling and delicious food, and you can sit and chat for quite a while and drink.
author: Annie P.

description: when the mist rolls in..late at night..it's so hard to find this place...just look for a little yellow bird "winking" sign...yes wink wink..literally a garage...yes..a garage...man...i thought i've seen it all....but this place tops them all..as the most ghetto little soju drinking hole in the wall i have ever seen...and this is coming from a guy whose 2nd home is garden grove..so it's pretty ghetto.....but enter..and you'll be surprised....it actually is a restaurant inside..fairly decent compared to the outside...mainly to drink beers and soju....they have some dishes to soak up the alcohol....pretty grubbing good squid and bulgogi....good stews....and cocktail soju out of oil bottle...going to say...best soju and korean barfood in sf....
author: Hen A.

description: After we figured out that you need to press the call button to get attention, we had a really great time. Before that we only had a great time. Highly recommend getting the peach and yogurt soju and mixing them in the little glasses.
author: Lamb Shanks S.

description:
a place to eat while you drink.

the garage is way out in the noriega fog, but that means parking is ample.

don't be mistaken, this is a drinking spot that serves food. you can easily eat dinner here, but there's not going to be the tons of side dishes and korean bbq.

i love their wings.
author: Ameer N.

description: I literally live a block and a half away from this place and I always thought some illegal underground type thing was going on in here. Gang meet ups? Who knows? Until i read the yelp reviews. I came here with a group of friends to try the infamous kimchee fried rice and yes I will agree and say it was some bomb ass fried rice. My only complaint though is the price. Eleven dollars for some fried rice is ALOT. Their other dishes were mediocre. I will prolly come back to this place once in awhile cause i cannot afford to be dropping that kind of money for some fried rice. I wish I could make it on my own. i did leave an imprint of my name on the wall.  i know ...GHETTO.  you gotta love it
author: bella h.

description: the food her for sure ALL drinking food. most is greasy but made well with fairly fresh ingredients and done properly as well. my friend and i came here to catch up so we ordered a giant bottle of hite. to eat we got kimchi fried rice, seafood pancake and garlic cheese fries. the kimchi fried rice was QUITE good. the seafood pancake would've been better if there werent slices upon slices of fresh jalepenos in there. i like spicy but biting into the SEEDS damn near killed me. aside from that it was quite good. the cheese/garlic fries were ok. just make sure to eat it hot and before the cheese solidifies.overall i'd say not bad. the place can be hard to find as it is in a converted garage and the front door is actually one of the garage doors. kinda confusing.
author: edward k.

description: Dang their noodles is spicier than my mom's. I can't handle their level of spice but I'm still digging the food here. This place is really small so it's a good Korean spot if you have four people or less in your party. Spicy food + sweet soju = great meal.
author: Tessa T.

description: I love how this place looks like a garage from the outside.....but inside the atmosphere is great along with the food. Workers where friendly and got a table pretty quick.
author: Phil W.

description: Man I love korean food, especially asian fried chicken.  It's just so different from the american kind.  This place I heard was all over yelp, kinda far from the inner city but well worth it.  I felt like I was in the middle of nowhere and walking into a garage.  But this place has a superior assortment although I ordered two sets of fried chicken.   TEE HEEE.  Flavored soju is tasty too.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
I never got to taste the food. In fact, I never even got to go inside [except once].

My friend raved about this "underground, really far Sunset" place. I had no idea how far and underground she meant. When we got there and I looked at the front of the restaurant [which, everyone probably knows by now, is a house], I was like "....what? A house?" But I decided to give it a fair shot. We told them we were a party of 6 and they said it would be about a 45 minute wait and that they would call us when our table was ready. So we waited.
